Description:
Database Manager
Corporate Headquarters
12575 Uline Drive, Pleasant Prairie, WI 53158
It’s all about the data. You understand that data integrity and retrieval is essential to a seamlessly efficient and effective business. Bring your experience and expert-level enterprise skills to Uline and deliver custom solutions to big challenges for an industry leader.

Better together than apart. This position is on-site, and we are looking for good people who share our passion.

Uline is proud to operate as a drug-free workplace. All new hires must complete a pre-employment hair follicle drug screening.

Position Responsibilities
Manage the overall strategy and implementation of database technologies, best practices, support, architectures and data integration within Uline.
Manage the day-to-day operations of the database technologies residing on SQL Server, DB2/400, IBM DB2 LUW and Oracle databases.
Provide expertise and advice in database technologies, disciplines, cost reduction, cost containment, customer service and expedient delivery of services.

Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s degree.
8+ years database experience.
Direct experience managing multiple DB platforms.
Strong analytical skills.
Demonstrated ability to solve problems, determine appropriate actions and complete projects with little direction.
Ability to meet tight deadlines and thrive in a multi-project environment.
Available for travel to Uline locations across North America.

Benefits
Complete insurance coverage that includes medical, dental, vision and life insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts and wellness programs.
401(k) with 5% employer match.
Paid holidays and generous paid time off.
Bonus programs that include annual performance, sales goals and profit sharing.
Scholarship program for children of employees.

Employee Perks
On-site cafe with executive chefs and seasonal dinner-to-go options.
First-class fitness center with complimentary personal trainers.
Over four miles of beautifully maintained walking trails.
Numerous employee appreciation events throughout the year.
Professional development classes and monthly in-house speakers.

About Uline

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, industrial and packaging materials. We're a family-owned company known for incredible service, our 800+ page catalog of over 38,500 quality products and same-day shipping of our huge in-stock inventory. With over 7,000 employees across 12 locations, it's time you joined Uline.

Each resume submitted gets individually reviewed by our team and retained for 24 months in case a great opportunity opens for you to join our Uline family.

EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled
#LI-TE1
#CORP
(#IN-PPIT)
Our employees make the difference and we are committed to offering exceptional benefits and perks! Explore Uline.jobs to learn more!

Overview:
Who we are
Imagine working in a place where continuous improvement and innovation is celebrated and rewarded; where fast-paced, high-impact teams come together to positively drive results for one of the largest & most iconic brands in the world.
As the only rapidly growing retailer, you may know us as your friendly neighborhood store. You probably know our familiar name, have seen our pervasive logo, and have tried our highly sought-after products, such as Slurpee® and Big Bite®. “Brain Freeze” is a 7-Eleven registered trademark for our 53-year old Slurpee® and with over 71,100 stores globally (more than any other retailer or food service provider), we sell over 14 million a month.
But there’s a lot more to our story and much more left to be written. We are transforming our business, ensuring we are customer obsessed and digitally enabled to seamlessly link our brick and mortar stores with digital products and services.
At 7-Eleven the entrepreneurial spirit is in our DNA and has been ever since our inception 90+ years ago. It’s what drove us to invent the convenience industry in 1927 by envisioning how a simple ice dock could provide household staples such as milk and eggs to better serve the needs of our customers.
Today we are redefining convenience and the customer experience in big ways...we are fundamentally changing our culture and we want talented, innovative, customer obsessed, and entrepreneurial people like you to come make history with us.
How we lead
At 7-Eleven we are guided by our Leadership Principles.
Be Customer Obsessed
Be Courageous with Your Point of View
Challenge the Status Quo
Act Like an Entrepreneur
Have an “It Can Be Done” Attitude
Do the Right Thing
Be Accountable
Each principle has a defined set of behaviors which help guide the 7-Eleven team to Serve Customers and Support Stores.
About This Opportunity

Responsibilities:

7-Eleven is looking for an Manager, Data Engineering to join the Enterprise Data Team.
Do you believe technology is going to constantly simplify how consumers shop products and access services? Do you want to re-imagine convenience? Do you enjoy working on a personal technology project? Do you have the desire to learn and further your knowledge in open source and public cloud, if so this opportunity at the digital innovation labs at 7-11 is for you?
You’re joining a multidisciplinary team of product managers, marketers, designers and engineers who research and innovate on latest technology to create awesome digital products that hundreds of thousands of people experience every day.
You are responsible for technical guidance and leadership to innovation pods to produce cutting edge research and innovation around a digitally enabled experience for 7-11 customers and franchisees. The position requires working in a fast-paced environment which needs a mindset of a startup and an entrepreneur that is not hesitant to constantly shift gears, test and learn.
Expertise in adopting innovation at workplace
Demonstrate passion to stay up to date with tech, prototype with and learn new technologies, proactive in technology communities, and learn from peers in engineering community
Excellent leadership and communication
Have an entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to try new practices and spearhead adoption
Ability to attract, hire and retain great talent.
Deliver on time with a high bar on quality of research, innovation and engineeringAdditionally, the lead will provide a technical point of view on how to grow and improve our technology and products and work side-by-side with the Product Managers.
Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree OR military experience.
At least 7 years of experience in software engineering, platform engineering, middleware or database technology.
At least 3 years of technology leadership experience building customer facing products.
At least 3 years of Cloud centric micro-services application architecture experience.
Expertise with programming languages, patterns and best practices especially Python, SQL and DataOps.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master's in Information Technology OR Master's degree in Computer Science.
3+ years of experience managing medium to large size agile teams.
3+ years of experience with the AWS/Azure/Google Cloud eco-system, toolsets and deployment architecture.
3+ years of leading modern development approaches (containerization, cloud, continuous delivery, micro-services, modular reactive web applications).

SQL Server Database Administrator
Corporate Headquarters
12575 Uline Drive, Pleasant Prairie, WI 53158
Uncover your full potential in a collaborative environment where you'll design, develop and deliver custom solutions to big challenges.

Better together than apart. This position is on-site, and we are looking for good people who share our passion.

Position Responsibilities
Design and implement HA / DR solutions using AlwaysOn, WFC and Replication.
Work with highly advanced business users in a professional environment.
Design and develop ETL solutions such as SSIS and Informatica.
Optimize database performance using advanced techniques, including indexing, query optimization, database redesign and execution plan analysis.
Participate in periodic HA / DR tests and other activities during off-hours.
Monitor database performance and forecast resource utilization.
Provide support for mission-critical databases with heavy utilization of SQL Replication.
Upgrade and patch DBMS and related components, including drivers (DB2, Oracle) and third-party replication tools.
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's degree in information technology or related field.
5+ years of experience in database management / data integration.
Proficient in all aspects of administrating one or more database management systems (DB2 LUW, DataStax, Oracle, SQL Server).
Familiar with one or more replication technologies (Precisely Connect, SQL Replication, Attunity).
Ability to read logical / physical data models.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Benefits
Complete insurance coverage that includes medical, dental, vision and life insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts and wellness programs.
401(k) with 5% employer match.
Paid holidays and generous paid time off.
Bonus programs include annual performance, sales goals and profit sharing.
Employee Perks
On-site cafe with executive chefs and seasonal dinner-to-go options.
First-class fitness center with complimentary personal trainers.
Over four miles of beautifully maintained walking trails.

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, industrial and packaging materials. We're a family-owned company known for incredible service, quality products and same-day shipping of our huge in-stock inventory. With over 8,000 employees across 12 locations, it's time you joined Uline.
Uline is proud to operate as a drug-free workplace. All new hires must complete a pre-employment hair follicle drug screening.

Join the OBRC Corporate Team! The Oregon Beverage Recycling Cooperative has an opening for a Senior Database Administrator to provide technical leadership on company database systems and solutions. OBRC is the industry steward of Oregon’s nationally recognized beverage container deposit program. We help keep Oregon beautiful by providing outstanding services to our partner distributors and retailers, and to the public for the recovery, reuse, and recycling of beverage containers. This position will work in our beautiful new headquarters building located in Clackamas, OR. We offer competitive wages, great benefits, 401k with company match, and much more!
Summary
This position will collaborate with various departments to develop an understanding of data and information needs, identify solutions, and improve the quality of service while providing support through the logical and physical design of databases. The Sr. DBA is responsible for maintaining the integrity and performance of the company databases and guaranteeing the data is stored securely and efficiently. The Sr. DBA provides strategic guidance and implementation of the corporate data warehouse and the corresponding data feeds.
Primary Duties & Responsibilities
Install, design, and maintain database system software and implement database security.
Monitor and analyze database performance and ensure effective and efficient utilization of database systems/processes.
Participate in the development and maintenance of strategic, architectural, and tactical plans for the database and data warehouse environments; be conversant with, and cognizant of, the future direction of systems, how that direction impacts the company, and how future and current database systems can be exploited for the company’s benefit.
Provide technical leadership on database systems and solutions. Provide individual mentoring and training on databases and tools. Recommend, test, and evaluate new technologies, software tools, and required skill sets; recommend and implement improvements.
Implement a Business Continuity solution for the database environment, including the installation and configuration of database software and replication processes.
Set and maintain database standards.
Maintain database dictionaries and support tools; develop and maintain accurate system documentation.
Identify and analyze the logical database structure for the company’s current and future needs.
Create, develop, maintain, and control the corporate data directory, which will include names, descriptions, sources of data, and keywords needed for categorizing and searching data item descriptions.
Ensure integrity of database system by developing, documenting, and enforcing security procedures and access controls.
Compose and develop protocols for levels of access necessary to view, print, sort, enter, revise, or delete material.
Design, implement, and periodically test database backup and recovery procedures.
Analyze requirements for current and future database performance; recommend equipment changes when necessary.
Develops guideline for database training for data-entry staff, data analysts, and end users.
Collaborate with various departments to identify needs; refine system to maximize multipurpose uses.
Assist senior management with reporting necessary to monitor the business within various departments.
Manage direct report(s)/systems and work with operations team members to ensure the route operations and field service department systems are reviewed and approved daily/weekly for pick-ups and container processing. Reconcile these systems monthly in collaboration with the finance department.
Maintain the UPC database used in reverse vending machines for container redemption at BottleDrops and retailers.
Provide outside reports for distributors, retailers, and other third-parties, as needed.
Manage retailers and distributors on OBRC’s partner portal.
Train, coach and supervise direct reports to complete daily tasks, maintain company standards, and following company policies and procedures.
Complete other duties as assigned.
Education/Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology/Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience required
5+ years of SQL server database experience as Database Administrator (DBA), including experience installing, configuring, designing, patching, archiving, and monitoring to include performance tuning databases with indexing
Microsoft certifications (preferred)
Minimum 1-year supervisory experience
Requirements – Skills, Job Knowledge & Abilities
Experience utilizing various high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) options for MS SQL Server.
Experience with backup/recovery best practices.
Extensive experience with query tuning and troubleshooting.
Working knowledge of data encryption techniques and database querying and management tools.
Experience running and creating SQL Server health assessments reports/SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) report development/experience writing complex SQL Queries.
Data warehouse design using star-schema and/or snowflake methodologies.
Previous experience with Azure data technologies (Azure SQL, Data Bricks)
PowerShell and Power BI development. (preferred)
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite including Word, Excel, and Outlook
Ability to analyze systems, identify opportunities for improvement, develop improved policies or procedures, and work collaboratively to implement organizational change
Demonstrated ability to successfully prioritize and manage multiple projects, adhere to deadlines, handle frequent changes effectively and professionally, follow through on issues in a timely manner, and give excellent attention to detail with a high level of accuracy
Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate effectively at all levels with both internal and external partners
Supervisory Responsibility
This position has direct supervisory responsibility
Benefits
Medical, Dental, Vision, and Long Term Health Insurance
401(k) with company matching
Paid Time Off
Paid Holidays

Payment commensurate with proven performance and references.We are a "small business" with forty employees and lots of growth ahead. For those starting in their software management /build advancement careers, we will work with you. You must have demonstrated ability and experience with SQL, Access, and CRM. This is basically income and accounting software we would like to upgrade and build out to transition from QB or use in harmony with it.ResponsibilitiesStudy our current excellent databuildExamine its strengths for us, prioritize simplicity and add ons in your buildWrite well-designed, testable codeTroubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systemsDeploy programs and evaluate user feedbackSkillsProven work experienceExperience designing interactive applicationsEnglish communication and ability to work together in person or conveniently by Zoom (if we approve it)Residence in Phoenix AZ and authorized to work in the U.S.References from companies like usEducationMust have a certified college degree. MA preferred. Salary commensurate with education level and experience.Notes: You must sign a non-disclosure agreement. This may be a short term or a long term position, as we will hire you permanently if you do a great job and get along with our great people. Software will transform our company and we will invest to build and perfect it. Let's work together!'Job Types: Full-time, ContractBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offProfessional development assistanceReferral programRetirement planVision insuranceSupplemental Pay:Bonus payCOVID-19 considerations:We are advertising all regular benefits AND remote work if needed. However we need you to meet our company leaders and be able to work carefully with them and the others who handle our data.Work Location: One location

About WorldlineWorldline [Euronext: WLN] is the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry and #4 player worldwide. With its global reach and its commitment to innovation, Worldline is the technology partner of choice for merchants, banks and third-party acquirers as well as public transport operators, government agencies and industrial companies in all sectors. Powered by over 20,000 employees in more than 50 countries, Worldline provides its clients with sustainable, trusted and secure solutions across the payment value chain, fostering their business growth wherever they are. Services offered by Worldline in the areas of Merchant Services; Terminals, Solutions & Services; Financial Services and Mobility & e-Transactional Services include domestic and cross-border commercial acquiring, both in-store and online, highly-secure payment transaction processing, a broad portfolio of payment terminals as well as e-ticketing and digital services in the industrial environment. In 2019 Worldline generated a proforma revenue of 5.3 billion euros. worldline.comSummary: The Database Administration Manager is responsible for managing the Database Administration function and its employees as well as organizing and participating in configuration, troubleshooting, and maintenance of the company’s Production and Development environment databases. The holder of this role will be primarily responsible for prioritization, ownership, tracking, and resolution of all database-related incidents and requests to meet SLA requirements and development goals. The primary responsibilities are to ensure a stable and performant SQL service in support of our Software as a Service platform. Secondarily, serve as a subject matter expert in support of the development team, especially concerning (but not limited to) database structures, database performance, data security, and query optimization. Technical degrees in computer science, software engineering, or mathematics; working knowledge of modern software development practices such as agile methodologies and DevOps.
7+ years of Relational Database implementation, operations and/or solution deployment experience in a business-critical, high-availability context.
7+ years of experience leading customer-facing technical teams
3+ years of experience leading other leaders

Job summary
Are you a Database Specialist? Do you like to solve the most complex and large-scale database challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new database technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners use Cloud computing web services to build new solutions, faster, and at lower cost? Do you like to gain the deepest customer and partner insights using Cloud computing technologies?

Amazon aims to be the most customer centric company on earth. Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers critical applications for hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world.

At AWS, we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to collaborate with our customers and partners on migrating their Database and Analytics Solutions to the cloud. This role will specifically focus on Amazon Aurora.

You would be one of the founding members of a dynamic team bringing the latest in disruptive, cutting-edge cloud computing technologies to bear on the difficult cost and agility challenges facing many organizations. The business development and accounting management teams will help accelerate the adoption of AWS as the leading cloud technology platform.

The ideal candidate will …

Be great fun to work with. Our company credo is “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. As the right candidate, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge.

Enjoy working with customers and partners. You have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building cloud computing systems for some of the world’s largest and most important organizations.

This position must be located at one of our U.S. AWS Corp. offices with a preference for east coast locations including Boston and New York.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Key job responsibilities

Design Customer Solutions ­ Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre­sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use Amazon Aurora.
Devise Strategy ­ and Engage with Solution Architects, Account Managers Professional Services and Partners to define a Databse & Analytics Engagement strategy for AWS operational territories and key accounts.
Thought Leadership – Provide global thought leadership on Database solutions that benefit customers through the use of AWS Services. This takes the form of contribution to external publications such as the AWS Big Data Blog, Whitepapers and Reference architectures, as well as internal training of Solution Architects, Professional Services Consultants, Technical Account Managers, and AWS Trainers
Serve as a key member of the business development and account management team in helping to ensure customer success in building and migrating applications, software and services on the AWS platform.
Drive the AWS platform by aligning customer requirements with AWS service teams’ roadmaps by prioritizing customer requests.
In partnership with the sales teams and service teams formulate and execute a sales strategy to exceed revenue objectives
Hire, on-board, train, and develop new Solutions Architects.
Coach Solutions Architects in the skills needed to conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions so they can transfer deep technical skills to customers who are considering or using AWS
Operational – Website/web services as well as traditional IT networking, operations, management, and security experience.
Knowledge of the underlying infrastructure requirements such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization.
Implementation and tuning experience of Databases including knowledge of Schema Design, Query Tuning and Optimization, and Data Migration and Integration.
Analytics presentation layer expertise including Dashboards, Reporting, and OLAP.
Possession of both technical and customer-facing skills enabling perception as a "trusted advisor" to customers. He or she will be able to facilitate relationships with senior technical executives, as well as easily interact and give guidance to software developers, IT operations staff, and system architects. The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges.
Hands on experience as a database administrator, data warehouse architect or big data developer.
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations and virtual teams.
Executive speaking and presentation skills – Formal presentations, white boarding, large and small group presentations.
Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of business environments such as large enterprises and start-ups
Understanding of application, server, and network security is highly desired
AWS Certifications, e.g., AWS Solutions Architect Associate/Professional
The base pay range for this position in Colorado is $122,300 – $160,000/yr. however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon's internal or external careers site.

Proven track record in building inclusive organizations and working across teams to achieve common goals.

In this role, you need to be technically capable and credible in your own right, as well as useful in shaping the customer and solutions-focused skills of your team. Furthermore, establishing thought leadership by looking beyond the technology, considering the value technology creates for our customers, and helping to change technology perspectives is an essential aspect of the role. You will help team members ramp-up on AWS as well as develop speaking, writing, presentation, and executive interaction skills. You need to be adept at interacting, communicating and partnering with internal teams within AWS such as our service and engineering teams, business development, marketing, and professional services, as well as representing your team to executive management.

You will also enjoy developing technical talent to achieve great things. You have a passion for educating, training and enabling relational database experts for a diverse and challenging set of commercial customers. Have a strong understanding of commercial and open source based relational databases. The ideal candidate has prior experience leading a team of solution architects or consultants. You enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones so that you can make substantial contributions to in-depth architecture discussions.

Capture, share and scale best-practice knowledge amongst customers, and the AWS solutions architect community
Build deep relationships with decision makers within customer accounts to enable them to be "Cloud advocates."
Act as a conduit and liaison between customers and service engineering teams and shape service offerings.
Academic background Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent professional experience
Experience communicating and working with Developers, IT, Chief Data/Technology/Product Officers to articulate database strategies and plans.
Experience of data migration techniques and process planning including transaction processing, security, logging and monitoring.
Experience of advanced deployment architectures such as availability, resiliency and fault tolerance.
Deep understanding of AWS services related to databases highly desirable, particularly Amazon RDS, Amazon Aurora
Demonstrated effectiveness working across multiple business units to achieve results
Experience managing technical teams

Join the OBRC Corporate Team! The Oregon Beverage Recycling Cooperative has an opening for a Senior Database Administrator to provide technical leadership on company database systems and solutions. OBRC is the industry steward of Oregon’s nationally recognized beverage container deposit program. We help keep Oregon beautiful by providing outstanding services to our partner distributors and retailers, and to the public for the recovery, reuse, and recycling of beverage containers. This position will work in our beautiful new headquarters building located in Clackamas, OR. We offer competitive wages, great benefits, 401k with company match, and much more!
Summary
This position will collaborate with various departments to develop an understanding of data and information needs, identify solutions, and improve the quality of service while providing support through the logical and physical design of databases. The Sr. DBA is responsible for maintaining the integrity and performance of the company databases and guaranteeing the data is stored securely and efficiently. The Sr. DBA provides strategic guidance and implementation of the corporate data warehouse and the corresponding data feeds.
Primary Duties & Responsibilities
Install, design, and maintain database system software and implement database security.
Monitor and analyze database performance and ensure effective and efficient utilization of database systems/processes.
Participate in the development and maintenance of strategic, architectural, and tactical plans for the database and data warehouse environments; be conversant with, and cognizant of, the future direction of systems, how that direction impacts the company, and how future and current database systems can be exploited for the company’s benefit.
Provide technical leadership on database systems and solutions. Provide individual mentoring and training on databases and tools. Recommend, test, and evaluate new technologies, software tools, and required skill sets; recommend and implement improvements.
Implement a Business Continuity solution for the database environment, including the installation and configuration of database software and replication processes.
Set and maintain database standards.
Maintain database dictionaries and support tools; develop and maintain accurate system documentation.
Identify and analyze the logical database structure for the company’s current and future needs.
Create, develop, maintain, and control the corporate data directory, which will include names, descriptions, sources of data, and keywords needed for categorizing and searching data item descriptions.
Ensure integrity of database system by developing, documenting, and enforcing security procedures and access controls.
Compose and develop protocols for levels of access necessary to view, print, sort, enter, revise, or delete material.
Design, implement, and periodically test database backup and recovery procedures.
Analyze requirements for current and future database performance; recommend equipment changes when necessary.
Develops guideline for database training for data-entry staff, data analysts, and end users.
Collaborate with various departments to identify needs; refine system to maximize multipurpose uses.
Assist senior management with reporting necessary to monitor the business within various departments.
Manage direct report(s)/systems and work with operations team members to ensure the route operations and field service department systems are reviewed and approved daily/weekly for pick-ups and container processing. Reconcile these systems monthly in collaboration with the finance department.
Maintain the UPC database used in reverse vending machines for container redemption at BottleDrops and retailers.
Provide outside reports for distributors, retailers, and other third-parties, as needed.
Manage retailers and distributors on OBRC’s partner portal.
Train, coach and supervise direct reports to complete daily tasks, maintain company standards, and following company policies and procedures.
Complete other duties as assigned.
Education/Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology/Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience required
5+ years of SQL server database experience as Database Administrator (DBA), including experience installing, configuring, designing, patching, archiving, and monitoring to include performance tuning databases with indexing
Microsoft certifications (preferred)
Minimum 1-year supervisory experience
Requirements – Skills, Job Knowledge & Abilities
Experience utilizing various high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) options for MS SQL Server.
Experience with backup/recovery best practices.
Extensive experience with query tuning and troubleshooting.
Working knowledge of data encryption techniques and database querying and management tools.
Experience running and creating SQL Server health assessments reports/SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) report development/experience writing complex SQL Queries.
Data warehouse design using star-schema and/or snowflake methodologies.
Previous experience with Azure data technologies (Azure SQL, Data Bricks)
PowerShell and Power BI development. (preferred)
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite including Word, Excel, and Outlook
Ability to analyze systems, identify opportunities for improvement, develop improved policies or procedures, and work collaboratively to implement organizational change
Demonstrated ability to successfully prioritize and manage multiple projects, adhere to deadlines, handle frequent changes effectively and professionally, follow through on issues in a timely manner, and give excellent attention to detail with a high level of accuracy
Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate effectively at all levels with both internal and external partners
Supervisory Responsibility
This position has direct supervisory responsibility
Benefits
Medical, Dental, Vision, and Long Term Health Insurance
401(k) with company matching
Paid Time Off
Paid Holidays

Responsibilities
Under the direction of the Senior Manager for Systems Operations and Cloud Operations, the Enterprise Cloud Database Manager will be responsible for overseeing operations for some of our most critical system database platforms. The platforms include: Cache, Oracle, SQL and DB2. In this role, you will provide technical guidance and support for our database teams, innovative solutions for how we can possibly optimize or consolidate our database standards as well as provide guidance on how we can take advantage of database cloud offerings from various cloud platforms. Because you will be well-versed in these database solutions and have an extended intimate knowledge of supporting large Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) in an enterprise setting, you will deploy, maintain, and oversee large RDBMs databases in a cloud setting.
Qualifications
4+ years of in-depth experience in the design, administration, programming, and support of RDBMSs/MDDBMSs (e.g., Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle,DB2) in one or more computing environments (e.g., Windows, Unix)
4+ years of in-depth experience in the design, administration, programming, and support of Cache for Epic
4+ years of experience as a DBA in one or more environments is highly desirable (preferably with RDBMSs) or strong, demonstrated DBA skills earned in equivalent experience
Thorough understanding of the relational database model and solid theoretical knowledge of relational database techniques
Experience in designing, modeling, developing, and supporting large RDBMSs
Extensive experience in logical and physical database design, hands-on data modeling techniques, and development methodology; physical schema design of table spaces, rollback segments, and data files
Experience assessing data storage and access needs, creating and maintaining databases, and upgrading database systems and software
Experience developing emergency data storage and retrieval plans
Experience managing data backup operations
Excellent oral and written communications skills
Experience with Power BI is recommended but not required
2+ years of experience managing a large team supporting critical EMR and related Databases
Must have a working knowledge of database languages, such as MySQL
Well-versed in different types of security programs
Knowledge of project management processes to oversee database development and operations

Job Title: Brand Manager, Therapeutic Nutrition CRM and Database - Colu...
Description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.
About Abbott
Our nutrition business develops science-based nutrition products for people of all ages, from helping babies and children grow, to keeping adult bodies strong and active. Millions of people around the world count on our leading brands – including Similac®, PediaSure®, Pedialyte®, Ensure®, Glucerna® and ZonePerfect® – to help get the nutrients they need to live their healthiest life.
Our location in Columbus, OH, currently has an opportunity for a Brand Manager, Therapeutic Nutrition CRM and Database. This role is responsible for driving the strategy and execution of the Ensure & Glucerna HCP and Consumer CRM programs by providing advanced analytics and plans across all aspects of the programs to achieve program objectives for acquisition, initiation, retention, and profitability by identifying, designing, and implementing advanced analytical projects. Responsible for strategy and management of Salesforce.com database that supports CRM programs and tracking of HCP salesforce activity and engagement. Specific responsibilities include management of data integrity and governance policies, data visualization and automation and integration/collaboration with HCP FSF and broader Data Analytics team.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Support development of CRM strategy and implementation for Ensure and Glucerna brands
Collaborate with Brand Managers and key cross functional teams to identify and evaluate opportunities to utilize overall Brand strategy and data analytics to maximize program success.
Responsible for advanced analytic data techniques, modeling, and business analysis to understand the business and recommend actions for improvements.
Design test and learn projects to ensure they meet statistical standards of size and readability. Assist operations team in implementing design into production.
Analyze the impact of all changes to the program; deliver results in appropriate format focusing on impact versus success metrics, implications to business, and next steps.
Lead program optimizations to drive business growth within the Brands CRM programs.
Forecast CRM production volumes and KPIs monthly. Adjust forecasts based on variance to actuals. Communicate changes in forecast that deviate from established plans with root cause of change and implications.
Ongoing expansion and oversight of program data structure as needed.
Develop and gain alignment on best visualization content that is in line with industry best practices and ease of user adoption to convey the story inside the data
Communicate analysis and findings clearly to senior leaders and key stakeholders
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE YOU’LL BRING
Required
BS/BA in Marketing, Data Science, Business Analytics, Math, Statistics, or related field
5 to 10 years’ experience in marketing analytics, marketing strategy, data mining, feature creation, decision sciences or other analytics
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, and the ability to communicate technical analysis and findings clearly to senior leaders and non-technical audiences
Excellent business acumen skills including ability to translate analytic findings into business strategies that make sense for the business model
Preferred
MS degree in Marketing, Data Science, Business Analytics, or related field
Experience with large scale CRM programs
Experience with large scale relational databases and other complex platforms
WHAT WE OFFER
At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer:
A fast-paced work environment where your safety is our priority (Include for Manufacturing roles only)
Production areas that are clean, well-lit and temperature-controlled (Include for Manufacturing roles only)
Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance
Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans
Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs
Paid time off
401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match
The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities
Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully: www.abbottbenefits.com
Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.
Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

Job Summary:
The Sr. DBA position works on a central team of Database Systems Engineers and Administrators supporting DBMS for Disney Connected, Advanced Technologies and corporate development teams and customers. Primary focus of this position will be Database support and service of operational and business processes for internet sites and corporate applications for The Walt Disney Company. Key responsibilities include DB technology evaluation, guidance and consultation, design support, task automation and scripting, best practice and standards development, capacity planning, optimization and tuning, system upgrades and migrations, performance management, monitoring, security, backup and recovery, issue troubleshooting, and documentation. Additional tasks as assigned.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for level 1 systems management and exercises project-level control over initiatives. Excellent technical expertise in relevant state of the art database technologies, stores, systems, and design. Carries out assignments with minimal coaching and guidance from others. Develops, enhances and adheres to engineering and administration standards. Upholds and maintains strong documentation.

The ideal candidate will have experience with Pubic Cloud providers like AWS and Azure and 4-6 years experience with DB2. Oracle and/or SQL Server experience is a plus.

Basic Qualifications:
4-6 years experience with DB2 is strongly preferred. Oracle and/or SQL Server experience, or similar relational database systems, is a plus.
4-6 years’ experience with Linux Server platforms and/or Windows Server
4-6 years’ experience with relevant scripting languages or programming frameworks desired (NodeJS, JavaScript, Python, Perl, C, windows script; PowerShell, sh, korne, bash)
Expertise in relational database administration including configuration, implementation, data modeling, maintenance, redundancy/HA/DR, security, troubleshooting/performance tuning, upgrades, database, data and server migrations, SQL
2 or more years of IT operational experience supporting robust e-commerce, gaming or online businesses in a 24X7 production environment (on call)
Thorough understanding in Security implementations (IAM, SSL, encryption, firewall, wall garden) on Database, storage, network and Cloud environments. Participated in auditing exercise
Knowledge in 1 or more Cloud Platforms including but not limited to: AWS, Azure, GCP, Oracle Cloud and hybrid cloud environments
Knowledge in Monitoring, Alerting tools such as Datadog, Cloudwatch, OEM, Quest
Expertise in configuring, implementing and supporting high availability redundancy strategies on systems including replication, clustering, log shipping, mirroring
Expertise in database design and architectural principles and methodologies
Expertise with Disaster Recovery planning and implementation
Experience with Linux system administration, configuration, troubleshooting, performance tuning, and security procedures; experience with Windows desired
Excellent knowledge of hardware, storage, RAID, and disk subsystems technologies as they pertain to DBMS systems, experience with SAN technologies highly desired
Excellent systems documentation and system diagraming skills
Experience with project management methodologies and handling complex projects
Ability to partner with relevant software vendors to determine near-term, long-term business impacts of product updates on our technology portfolio
Demonstrated experience with troubleshooting systems issues and effectively diagnosing problems
Knowledge of understanding of TCP/IP fundamentals (DNS, SSH), general networking technologies, AWS networking (VPC, security group), network architecture and connectivity troubleshooting
Preferred Qualifications:
Leads and completes tasks independently, with attention to detail and while under pressure
Excellent judgment, problem resolution, negotiation, and decision-making skills as well as the ability to work under continual deadline pressure
Identifies, analyzes, and drives problems to resolution, handling complex issues simultaneously while effectively communicating across teams
Builds team relationships across the organization
Effectively communicates technical actions and expectations to the appropriate audience
Delivers customer service excellence by knowing customer’s business needs, identifying appropriate technical solutions, and meeting/exceeding service expectations

Preferred Education

About WorldlineWorldline [Euronext: WLN] is the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry and #4 player worldwide. With its global reach and its commitment to innovation, Worldline is the technology partner of choice for merchants, banks and third-party acquirers as well as public transport operators, government agencies and industrial companies in all sectors. Powered by over 20,000 employees in more than 50 countries, Worldline provides its clients with sustainable, trusted and secure solutions across the payment value chain, fostering their business growth wherever they are. Services offered by Worldline in the areas of Merchant Services; Terminals, Solutions & Services; Financial Services and Mobility & e-Transactional Services include domestic and cross-border commercial acquiring, both in-store and online, highly-secure payment transaction processing, a broad portfolio of payment terminals as well as e-ticketing and digital services in the industrial environment. In 2019 Worldline generated a proforma revenue of 5.3 billion euros. worldline.comSummary: The Database Administration Manager is responsible for managing the Database Administration function and its employees as well as organizing and participating in configuration, troubleshooting, and maintenance of the company’s Production and Development environment databases. Immuta is the universal cloud data access control platform, enabling data teams to automate data access control on any cloud, using any data platform, at scale. With Immuta, organizations can finally unlock the full value of their data – even the most sensitive data – while improving productivity, reducing time to data, maintaining strong security, and enabling new data sharing use cases.
Since our founding in 2015, Immuta has now become the leader in cloud data access control. That comes by applying our expertise in engineering, security, ethics, and law. But, more importantly, it requires a relentless focus on our customers’ needs. Immuta’s customers understand that data is the most critical asset for innovation. Secure, democratized, self-service access to cloud-based data is an imperative to accelerate business intelligence, data science, and data sharing outcomes.
 Immuta has been recognized by Forbes as a top American startup employer, by Inc. Magazine as one of the best workplaces, and by Fast Company as one of the top 50 most innovative companies Customers include Aon, Credit Suisse, Daimler, S&P Global, U.S. Army, and Atlassian. Over half of the top banks now use ImmutaPartners include Databricks, Snowflake, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and Starburst$169 million in total venture capital funding. Investors include Greenspring Associates, March Capital, Ten Eleven Ventures, Intel Capital Corporation, NGP Capital, DFJ Growth, Dell Technologies Capital, Citi Ventures, Inc, Wipro Ventures, and Okta VenturesMajor offices in Boston, Massachusetts; Columbus, Ohio; and, College Park, Maryland
TAKE YOUR IMPACT TO THE NEXT LEVEL:
We are looking for an Engineering Manager to lead the product engineering squad responsible for building many of our integrations with various cloud databases. We want you to help us continue to bring the best in security and privacy to our customers. As an engineering manager at Immuta, you will be responsible for recruiting, coaching, and leading a team of bright, mission-focused engineers, while still writing quality code.
YOU'RE THE BEST PERSON FOR THIS ROLE IF YOU ENJOY:
Building and running a top-notch engineering team. You have recruited, coached, and led junior and senior engineers. You empathize and actively listen first, fostering a warm, inclusive, “humble-intellect” culture.
Data. You love databases and want to stay current on all the new features available in various cloud databases.
Programming. Our engineering managers are technical. We’re looking for candidates that still want to spend at least some of their time hands on writing code.
A company that really cares about their employees. Immuta invests significantly in you and your well-being with 100% employer-paid health, dental, and vision, mental health, Unlimited PTO, and more.
YOU'LL BE A GREAT ADDITION TO THE TEAM IF YOU HAVE:
Experience leading a software engineering team or a senior engineer looking for that next career challengeProven track record of delivering performant, scalable products in a continuous delivery environmentExperience with a modern technology stack (our stack: Node.js, Typescript/Javascript/SQL/ODBC/C, Docker/Kubernetes, numerous SQL databases)Strong technical background that allows you to advocate for and support your engineersStrong desire to understand the details of systems, get hands-on with data analysis and root cause analysisAbility to hold yourself, and direct reports accountable for resultsAbility to maintain high standards for hiring employees, culture, and quality
Benefits
At Immuta, our goal is to help bridge the gap between personal and professional growth, so that our team members can be well and thrive personally and professionally. After all, great professional success stories rarely happen without great personal success stories! Our generous benefits package includes:
100% employer paid Healthcare (Medical, Dental, Vision) premiums and deductibles for you and your dependents (including Domestic Partners)100% employer paid mental wellness platform for you and your dependentsStock OptionsWellness perks (100% employer paid Whoop fitness band and subscription)Paid parental leave (Both Maternity and Paternity)Unlimited Paid time offLearning and Development Resources

Job summary

Would you like to build and lead a Specialized Sales team focused on accelerating adoption of AWS Database Services? Do you have the business savvy, technical background, and sales leadership skills necessary to help position Amazon as the cloud provider of choice for these workloads? AWS is seeking a seasoned Specialized Sales Manager to help us maintain our leadership position as the preferred cloud platform for database. The role has a specific focus on AWS services such as Amazon Aurora, Amazon RDS, Amazon Document DB, and Amazon ElasticCache Service just to name a few of our database services. The Specialized Sales Team is critical to driving deeper workload specialization in alignment with our Account Managers with a goal to build a unified and cohesive community of delighted database customers powering their business with AWS.

The leader of this team will be in charge of hiring and developing a Specialized Sales Team within our Strategic Industries organization. They will be an integral part of the leadership team and a key member of the worldwide database organization. The ideal candidate will have experience with cloud-related activities such as data center migrations, database management systems, infrastructure optimization/modernization and earning customer trust by helping to create a long-term strategy with the customer as part of their AWS partnership. They will be a self-starter, and be willing to operate both tactically and strategically. As a key team member in this fast growing, exciting space, this leader will have the opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of a service category with significant impact on our customers’ business.

Key job responsibilities
Responsibilities include building and managing a sales team focused on driving revenue, adoption, and market penetration in a large territory. The ideal candidate will possess a sales background with a strong track record of performance and customer obsession to lead a team of remote senior Specialized Sellers with engagements at the CxO level, manage a regional sales pipeline and lead sales efforts. They will engage with our internal sales, solutions architects, partners, and professional services organizations to drive large and highly complex opportunities to closure. They will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product and technical challenges with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions while working cross-organizationally to build consensus.

A day in the life
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

About the team
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.


3+ Years Selling Managed Cloud Services
Experience Selling to multi-national companies

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Role Summary
This role is responsible for balancing strategic priorities while ensuring tactical execution for Database Platforms for Alaska Airgroup. As a people leader, the Senior Manager, Database Platforms leads and establishes priorities for the team to provide stable, secure and performant database platforms for both on-prem and cloud resources.
Key Duties
Leads a highly technical team responsible for ensuring the integrity, availability and security of multiple database, middleware and cloud infrastructure disciplines, requiring specialized infrastructure administration support.
Ensures database platforms meet/exceed critical systems disaster recovery objectives.
Collaborates and influences other IT teams to improve systems support, monitoring, and administration.
Ensures robust capacity planning and life cycle management processes are developed and executed by the team.
Lead and/or influence cross divisional enterprise infrastructure projects related to database platforms
Define the long-term strategy for database platforms and their implementation.
Manages vendor relationships, ensuring highest quality and reasonable costs.
Writes business cases to gain Senior leadership support
Develops people through effective performance management and ongoing feedback, focusing on delegation for stretch assignments, growing and developing the team for capacity and growth, looking at performance across the team, and time management.

Required

Company Name: Goodwill of the Olympics and Rainier Region
Description:
When you love what you do, it’s more than a job. It’s a passion, and a Mission.
We are sure that you’ve seen our stores, but have you ever considered the employment opportunities found at Goodwill in our Social and Shared Services? It takes a dynamic team of IT, Safety, Facilities Management, Human Resources, Loss Prevention, Accounting, and Marketing professionals to support the infrastructure of our organization.
Right now, our People Team is adding an Online Giving and Database Manager This role will be based out of Tacoma, WA.
Salary: $70,000 Annually
Job Summary:
The Online Giving and Database Manager is responsible for a variety of projects related to online giving, membership, annual fund, major gifts, special events, and planned giving. The ideal candidate is an expert analytical researcher and has significant experience (5-10 years) with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software, and is very comfortable with analyzing data, creating reports and communicating results.
Principal Functions/Responsibilities:
Acts as primary gift processor.
Generates all acknowledgements and receipts.
Generates pledge reminders.
Utilizes Blackbaud as the primary database to track and retain donor information and to create reports, including donor reports and campaign reports.
Uses Blackbaud to provide analytics that can be used by staff to help reach fundraising goals.
Works collaboratively with the Fundraising & Marketing team to coordinate events and giving-related activity.
Responsible for the implementation of online giving strategies.
Coordinates tracking and processing of financial and in-kind donations and prepares appropriate and timely donor acknowledgements.
Provides assistance for annual fund, special events, and grant solicitations, including preparation, tracking and reporting.
Manages and maintains donor electronic and paper records.
Works in partnership with Accounting Department to ensure all reports are consolidated properly.
Provides all necessary training and materials needed by the staff to utilize Blackbaud effectively and efficiently.
Responsible for research of both current and potential supporters.
Works with Chief Advancement Officer to manage revenues and expenses on behalf of the Foundation staff.

Education and/or Experience: Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited 4-year college or university; 5-10 years of complimentary/relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Language Skills: Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and client communications effectively and clearly. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from donors, clients, customers (internal and external), and the general public with diplomacy, discretion and customer-service orientation. Strong attention to detail and accuracy, the ability to prioritize and organize multiple projects, meet deadlines, problem-solve, and multi-task. Ability to thrive and work effectively as part of a small team in a fast-paced and rapidly growing program, with limited instruction.
Computer Skills: Strong knowledge and capabilities in Microsoft Office Suite products as well as experience and expertise in database management and knowledge of Blackbaud. Able to manage processes. Social media and use of web-based products.
At Goodwill we are committed to creating and sustaining a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion. We embrace our employees’ differences, and believe in meeting the members of our workforce and their communities where they are. Since our doors first opened in 1921, we have been changing lives by offering a hand up, not a hand out. We invite you to join us for our next 100 years of service to our neighbors.
Our Mission is to help people reach their fullest potential through individual education, job placement and career pathway services made possible by community donations, purchases and partnerships.
At Goodwill, we welcome people with diverse backgrounds, including persons with disabilities or other disadvantages. In fact, a substantial portion of our employees have a disability and/or economic disadvantage and we strongly encourage such persons to apply.

About The Position
Manager, Application Database Services is responsible for the leadership & execution of the Application Database Services team for Digital Technology (DT) and Utility Operations Technology (UOT). Primary responsibilities include oversight of database performance and tuning efforts in support of various application teams. Technologies such as Sybase, MS SQL, Oracle, and AWS database platforms. Additional responsibilities include planning for database technologies and lifecycle, developing standards for application teams and maintaining security and currency of those environments. The Manager will collaborate with leaders across Digital and Ameren to ensure DT/UOT operations are continuously improving, optimized, evolving from reactive to proactive, leveraging automation to create efficiencies, and executing on strategic goals/objectives.
Key responsibilities include:
Inspire and drive continuous improvements and operational excellence capabilities across Development teams and Operations
Drive standardization, automation, process improvement and enhancements to deliver maximum value, quality and efficiencies to support business needs
Must be able to present to different audiences and adjust accordingly (business, technical and management) either structured presentations or ad-hoc.
Must be able to establish and maintain business relationships with individual contributors as well as management.
Evaluate programs, policies and procedures. Identify issues and develop alternative solutions which may include changes to programs, policies and procedures for area of responsibility.
Develop, analyze, and refine KPI’s & metrics based on organizational, department, and business unit goals.
Use metrics based performance goals to direct and manage team success
Review and analyze trends to advise and develop recommendation to achieve and modify operational excellence goals and effectively report the health of Digital Operations through metrics.
Understand business priorities, rationalizes demand and communicate priorities to ensure teams are working on the highest value activities
Drive and influence operational excellence and continuous improvements across teams.
Lead proactive problem-solving efforts on core DTO services and key projects to improve quality, reduce cost and eliminate waste.
Lead performance and tuning efforts for applications interfaces with various database technologies
Establish enterprise standards and best practices for applications developers interfaces with various databases technologies
Collaborate and engage with development team to forecast new workstreams and resource requirements
Understand the platform lifecycle and ensure that application teams are aware and planning to keep systems updated on supported versions of the database platforms
Identify opportunities to automate and migrate monitoring and first level response activities to the command center. Transfer knowledge and develop scripts so that off shift resources can provide support and escalate to DBA team as appropriate. Transfer knowledge to the command center to drive positive first contact resolution.
Collaborate with automation team to find opportunities to automate build and deployment processes as well as self-healing processes and procedures that leverage existing automation scripts and tools to enable efficient 24/7/365 operational excellence
Work with cloud, platform, and architecture teams to understand the trend in database technology adoption and help drive the standards that will be used to drive platform skills investments.
Assess training needs and develop associated training plans and programs for teams around necessary skillsets
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Management Information System, Business Administration, or equivalent computer related degree from an accredited college or university required. Master’s degree preferred.
Five or more years of related IT experience required with extensive background in one or more of the following IT disciplines: Operations, Infrastructure, Security, Service Management, Project Management
Three or more years of supervisory and high-level team/project leadership required. Strong management and effective leadership experience.
Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities; a strategic thinker.
Exceptional ability to lead change and drive operational excellence, removes barriers, acts with a sense of urgency, and leads by example.
Proven track record of delivering complex IT services in a diverse environment.
Superior written and verbal communication skills
Experience with ServiceNow and other IT management tools
In addition to the above qualifications, the successful candidate will demonstrate:
Ability to lead and influence broad, multi-site, cross-functional teams.
Proven effective management and leadership skills in a flexible, creative and team-oriented performance driven environment.
Ability to facilitate relations between business groups and technology departments.
Strong facilitation skills as well as the ability to work with team members, providing assistance and guidance as needed.
Must be able to communicate effectively both with technical personnel and senior leaders.
Additional Information
Ameren’s selection process includes a series of interviews and may include a leadership assessment process. Specific details will be provided to qualified candidates.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, genetic information, military service or status, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other class, trait, or status protected by law.

WHAT IS BOX?
Box is the market leader for Cloud Content Management. Our mission is to power how the world works together. Box is partnering with enterprise organizations to accelerate their digital transformation by creating a single platform for secure content management, collaboration and workflow. We have an amazing opportunity to further establish ourselves as leaders in the space, and we need strong advocates to help us achieve that goal.

By joining Box, you will have the unique opportunity to help capture a majority of this developing market and define what content management looks like for the digital enterprise. Today, Box powers over 100,000 businesses, including 67% of the Fortune 500 who trust Box to manage their content in the cloud.

WHY BOX NEEDS YOU
We are looking for someone to focus on developing robust software to automate routine tasks, infrastructure management, and propagation of database changes to hundreds of MySQL instances in a Linux environment. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and testing mission critical software in collaboration with engineers across various teams to provide enterprise grade capabilities for Box's data infrastructure.

That Database Operations group is a close-knit and diverse team that regularly pushes the boundaries of our data infrastructure and continually drives improvements to the resiliency of Box's database platforms. As a Database Engineer, we expect you to bring new and innovative solutions for classic infrastructure challenges, partner closely with your fellow database engineers, and improve our overall database management capabilities!

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Develop software and tools to automate and improve routine infrastructure management changes
Improve performance of database infrastructure and infrastructure management tools through configuration tuning, query optimization, and software optimizations
Leverage existing industry and internal tools to manage, debug, and scale MySQL database infrastructure
Troubleshoot complex issues in a sharded database environment and dive into MySQL and Linux internals
Work as part of a multi-functional engineering team and enable yourself and others to build new features and software to grow our business
GCP Cloud Knowledge (ADD)

WHO YOU ARE
3+ years of professional software development and production operations experience
Experience designing, building, and deploying high quality software with test frameworks and CI/CD
You have automated routine work with software written in Python, Java, Go, and more
You are excited to troubleshoot issues spanning hundreds of databases and want to dive into the internals of MySQL and Linux to resolve complex problems
You've worked in cross-functional engineering teams and have an eye for enabling others' success in building new features and software to grow our business
Any Public Cloud Exp (GCP prefer)

Job Title: Sr. Program Manager, Tech - Database and Analytics
Description:
Bachelor’s Degree or relevant experience
5+ years of Product Management, Technical Marketing, Pre-Sales or Solutions Architect experience in the tech industry
5+ years of experience working with Cloud Service Providers or companies providing hybrid cloud offerings across product, marketing, and support teams

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking an experienced, self-motivated Technical Lead on the Analyst Relations team to support top vendor evaluations (e.g. Gartner Magic Quadrant, Forrester Wave, IDC MarketScape). This person will engage in a wide range of activities around their domain of expertise, researching technical solutions to influence and respond to criteria for analyst evaluations, competitive analysis of other cloud service providers, and providing feedback to service teams to influence product roadmap. We are looking for a candidate who is comfortable at the intersection of technology and business. They will be broadly competent across many areas of technology and deep in a handful of areas. It's ok for them to be less deep in some places, but we need to feel confident that they have the fundamentals and the ability to learn complex new technologies quickly.

Candidates should have a mix of communication and technical skills, and the ability to engage with stakeholders from different areas in the organization, from service teams, solution architects and peers in the marketing organization as well as external vendors.

The AWS cloud computing platform is used today by millions of businesses and developers around the world, ranging from start-ups to Fortune 50 enterprises. Cloud computing is arguably one of the most impactful developments in technology within the last 20 years. AWS is a pioneer and leader in the fast growing field of cloud computing. Because of this, there are thousands of analysts worldwide who are trying to understand AWS to then help their clients realize the transformation potential of cloud computing for their business. Our role is to inform these analysts and explain how AWS is different from traditional IT infrastructure offerings, and to work with these analysts to understand core customer requirements and concerns.

Position will be located in an Amazon/AWS U.S. Corp office based in the following locations: Seattle, WA (HQ); Arlington, VA (HQ2); San Francisco, CA; Austin, TX; New York, NY. Relocation offered from within the US only to these locations.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Work with the service teams, solution architects and peers in the marketing organization to influence and respond to deeply technical and business critical criteria for vendor evaluations to ensure the best possible outcome for AWS
Project manage the vendor evaluation life-cycle for the most strategically important reports
Provide technical support and guidance to analyst relation managers and be a trusted advisor in all technical matters
Research AWS competitors to ensure accuracy of assessments from vendor evaluations
Capture and share competitive information derived from analyst evaluations to internal stakeholders and the field
Innovate and develop processes and tools to streamline the vendor evaluation process
Drive team awareness of market requirements and analyst viewpoints to align feature roadmaps and product messaging in a way that is consistent with market/analyst expectation
Create and maintain a scalable and dynamically evolving set of responses to frequently-used analyst criteria, and through re-use, minimize the response effort and response time

.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience supporting technical vendor evaluations for Gartner Magic Quadrant and Forrester Wave
Passion for working in a lean, fast-paced organization, and desire to own and refine key operational processes
Ability to adapt to a fast-changing and evolving role
Desire to grow with the team and take on additional responsibilities
Excellent written and oral communications skills
Clearly understands technology and can abstract business/solution value
