Job Summary:
The Sr. DBA position works on a central team of Database Systems Engineers and Administrators supporting DBMS for Disney Connected, Advanced Technologies and corporate development teams and customers. Primary focus of this position will be Database support and service of operational and business processes for internet sites and corporate applications for The Walt Disney Company. Key responsibilities include DB technology evaluation, guidance and consultation, design support, task automation and scripting, best practice and standards development, capacity planning, optimization and tuning, system upgrades and migrations, performance management, monitoring, security, backup and recovery, issue troubleshooting, and documentation. Additional tasks as assigned.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for level 1 systems management and exercises project-level control over initiatives. Excellent technical expertise in relevant state of the art database technologies, stores, systems, and design. Carries out assignments with minimal coaching and guidance from others. Develops, enhances and adheres to engineering and administration standards. Upholds and maintains strong documentation.

The ideal candidate will have experience with Pubic Cloud providers like AWS and Azure and 4-6 years experience with DB2. Oracle and/or SQL Server experience is a plus.

Basic Qualifications:
4-6 years experience with DB2 is strongly preferred. Oracle and/or SQL Server experience, or similar relational database systems, is a plus.
4-6 years’ experience with Linux Server platforms and/or Windows Server
4-6 years’ experience with relevant scripting languages or programming frameworks desired (NodeJS, JavaScript, Python, Perl, C, windows script; PowerShell, sh, korne, bash)
Expertise in relational database administration including configuration, implementation, data modeling, maintenance, redundancy/HA/DR, security, troubleshooting/performance tuning, upgrades, database, data and server migrations, SQL
2 or more years of IT operational experience supporting robust e-commerce, gaming or online businesses in a 24X7 production environment (on call)
Thorough understanding in Security implementations (IAM, SSL, encryption, firewall, wall garden) on Database, storage, network and Cloud environments. Participated in auditing exercise
Knowledge in 1 or more Cloud Platforms including but not limited to: AWS, Azure, GCP, Oracle Cloud and hybrid cloud environments

Join the OBRC Corporate Team! The Oregon Beverage Recycling Cooperative has an opening for a Senior Database Administrator to provide technical leadership on company database systems and solutions. OBRC is the industry steward of Oregon’s nationally recognized beverage container deposit program. We help keep Oregon beautiful by providing outstanding services to our partner distributors and retailers, and to the public for the recovery, reuse, and recycling of beverage containers. This position will work in our beautiful new headquarters building located in Clackamas, OR. We offer competitive wages, great benefits, 401k with company match, and much more!
Summary
This position will collaborate with various departments to develop an understanding of data and information needs, identify solutions, and improve the quality of service while providing support through the logical and physical design of databases. The Sr. DBA is responsible for maintaining the integrity and performance of the company databases and guaranteeing the data is stored securely and efficiently. The Sr. DBA provides strategic guidance and implementation of the corporate data warehouse and the corresponding data feeds.
Primary Duties & Responsibilities
Install, design, and maintain database system software and implement database security.
Monitor and analyze database performance and ensure effective and efficient utilization of database systems/processes.
Participate in the development and maintenance of strategic, architectural, and tactical plans for the database and data warehouse environments; be conversant with, and cognizant of, the future direction of systems, how that direction impacts the company, and how future and current database systems can be exploited for the company’s benefit.
Provide technical leadership on database systems and solutions. Provide individual mentoring and training on databases and tools. Recommend, test, and evaluate new technologies, software tools, and required skill sets; recommend and implement improvements.
Implement a Business Continuity solution for the database environment, including the installation and configuration of database software and replication processes.
Set and maintain database standards.
Maintain database dictionaries and support tools; develop and maintain accurate system documentation.
Identify and analyze the logical database structure for the company’s current and future needs.
Create, develop, maintain, and control the corporate data directory, which will include names, descriptions, sources of data, and keywords needed for categorizing and searching data item descriptions.
Ensure integrity of database system by developing, documenting, and enforcing security procedures and access controls.
Compose and develop protocols for levels of access necessary to view, print, sort, enter, revise, or delete material.
Design, implement, and periodically test database backup and recovery procedures.
Analyze requirements for current and future database performance; recommend equipment changes when necessary.
Develops guideline for database training for data-entry staff, data analysts, and end users.
Collaborate with various departments to identify needs; refine system to maximize multipurpose uses.
Assist senior management with reporting necessary to monitor the business within various departments.
Manage direct report(s)/systems and work with operations team members to ensure the route operations and field service department systems are reviewed and approved daily/weekly for pick-ups and container processing. Reconcile these systems monthly in collaboration with the finance department.
Maintain the UPC database used in reverse vending machines for container redemption at BottleDrops and retailers.
Provide outside reports for distributors, retailers, and other third-parties, as needed.
Manage retailers and distributors on OBRC’s partner portal.
Train, coach and supervise direct reports to complete daily tasks, maintain company standards, and following company policies and procedures.
Complete other duties as assigned.
Education/Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology/Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience required
5+ years of SQL server database experience as Database Administrator (DBA), including experience installing, configuring, designing, patching, archiving, and monitoring to include performance tuning databases with indexing
Microsoft certifications (preferred)
Minimum 1-year supervisory experience

Experience utilizing various high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) options for MS SQL Server.
Experience with backup/recovery best practices.
Extensive experience with query tuning and troubleshooting.
Working knowledge of data encryption techniques and database querying and management tools.
Experience running and creating SQL Server health assessments reports/SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) report development/experience writing complex SQL Queries.
Data warehouse design using star-schema and/or snowflake methodologies.
Previous experience with Azure data technologies (Azure SQL, Data Bricks)

Demonstrated ability to successfully prioritize and manage multiple projects, adhere to deadlines, handle frequent changes effectively and professionally, follow through on issues in a timely manner, and give excellent attention to detail with a high level of accuracy
Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate effectively at all levels with both internal and external partners

Job summary

Would you like to build and lead a Specialized Sales team focused on accelerating adoption of AWS Database Services? Do you have the business savvy, technical background, and sales leadership skills necessary to help position Amazon as the cloud provider of choice for these workloads? AWS is seeking a seasoned Specialized Sales Manager to help us maintain our leadership position as the preferred cloud platform for database. The role has a specific focus on AWS services such as Amazon Aurora, Amazon RDS, Amazon Document DB, and Amazon ElasticCache Service just to name a few of our database services. The Specialized Sales Team is critical to driving deeper workload specialization in alignment with our Account Managers with a goal to build a unified and cohesive community of delighted database customers powering their business with AWS.

The leader of this team will be in charge of hiring and developing a Specialized Sales Team within our Strategic Industries organization. They will be an integral part of the leadership team and a key member of the worldwide database organization. The ideal candidate will have experience with cloud-related activities such as data center migrations, database management systems, infrastructure optimization/modernization and earning customer trust by helping to create a long-term strategy with the customer as part of their AWS partnership. They will be a self-starter, and be willing to operate both tactically and strategically. As a key team member in this fast growing, exciting space, this leader will have the opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of a service category with significant impact on our customers’ business.

Key job responsibilities
Responsibilities include building and managing a sales team focused on driving revenue, adoption, and market penetration in a large territory. The ideal candidate will possess a sales background with a strong track record of performance and customer obsession to lead a team of remote senior Specialized Sellers with engagements at the CxO level, manage a regional sales pipeline and lead sales efforts. They will engage with our internal sales, solutions architects, partners, and professional services organizations to drive large and highly complex opportunities to closure. They will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product and technical challenges with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions while working cross-organizationally to build consensus.

A day in the life
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

About the team
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.


3+ Years Selling Managed Cloud Services
Experience Selling to multi-national companies

At Redbox, we’re on a mission to serve our customers unparalleled choices in new release movies and entertainment with more ways to watch at affordable prices. Redbox has expanded our digital streaming offerings while growing our nationwide footprint of approximately 40,000 entertainment kiosks, serving 40 million customers, creating a multi-platform, multi-product entertainment experience. And we are growing Redbox Entertainment, our original movie and distribution arm, bringing fresh, original content to our customers.
Bring your energy, passion for entertainment, and unique skillset to help us achieve our mission to make it ridiculously cheap and easy for customers to get the entertainment they want most!
Redbox has a hybrid workforce and many of our jobs are available to be remote with the ability to use our corporate office spaces which are located in Oakbrook Terrace, IL, Bellevue, WA and soon to open in Los Angeles.
Position Overview
The Manager of Database Engineering provides day-to-day direction and guidance to the database administration team responsible for production workloads. This role implements and maintains cloud data infrastructure and on-premise database servers, assuring the integrity, recoverability, and security of data residing in all databases.
Key Responsibilities
Coordinate with the application teams to move data workloads from on-premise to cloud databases
Implement and maintain cloud and on-premise databases and data warehouse solutions that are scalable, secure and performant
Collaborate with info-sec and data team to create cloud data governance policies pertaining to database management, security, maintenance and utilization
Set and monitor standards of database efficiency and implement improvements
Help control the activities related to database planning, migration and architecture, and develop a long-range plan for database systems
Ensure that databases support the appropriate systems and are properly maintained
Monitor the ticket queue for requests and prioritize, communicate, and evaluate progress and results regarding the team’s activities and goal attainment
Confer with appropriate managers and teams to determine cloud database needs, and address problems and capabilities of databases
Communicate status of projects to senior management, advising managers on database concepts and functional capabilities, and recommending systems changes as appropriate
Evaluate vendor products in light of company needs
Provide input to annual budget as needed
Coordinate the administration of database systems ensuring that staff is adequately trained and responsive to end user needs
Manage the activities of a team of database administrators, to including hiring, training, performance appraisals, and coaching
Perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in computer programming or Information Technology required
10+ years of technical experience in database administration, including 3+ years in cloud (AWS or GCP)
2+ years of management experience required
Thorough knowledge of database concepts and management best practices related to administration, programming and systems analysis procedures
3+ years in MS SQL Server database administration
3+ years in GCP, AWS, data operations experience
Experience creating design specifications and system documentation
Ability to accurately estimate project resources and accurately project completion timelines
Experience in managing AWS Services like EC2, Redshift, S3, RDS, SNS, Cloudwatch, IAM, Lambda, and Athena. GCP services like BigQuery, MySQL
Experienced in database architecture, permissions, and performance tuning
Experience in automated cloud deployments and configuration using terraform
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Self-directed with a commitment to quality service
Clear written communications and ability to thoroughly document computing environment and support procedures
Ability to develop and analyze solutions to solve problems and to effectively use new technologies to improve service levels
Ability to quickly learn new technologies and share that learning with co-workers and other teams
Use of network, server and database monitoring and analysis software to improve reliability and performance
Excellent knowledge of business objectives and strategies
Excellent time management, communications, decision making, presentation, human relations and organization skills

Redbox is dynamic and fast-paced with a passionate team who creates products that delight, listens to our customers, and believes in the power of entertainment to connect us to each other and to the world. As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.

Special Education Student Information System (SESIS): The Division of Specialized Instruction and Student Support (DSISS) is seeking an Expert Database Manager to be part of the MIS/Analytics Team. He/she will be responsible for translating high-level technical specifications, designing and developing the data models and data migration plans, and ensuring the implementation of a smooth system, heavily focused on data analysis.


Responsibilities include:
Programs data queries, data transformations, load jobs, and data extracts using SQL and stored procedures in MS SQL Server.
Guide and manage database programming and data extraction, transformation and loading of data into consolidated data marts that will be used for MIS reporting, operational dashboards, analytical modeling, and custom reporting applications.
Actively participate in working sessions to help define system requirements pertaining to the design and building phases for all data-related systems.
Responsible for documenting business requirements associated with all data integration projects/processes.

SUMMARY
Exercising discretion and independent judgement, directs the business functions related to membership, manages the membership database and coordinates the day to day processing of accounts payables.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

BUSINESS MANAGEMENT

Oversees the membership services department and directly carries out supervisory responsibilities to effectively manage personnel in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; auditing and appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems, without direct oversight and using independent discretion and judgement.
Serves as the Association’s lead for technical support and business questions related to membership. Investigates and determines appropriate course of action or response, without direct oversight and using independent discretion and judgement.
Reviews and recommends best practices related to the accounting and financial segment of membership and programs, without direct oversight and using independent discretion and judgement. May deviate from established policies and procedures without prior approval as needed to facilitate the business functions.
Provides leadership and guidance to the Directors in implementing and maintaining the established best practices. If not followed takes initiative to work in conjunction with the Executive to provide coaching and additional training.
Successfully completes critical aspects of deliverables related to the business functions of membership to include, but not limited to account maintenance, renewals, invoicing, bank drafts and returned payments.
Prioritizes conflicting needs; handles matters expeditiously, proactively and follow through on projects to successful completion, often with deadline pressures.
Manages the administrative responsibilities associated with special initiatives (e.g., military, limited use partners, etc.) and large corporate partnerships.
Attends membership committee meetings to provide input related to the business function of membership.
Collaborates with Directors and Executives and provides recommendations on membership data, reporting, mailing/email lists, membership categories, pricing and incentives.
Provides high quality customer service to members and program participants over the phone and in person. Uses independent discretion and judgement to handle escalated concerns from the public.
Develops and conducts initial and ongoing trainings related to use of the membership software system.

DATABASE MANAGEMENT

Manages the membership database to include performance, security and maintenance.
Troubleshoots issues on behalf of the users.
Monitors the integrity of data entered and takes appropriate action with users to remediate errors.
Develops user, support and technical documentation.
Determine need, develops and conducts trainings related to use of the database.
Provides expert advice and information sharing to other users and management.
Creates, analyzes and provides input on reports that utilize data stored on the database. Cross references and mines data from multiple source documents as needed.
Customizes existing applications in order to make them fit for purpose.
Assumes a lead role in managing the implementation process of enhancements and upgrades to software. Collaborates with users and provides, input, guidance and leadership.

OTHER

Maintains flexibility as workloads change throughout the department and assumes responsibilities to support the ongoing success of the YMCA as a whole.
Develops and maintains procedures for job duties.
Monitors and maintains departmental record systems, files and paperwork.
Receives and protects confidential information.
Receives and carries out instructions.
Maintains regular and predictable attendance. May require evenings/weekends as required to conduct training and/or support the branches.
Performs special projects and other duties as assigned.
Performs other activities and duties as needed that address the ongoing health and well-being of our staff and members, including but not limited to housekeeping, sanitation, etc. throughout all YMCA buildings and program areas.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Ability to read, write, talk, see and hear.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide.
Ability to exhibit initiative, responsibility and flexibility and maintain organization and detail in a changing environment.
Knowledgeable in accounting and financial procedures.
CRM experience
General knowledge and proficient use of a computer and computer programs to include MS Office products.
Ability to perform multiple tasks and handle multiple projects at one time.
Ability to maintain a high level of detail.
Ability to work with all levels of YMCA staff, members and program participants and establish effective working relationships.
Possesses a strong understanding of the YMCA and its purpose, mission and values. Demonstrates this understanding through behavior and actions that support the purpose, mission and values.

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience and/or training.

Job Summary
This position is a Oracle and Oracle Exadata Database Administrator (DBA) for the Data and Analytics Team . The DBA is mainly responsible for maintaining highly visible production databases. Responsibilities include designing, installing, upgrading, patching, tuning, monitoring and troubleshooting databases with large amounts of data (Terabytes) and high transaction rates. Capacity planning, sql analysis, schema revisions, security administration and user account maintenance are also required tasks. Immediate participation in an active on call rotation required. Candidate must be capable of providing off hours support to avoid impacting database availability during normal business hours. The candidate will be widely regarded as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) and will need to demonstrate an ability to resolve complex problems across wide stack of Data Base.
Job Description
Job Requirements :
1) Database Availability & StabilityExperienced in managing database objects, including tables, partitions, indexes, views, sequencesExperienced in setting up monitoring and alerting for database systemsExperienced in setting up database cluster, replication, backups, monitoring and SQL tuning.

Who provides the know-how to protect data, tools and information systems at Dell Technologies? It’s the Database Admin team within our Information Technology organization. We develop, design and optimize our information technology and systems functions that support our business processes and technical information systems platforms. Focused on efficiency, performance, availability and platform compatibility, we analyze, select and modify enterprise systems and application software, install network hardware and software and manage our databases – setting system and programming standards along the way.
Join us as a Consultant Data Base Administrator on our Database Design Engineering and Reliability Enablement team in Remote, Texas to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.
What you’ll achieve
As a Consultant Database Administrator you will be responsible for Providing technical consultations and Database Solutions, Database Platform Reliability Services which includes DB Provision and Support. You will work with Application Team, DB Engineering, DDC team onNo SQL Databases, Graph Databases ( Tiger Graph, Neo4j, Cassandra), and RDBMS like Oracle.
You will:
Work with internal customers (i.e., Product Managers, Project Managers, and technical users from the Application team) to complete Database Provision in time.
Upgrading DB Server/Applying Service Packs as needed, Server Replication Designing and Implement
 Server and Database Security Administration, Tune database queries, tuning and Monitoring
 Create database objects (tables, indexes, etc.) and Write database procedures, functions, and triggers
Works with Application Team, DB Engineering, DDC team, and DB Cross Product Lead to define and deliver requested products
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements
At least 12 years of experience in No SQL, Graph Database and Oracle Administration in a big Enterprise organization
Extensive experience in designing and handling Disaster recovery/high availability/
Should be very strong in replication concepts and troubleshooting replication issues within SLA.
Good communication, time management, negotiation, and leadership skills
Masters or Bachelor's degree in any discipline
Desirable Requirements
Experience in scripting tools: PowerShell, Perl, Python, Shell, etc

Overview:

Gryphon Technologies is a premier engineering and technical services provider supporting National Security programs. Gryphon is the federal Government’s partner working in support of mission critical systems in every phase of their lifecycle. We are proud of our ability to help shape tomorrow, while ensuring today’s U.S. and coalition forces can carry out their critical missions and tasks.
Gryphon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
As required by Executive Order 14042, Federal contractors are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 regardless of the employee’s work location or work arrangement (e.g., telework, remote work, etc.), subject to such exceptions as required by law. If selected for a position with Gryphon Technologies, you will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit documentation of proof of vaccination prior to starting. Gryphon Technologies will provide additional information regarding what information or documentation will be needed and how you can request a request a medical or religious exemption from this requirement.
Responsibilities:

Gryphon Technologies is looking for a highly qualified Sr. Database Manager to manage the development of database projects. Plans and budgets staff and database resources. Reallocates resources to maximize benefits. Prepares and delivers presentations on Database Management Systems (DBMS) concepts. Provides daily supervision and direction to support staff who designs and builds relational and dimensional databases. Performs data access analysis design, and recovery. Develops strategies for and leads data cloud migration efforts.

You will provide advocacy and strategic technical guidance to help plan and build solutions using best practices, and pro-actively oversee a team that keeps customers’ database environments operationally healthy. The close relationships developed with your customers will allow you to understand their business/operational needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value.


As our customers make the move to the cloud this is an opportunity for you to shape the future of America’s Armed Forces!
Qualifications:

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Seven (7) years’ experience with increasing responsibilities in DBMS systems analysis and / or programming, using current DBMS technologies
Five (4) years’ experience leading large cloud migration efforts
Application database design utilizing various database management systems and experience with DBMS internals.
Experienced in working independently or under only general direction. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Math, or related discipline required, or 7 years of equivalent work experience
Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience as a technical lead
Experience with AWS or Azure services and/or other cloud offerings
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Meets/exceeds Gryphon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Gryphon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role 7+ years of technical engineering experience
Experience in operational parameters and troubleshooting for four (4) or more of the following: AWS RDS / Dynamo DB / Redshift / Aurora / Azure Database Migration Service / Cosmos DB / Maria DB / Azure SQL Managed Instance / Azure Database for MySQL
Experience in Informational Technology operations
Professional oral and written communication skills, presenting to an audience containing one or more decision maker(s) Experience in a 24x7 operational services or support environment
AWS Certified Database – Specialty certification, Oracle Certified Professional, or similar advanced database certification
Please note many of our positions require the ability to obtain/maintain a security clearance. Security clearances may only be granted to U.S. citizens. In addition, candidates who accept a conditional offer of employment may be subject to government security investigation(s) and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
Principal Database Administrator
Install, design, implement, upgrade, and optimize the performance of databases required to operate Allscripts' software solutions.


Accountabilities
Estimate effort for self and agree on schedules with Project Manager.
Create and maintain appropriate documentation (Database, Architecture, etc.).
Analyze and diagnose problems reported to the help desk, escalate support issues.
Discuss issues/requirements with client.
Work with the development teams in the data modelling and database design of product and efficient SQL for fast application performance.
Effectively support Sales, BSG and Professional Services.
Research and identify third party tools / software that improve the development process.
Install and configure database system software plus third-party system tools, applications, and products.
Performance Optimization – Performance monitoring, measurement, and capacity planning of Production Software solutions, recommending changes to Allscripts products and "standardized" System configurations.
Implement, periodically test, and review appropriate data access and security measures, including access control, audit, backup/restore and system rebuild & recovery processes.
Implement and continuously improve the database infrastructure environment. Provide fast and value-added services to the development organization.
Participate in the process of ensuring that identified Business Continuity measures are implemented, documented, and regularly tested to enable continue operations of systems identified as requiring such protection in accordance with the corporate Disaster Recovery program.
Stay current with the DB technology. Perform software upgrades and new software installation both pro-actively and in response to requests from users of systems, including any necessary patches to database systems and applications to ensure continuing stable and secure operation.
Provide an ad-hoc support service to users of all computer systems, troubleshooting and resolving database problems.
Carry out prescribed programs of computer system performance management and capacity planning for systems as designated by Management to ensure the necessary system capacity and performance is available as required.
Pro-actively seek and acquire technical training, vocational training and market and product awareness such that skills remain current, relevant, and valued within Allscripts.
Accurately estimate effort for self and agree schedules with manager.
Liaise with manager; keep manager informed of progress.
Train, coach, and mentor junior team members.
Provide leadership to the Team.
Help recruit to build the organization with the right talent.

Academic and professional qualifications

Successful completion of a bachelor's degree or relevant database experience.
Post-graduation qualifications or technical database certifications preferred.

Experience

Typically requires 14+ years of experience.
Detailed technical database knowledge is dependent on the specific Allscripts Product Development Center requirements.

Travel requirements

Depends upon the project/program needs.

Working arrangements

Hours required to complete projects/assignments
Must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for employment with Allscripts.

Visa Sponsorship is not offered for this position.

DraftKings is growing quickly and we’re looking for a Senior DBA centered around the mission of providing a best-in-class experience for our products and customers. This position requires strong technical skills and a bias toward collaboration. You will be working across teams, informing business decisions, and helping to expand our software platform.
WHAT YOU'LL DO AS A SENIOR DBA:
Maintaining, monitoring, and securing the organization's production and non-production of PostgreSQL / MS SQL / MongoDB databases, in high-volume/multi-instance environments, utilizing state of the art concepts and employing leading-edge maintenance techniques to maximize application availability.
Actively monitor the health, performance, and integrity of all databases and proactively take corrective actions as necessary.
Defining and implementing an effective database backup strategy.
Defining and implementing an effective data retention strategy.
Participating in the assessment and implementation of all database-related tools or other 3rd-party products and in the migration and testing required to move to more recent versions of PostgreSQL / MS SQL / MongoDB as they are released.
Providing on-call support for production environments on a shared DBA rotation.
Providing 24/7 support for various activities including Database maintenance, Application Releases, Application Database upgrades, DBMS upgrades, and Disaster Recovery.

WHAT YOU’LL BRING:
Good knowledge and experience of PostgreSQL infrastructure and capabilities
Good knowledge and experience of MongoDB infrastructure topology is an advantage
Good knowledge in MS SQL 2016 and related product technologies AlwaysON/HA, Replication, Log shipping, etc. is an advantage.
Experience in troubleshooting and resolving database integrity issues, performance issues, blocking and deadlocking issues, connectivity issues, security issues, etc.
Knowledge of indexes, index management, and statistics.
Experience in Performance Tuning, Query Optimization, and other related monitoring and troubleshooting tools.
Analytical ability, strong judgment, and the ability to work effectively with IT, management, and staff.
Ability to effectively communicate with users in written or verbal form.
General knowledge in the following areas: IT concepts, strategies, and methodologies, architectures and technical standards, database administration tools and utilities, backup and recovery, storage subsystems, and replication concepts.
Code writing skills in one or more of the following languages: tsql, python, ansible, Powershell.

Overview
Guidehouse is a leading global provider of consulting services to the public and commercial markets with broad capabilities in management, technology, and risk consulting. We help clients address their toughest challenges and navigate significant regulatory pressures with a focus on transformational change, business resiliency, and technology-driven innovation. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and digital services, we create scalable, innovative solutions that prepare our clients for future growth and success. The company has more than 10,000 professionals in over 50 locations globally. Guidehouse is a Veritas Capital portfolio company, led by seasoned professionals with proven and diverse expertise in traditional and emerging technologies, markets, and agenda-setting issues driving national and global economies. For more information, please visit: www.guidehouse.com.

Responsibilities

Qualifications
The Database Manager Administrator role requires 4 years of experience in the field with 2 or more years in a related complex data analytics environment as an individual contributor.
The Database Manager Administrator will be responsible for managing the administration of an organization's database.
Analyzes the organization's database needs and develops a long-term strategy for data storage.
Recommends policies and procedures related to data security and integrity and monitors and limits database access as needed.
Assists in the the design, maintenance and implementation of the systems that manage an internal database.
Familiarity with managing databases in a data analytics/unstructured data environment.
Minimum Education Requirements: Requires a Bachelor's degree in information technology or a relevant related field.
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of DoD Data Standards such as the Air Force Data Services Reference Architecture.
Experience supporting either the DoD Chief Data or Chief Software Offices
Air Force PlatformONE or CloudONE experience

Additional Requirements

The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.

SUMMARY
Exercising discretion and independent judgement, directs the business functions related to membership, manages the membership database and coordinates the day to day processing of accounts payables.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

BUSINESS MANAGEMENT

Oversees the membership services department and directly carries out supervisory responsibilities to effectively manage personnel in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; auditing and appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems, without direct oversight and using independent discretion and judgement.
Serves as the Association’s lead for technical support and business questions related to membership. Investigates and determines appropriate course of action or response, without direct oversight and using independent discretion and judgement.
Reviews and recommends best practices related to the accounting and financial segment of membership and programs, without direct oversight and using independent discretion and judgement. May deviate from established policies and procedures without prior approval as needed to facilitate the business functions.
Provides leadership and guidance to the Directors in implementing and maintaining the established best practices. If not followed takes initiative to work in conjunction with the Executive to provide coaching and additional training.
Successfully completes critical aspects of deliverables related to the business functions of membership to include, but not limited to account maintenance, renewals, invoicing, bank drafts and returned payments.
Prioritizes conflicting needs; handles matters expeditiously, proactively and follow through on projects to successful completion, often with deadline pressures.
Manages the administrative responsibilities associated with special initiatives (e.g., military, limited use partners, etc.) and large corporate partnerships.
Attends membership committee meetings to provide input related to the business function of membership.
Collaborates with Directors and Executives and provides recommendations on membership data, reporting, mailing/email lists, membership categories, pricing and incentives.
Provides high quality customer service to members and program participants over the phone and in person. Uses independent discretion and judgement to handle escalated concerns from the public.
Develops and conducts initial and ongoing trainings related to use of the membership software system.

DATABASE MANAGEMENT

Manages the membership database to include performance, security and maintenance.
Troubleshoots issues on behalf of the users.
Monitors the integrity of data entered and takes appropriate action with users to remediate errors.
Develops user, support and technical documentation.
Determine need, develops and conducts trainings related to use of the database.
Provides expert advice and information sharing to other users and management.
Creates, analyzes and provides input on reports that utilize data stored on the database. Cross references and mines data from multiple source documents as needed.
Customizes existing applications in order to make them fit for purpose.
Assumes a lead role in managing the implementation process of enhancements and upgrades to software. Collaborates with users and provides, input, guidance and leadership.

OTHER

Maintains flexibility as workloads change throughout the department and assumes responsibilities to support the ongoing success of the YMCA as a whole.
Develops and maintains procedures for job duties.
Monitors and maintains departmental record systems, files and paperwork.
Receives and protects confidential information.
Receives and carries out instructions.
Maintains regular and predictable attendance. May require evenings/weekends as required to conduct training and/or support the branches.
Performs special projects and other duties as assigned.
Performs other activities and duties as needed that address the ongoing health and well-being of our staff and members, including but not limited to housekeeping, sanitation, etc. throughout all YMCA buildings and program areas.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Ability to read, write, talk, see and hear.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide.
Ability to exhibit initiative, responsibility and flexibility and maintain organization and detail in a changing environment.
Knowledgeable in accounting and financial procedures.
CRM experience
General knowledge and proficient use of a computer and computer programs to include MS Office products.
Ability to perform multiple tasks and handle multiple projects at one time.
Ability to maintain a high level of detail.
Ability to work with all levels of YMCA staff, members and program participants and establish effective working relationships.
Possesses a strong understanding of the YMCA and its purpose, mission and values. Demonstrates this understanding through behavior and actions that support the purpose, mission and values.

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience and/or training.

Job Summary
This position is a Oracle and Oracle Exadata Database Administrator (DBA) for the Data and Analytics Team . The DBA is mainly responsible for maintaining highly visible production databases. Responsibilities include designing, installing, upgrading, patching, tuning, monitoring and troubleshooting databases with large amounts of data (Terabytes) and high transaction rates. Capacity planning, sql analysis, schema revisions, security administration and user account maintenance are also required tasks. Immediate participation in an active on call rotation required. Candidate must be capable of providing off hours support to avoid impacting database availability during normal business hours. The candidate will be widely regarded as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) and will need to demonstrate an ability to resolve complex problems across wide stack of Data Base.
Job Description
Job Requirements :
1) Database Availability & StabilityExperienced in managing database objects, including tables, partitions, indexes, views, sequencesExperienced in setting up monitoring and alerting for database systemsExperienced in setting up database cluster, replication, backups, monitoring and SQL tuning.
2) Database Analysis & DesignAdvanced knowledge of ‪SQL, PL/SQL and any of scripting languages used to automate DB related tasksDatabase performance tuning and troubleshooting (Production DB)Strong analysis and troubleshooting skills and experienceSelf-starter who is excited about learning new technologyExposure to security concepts / best practicesMust be willing to work on-call as part of regular work schedule or off hours when required.
Required Technical Skills:
Needs a minimum of 5 years with Oracle databases requiring the following skills:
Software Products: Oracle X8M, Oracle 11g/12c RDBMS, Oracle 11g/12c RAC, OEM 12c, RMAN, Oracle Data guard (Physical and Active), Advanced Replication, Streams, Golden Gate, Partitioning, Oracle Cloud infrastructure (OCI), Netapp Snap Manager, Advanced Security, Data Vault
Operating Systems: Linux (Redhat, OEL), Solaris, HPUX
Hardware environments: Exadata, HP, Nutanix, SUN, DELL,
Programming Language(s): SQL, PL/SQL, Unix and Shell Scripting
Strong UNIX and Shell scripting
Required Personal Skills & Experience:
Experience with all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle, including system analysis, design, coding, testing, debugging and documentation
Works independently with general supervision.
Teamwork & collaboration skills to work across organizations and lead cross-functional teams
Communication & stakeholder management skills
Problem solving skills to develop quick yet sound solutions to resolve complex issues
Desired Skills:
Certification(s): Oracle Database Administration

Job description
Database Administrator - 6 month contract
Preferred remote location: Arizona, Colorado, Montana, New Mexico, Wyoming, California, Nevada, Washington, Idaho, Oregon
Join our team for the opportunity to work for a global organizational consulting firm enabling people and organizations to exceed their potential. We operate the organization infrastructure in the cloud using modern managed software services. Our vision for our next platform generation offers a unique opportunity to be part of something special.
The Database Administrator position is a member of an internal software development team employed to advance the organization's proprietary software platform. The Database Administrator will engage colleagues to facilitate the management of the database landscape founded and hosted in the cloud with Azure Services. The Database Administrator at a high level will oversee enterprise implementation of numerous instances of Microsoft SQL Server in operation globally.
Duties
Define and implement Microsoft SQL Server best practice guidelines
Define and implement data protection
Define and implement disaster recovery
Define and implement change control
Define and implement database maintenance plans
Define and implement database backup and recovery plans
Define and implement database monitoring
Develop a security and compliance plan
Support the development team and give guidance on Microsoft SQL Server operating environment
Provide performance tuning
Provide resource health-checks and performance metrics reporting
Technical Skills
Microsoft SQL Server version 2016, 2017, 2019
Microsoft SQL Server Azure Managed
Microsoft SQL Server Cluster
Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, and SQL Server Performance Monitor
Microsoft SQL Server Query Language
Microsoft SQL Server Stored Procedures
Experience
Minimum 8 years of experience in the field of database management combined with software development
Minimum 6 years of experience Microsoft .NET platform combined with Web development
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure DevOps Development pipeline; Projects, Dashboards, Wiki, Boards, Test Plans, Epics, User Stories, and Work Items
Participated in medium to large projects involving software application lifecycle phases; plan, develop, deliver, and operate
Remote and unsupervised work environment
Education Qualification
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Technology or Computer Science from an accredited college
Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate

About DMI:
DMI (Digital Management, LLC.), the world’s first end-to-end mobility company, combines all the skills and services necessary to deliver mobile enterprise solutions. Built to reinvent business through mobility, DMI has expertise in mobile strategy, UX, web, and app development, omni-channel commerce, brand and marketing, IoT and big data analytics, and secure device and app management. The company’s unique, integrated approach to mobility has resulted in dramatic growth as well as an expanding client base, which includes hundreds of Fortune 1000 commercial clients and all fifteen U.S. Federal Departments. DMI is headquartered in Bethesda, MD, with satellite offices around the world. The company was named one of the 2018 Top Workplaces in the Washington, DC area by The Washington Post and received Inc. Magazine’s Hire Power Award as one of the top 100 Private Job Creators in the US. Additional information is available at www.dminc.com and on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

About the Opportunity:
DMI (Digital Management LLC) is looking for ADABAS Data Base Specialist remotely

Qualifications:
These personnel provide highly technical expertise and guidance in the interrelationship of the enterprise DBMS within the system software environment.
Each ADABAS Data Base Specialist must meet all the qualifications listed under Mandatory Core Competencies.
The ADABAS Data Base Specialist is responsible for installing, customizing, and maintaining the Data Center’s ADABAS Cluster Services environment and associated suite of Software AG (SAG) products.
ADABAS Cluster Services is fundamental to the Data Center high availability and continuous operating ADABAS environment. Availability of information and information systems are critical to OPM meeting its mission.

Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
1. Planning, installing, customizing, configuring, and implementing SAG suite of ADABAS software products.
2. Planning and executing disaster recovery for ADABAS and ADABAS related products.
3. Planning, creating, and managing table spaces in support DBAs.
4. Planning, configuring, and implementing ADABAS Cluster Services and its add-on tools.
5. Planning, configuring, and implementing new DBMS technologies following OPM Change Control process.
6. Planning and implementing ADABAS support for structured and unstructured data.

Job Summary
This position is a Oracle and Oracle Exadata Database Administrator (DBA) for the Data and Analytics Team . The DBA is mainly responsible for maintaining highly visible production databases. Responsibilities include designing, installing, upgrading, patching, tuning, monitoring and troubleshooting databases with large amounts of data (Terabytes) and high transaction rates. Capacity planning, sql analysis, schema revisions, security administration and user account maintenance are also required tasks. Immediate participation in an active on call rotation required. Candidate must be capable of providing off hours support to avoid impacting database availability during normal business hours. The candidate will be widely regarded as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) and will need to demonstrate an ability to resolve complex problems across wide stack of Data Base.
Job Description
Job Requirements :
1) Database Availability & StabilityExperienced in managing database objects, including tables, partitions, indexes, views, sequencesExperienced in setting up monitoring and alerting for database systemsExperienced in setting up database cluster, replication, backups, monitoring and SQL tuning.
2) Database Analysis & DesignAdvanced knowledge of ‪SQL, PL/SQL and any of scripting languages used to automate DB related tasksDatabase performance tuning and troubleshooting (Production DB)Strong analysis and troubleshooting skills and experienceSelf-starter who is excited about learning new technologyExposure to security concepts / best practicesMust be willing to work on-call as part of regular work schedule or off hours when required.
Required Technical Skills:
Needs a minimum of 5 years with Oracle databases requiring the following skills:
Software Products: Oracle X8M, Oracle 11g/12c RDBMS, Oracle 11g/12c RAC, OEM 12c, RMAN, Oracle Data guard (Physical and Active), Advanced Replication, Streams, Golden Gate, Partitioning, Oracle Cloud infrastructure (OCI), Netapp Snap Manager, Advanced Security, Data Vault
Operating Systems: Linux (Redhat, OEL), Solaris, HPUX
Hardware environments: Exadata, HP, Nutanix, SUN, DELL,
Programming Language(s): SQL, PL/SQL, Unix and Shell Scripting
Strong UNIX and Shell scripting
Required Personal Skills & Experience:
Experience with all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle, including system analysis, design, coding, testing, debugging and documentation
Works independently with general supervision.
Teamwork & collaboration skills to work across organizations and lead cross-functional teams
Communication & stakeholder management skills
Problem solving skills to develop quick yet sound solutions to resolve complex issues
Desired Skills:
Certification(s): Oracle Database Administration

Company Overview: At ADT, we've been in the business of helping save lives for more than 145 years. As the number one smart home security provider serving residential and business customers, our people are our most important asset. Headquartered in Boca Raton, FL and at more than 200 locations across North America, our employees help empower our customers to live more secure and confident lives. Join our team and help us protect what matters most. Position Summary:
The Manager, Database Administration will be responsible for the overall management of all Oracle, DB2, etc databases hosted on-prem and in the Cloud. The person in this role will lead a team of Database Administrators (on-shore and off-shore) that support ADT's business critical databases. Be involved in design, implementation and migration of Database environments ensuring highest levels of performance and availability. Should be able to interpret/identify internal or external business issues/ requirements and recommend changes and improvements to the process and infrastructure design. Must have people management experience, be a team player, possesses a solutions-oriented approach and high work ethics with excellent communication and process management skills.
Job Responsibilities:
Incident management - join Tech Bridge when there is a database related issue. Lead and guide the DBAs and other teams through troubleshooting and resolution
Manage the DBA on-call roster
Provide recommendations on Cloud Database Platforms based on Application requirements and cost analysis
Lead the Cloud Migration effort for databases
Be involved in Proof of Concepts for Cloud technologies/tools for database management, monitoring, alerting, etc and make recommendations
Ensures database and database system implementation and designs adhere to documented standards
Ensures databases are monitored for reactive and proactive troubleshooting to include information needed for periodic health checks, capacity, and issues
Oversees build of databases, database servers, and integration into application or data center/cloud environment
Periodically reviews database team's processes, standards, and documents and take actions to improve those as necessary
Ensures security is maintained on all databases
Responsible for database related risks, controls, and audits
Manages and provides guidance and mentorship to team members
Manages, motivates, organizes, and controls the staff and contractors
Participate in ADT's Disaster Recovery exercises and ensure consistency, completion and soundness of Application Recovery Plans from database perspective
Any other related tasks as required and/or assigned
Compensation:
The pay range for this role is $120,000 - $140,000 anually and is based on experience and qualifications.
Benefits:
Medical, Dental and vision insurance
Paid Time Off
401(k) plan with company matching contribution
Supplemental Voluntary Benefits
Tuition Reimbursement
Employee Referral Program
Employee Discount Program
Required Education/Experience/Skills:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or other equivalent technical discipline
2-5 years' experience leading/managing people
Good understanding of Database concepts, knowledge of Database and SQL performance tuning would be highly desirable
Strong analytical skills
Real experience with Cloud (GCP preferred) database platforms and tools
Experience with large scale multi-regional infrastructure deployments is nice to have
Deep and demonstrated understanding of the project and system development lifecycle
2-3 years' experience with Oracle databases
Effective communication (written and verbal) with technical and non-technical stakeholders across various business units and executives
ADT LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. We are committed to having a diverse and inclusive workforce and do our best to foster a culture and environment where every employee feels valued. Our goal is to serve our customers and help save lives. We can achieve this goal when we have the best talent working in an environment where employees feel included and recognized. Visit us online at jobs.adt.com to learn more.

Overview:

Abile Group has an exciting and challenging opportunity for a Database Administrator supporting an Intelligence Community Customer. We have an IMMEDIATE NEED for a Database Administrator to provide SQL and PostgreSQL support to Agile DevOps software development and to IT mission critical systems. The DBA will perform database administrator tasks including monitoring user access and security, monitoring performance and managing parameters to provide fast responses to front-end users, mapping out the conceptual design for a planned database, refining the logical design, installing and testing new versions, and refining the physical design to meet system storage requirements and conduct capacity planning.
The right candidate will possess the below skills and qualifications and be ready to handle all responsibilities independently and professionally.
Responsibilities:
Act as the SME and provide best practice recommendations for SQL and PostgreSQL
Provide SQL infrastructure engineering to include database architecture maintenance, database upgrades, server configurations, and application configurations.
Install, configure, and manage multiple SQL server environments with high availability and disaster recovery, to include monitoring, analysis, reporting, and data warehouse services and solutions
Architect and design the configuration and operation of SQL platforms on all environments.
Ensure proper integration of SQL with applications to include but not limited to SharePoint, Active Directory, etc.
Ensure that storage and archiving procedures are functioning correctly
Work closely with IT Project Managers and Software Developers
Communicate with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security
Commissioning and installing new applications and customizing existing applications
Support on-call activities as needed
Qualifications:

Clearance Required: Top Secret
Degree and Years of Experience:
BS degree and 12 – 15 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 10 – 13 years of prior relevant experience
5+ years of experience administering, patching, performance tuning and securing PostrgeSQL database
Preferred 3+ year administering Microsoft SQL Server
4+ years of AWS RDS management experience
Desired Certifications:
Oracle Database Administrator Certifications a plus
Relevant AWS certification preferred
Required Skills:
Experience with scripting using Ansible, Python or similar dynamic languages
Must have excellent communications and documentation skills
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to effectively troubleshoot, resolve, or escalate problems
Experience in Federal Grants Management is a plus
About Abile Group, Inc.:

Abile Group, Inc. was formed in July 2004 to partner with the Intelligence Community and their Contractors in the areas of Enterprise Analytics & Performance Management, IT & Systems Engineering and Program & Project Management. We have significant experience with the Federal Government and are an EDWOSB dedicated to our employees and clients. We are looking for high performing employees who enjoy providing advice and guidance along with solutions development and implementation support, crafted by combining industry best practices with the clients’ subject matter experience and Abile’s breadth of expertise.

Job summary
Are you a Database Specialist? Do you like to solve the most complex and large-scale database challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new database technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners use Cloud computing web services to build new solutions, faster, and at lower cost? Do you like to gain the deepest customer and partner insights using Cloud computing technologies?

Amazon aims to be the most customer centric company on earth. Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers critical applications for hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world.

At AWS, we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to collaborate with our customers and partners on migrating their Database and Analytics Solutions to the cloud. This role will specifically focus on Amazon Aurora.

You would be one of the founding members of a dynamic team bringing the latest in disruptive, cutting-edge cloud computing technologies to bear on the difficult cost and agility challenges facing many organizations. The business development and accounting management teams will help accelerate the adoption of AWS as the leading cloud technology platform.

The ideal candidate will …

Be great fun to work with. Our company credo is “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. As the right candidate, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge.

Enjoy working with customers and partners. You have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building cloud computing systems for some of the world’s largest and most important organizations.

This position must be located at one of our U.S. AWS Corp. offices with a preference for east coast locations including Boston and New York.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Key job responsibilities

Design Customer Solutions ­ Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre­sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use Amazon Aurora.
Devise Strategy ­ and Engage with Solution Architects, Account Managers Professional Services and Partners to define a Databse & Analytics Engagement strategy for AWS operational territories and key accounts.
Thought Leadership – Provide global thought leadership on Database solutions that benefit customers through the use of AWS Services. This takes the form of contribution to external publications such as the AWS Big Data Blog, Whitepapers and Reference architectures, as well as internal training of Solution Architects, Professional Services Consultants, Technical Account Managers, and AWS Trainers
Serve as a key member of the business development and account management team in helping to ensure customer success in building and migrating applications, software and services on the AWS platform.
Drive the AWS platform by aligning customer requirements with AWS service teams’ roadmaps by prioritizing customer requests.
In partnership with the sales teams and service teams formulate and execute a sales strategy to exceed revenue objectives
Hire, on-board, train, and develop new Solutions Architects.
Coach Solutions Architects in the skills needed to conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions so they can transfer deep technical skills to customers who are considering or using AWS
Operational – Website/web services as well as traditional IT networking, operations, management, and security experience.
Knowledge of the underlying infrastructure requirements such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization.
Implementation and tuning experience of Databases including knowledge of Schema Design, Query Tuning and Optimization, and Data Migration and Integration.
Analytics presentation layer expertise including Dashboards, Reporting, and OLAP.
Possession of both technical and customer-facing skills enabling perception as a "trusted advisor" to customers. He or she will be able to facilitate relationships with senior technical executives, as well as easily interact and give guidance to software developers, IT operations staff, and system architects. The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges.
Hands on experience as a database administrator, data warehouse architect or big data developer.
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations and virtual teams.
Executive speaking and presentation skills – Formal presentations, white boarding, large and small group presentations.
Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of business environments such as large enterprises and start-ups
Understanding of application, server, and network security is highly desired
AWS Certifications, e.g., AWS Solutions Architect Associate/Professional
The base pay range for this position in Colorado is $122,300 – $160,000/yr. however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon's internal or external careers site.

Job Summary
This position is a Oracle and Oracle Exadata Database Administrator (DBA) for the Data and Analytics Team . The DBA is mainly responsible for maintaining highly visible production databases. Responsibilities include designing, installing, upgrading, patching, tuning, monitoring and troubleshooting databases with large amounts of data (Terabytes) and high transaction rates. Capacity planning, sql analysis, schema revisions, security administration and user account maintenance are also required tasks. Immediate participation in an active on call rotation required. Candidate must be capable of providing off hours support to avoid impacting database availability during normal business hours. The candidate will be widely regarded as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) and will need to demonstrate an ability to resolve complex problems across wide stack of Data Base.
Job Description
Job Requirements :
1) Database Availability & StabilityExperienced in managing database objects, including tables, partitions, indexes, views, sequencesExperienced in setting up monitoring and alerting for database systemsExperienced in setting up database cluster, replication, backups, monitoring and SQL tuning.
2) Database Analysis & DesignAdvanced knowledge of ‪SQL, PL/SQL and any of scripting languages used to automate DB related tasksDatabase performance tuning and troubleshooting (Production DB)Strong analysis and troubleshooting skills and experienceSelf-starter who is excited about learning new technologyExposure to security concepts / best practicesMust be willing to work on-call as part of regular work schedule or off hours when required.
Required Technical Skills:
Needs a minimum of 5 years with Oracle databases requiring the following skills:
Software Products: Oracle X8M, Oracle 11g/12c RDBMS, Oracle 11g/12c RAC, OEM 12c, RMAN, Oracle Data guard (Physical and Active), Advanced Replication, Streams, Golden Gate, Partitioning, Oracle Cloud infrastructure (OCI), Netapp Snap Manager, Advanced Security, Data Vault
Operating Systems: Linux (Redhat, OEL), Solaris, HPUX
Hardware environments: Exadata, HP, Nutanix, SUN, DELL,
Programming Language(s): SQL, PL/SQL, Unix and Shell Scripting
Strong UNIX and Shell scripting
Required Personal Skills & Experience:
Experience with all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle, including system analysis, design, coding, testing, debugging and documentation
Works independently with general supervision.
Teamwork & collaboration skills to work across organizations and lead cross-functional teams
Communication & stakeholder management skills
Problem solving skills to develop quick yet sound solutions to resolve complex issues
Desired Skills:
Certification(s): Oracle Database Administration

It’s why we strive to create a nurturing environment that offers countless career opportunities to grow. Deep caring and solid family values are what makes us the one of the top work places for jobs in the Greater Pittsburgh, Cleveland, Columbus and Indianapolis Areas. From our Warehouses to our GetGo’s, our grocery Stores through our Corporate home office we are working together to put food on shopper’s tables’ and smiles on their faces. Our Engineering group is seeking an accomplished SQL Server Database Administrator to join our talented team in Tulsa, OK. In this position, you will provide support for production systems and provide DBA services to application development teams, including database design, database generation, coding, and database production support. You will also support database environments with a high degree of customer service, technical expertise, and timeliness to ensure user productivity.

 As a Senior Database Administrator, you are instrumental in researching, evaluating, designing, testing, recommending, and planning implementation of new versions of MS SQL Server database and database tools. You may act as a team lead during database implementations and for system operation and maintenance.
Primary Responsibilities and Essential Duties:
Defines database strategy to support our cloud and on-prem database environments.
Develops automation for environment setup, configuration, deployment, and recovery.
Continual assessment of database performance and identification of problem areas.
Designs global solutions for multi-region high availability, cloud failover, and disaster recovery.
Works with engineering, support, and operations teams during design, development, and implementation of production applications.
Provides guidance and mentoring across the organization in all aspects of the supported areas.
Maintains awareness of industry developments, technology, and trends.
Reviews tools, technologies, and processes to make best practice recommendations.
Provides technical support for the database environment and provides guidance to the development team on new service implementations.
Leads database performance benchmarks and implements performance enhancements.
Manages day-to-day database support and maintenance activities, such as database backup and testing, to meet business and IT needs.
Develop, manage, and support 24x7 proactive monitoring and alerting for database environments, working with both cloud and development teams to resolve issues as part of on-call support rotation.
Logical and physical database design and documentation.
Translation of log files to actionable and measurable tasks.
Planning and execution of database migrations, combined with modernization, upgrades, transformation, and optimization.
Responsible for Database Server installation and configuration.
Infrastructure troubleshooting in partnership with server support team.
 Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in computer science or other business-related field or equivalent experience.
5+ years of experience as a DBA in a mixed Operating System environment.
5+ years of experience with MS SQL Server or Azure SQL.
5+ years of working experience in large enterprise(s).
Very strong knowledge and experience in DB performance tuning.
Knowledge of data modeling concepts.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with successful project management.
Preferred Skills:
Experience with Azure cloud technologies
Hands On experience with SQL Always-On technology
MS SQL certifications
Azure cloud certifications
The Company:
TMA Systems (TMA) is a technology company located in Tulsa, Oklahoma. For more than 30 years, TMA has been transforming organizations by providing facility professionals with the most technologically advanced Maintenance Management solutions available.
Utilizing WebTMA, TMA’s flagship solution, organizations can manage their strategic assets throughout their entire lifecycle. Our comprehensive web-based solutions are tailored to a variety of industries that have a desire to effectively streamline maintenance operations. TMA is setting new standards for organizations to account for, maintain, and extend the useful life of their physical assets. In a budget conscious world, TMA provides a solution that will maximize return-on-investment (ROI).
We are a global organization with over 1,500 clients that has developed industry-leading solutions based on what our clients need to be successful. How do we achieve this? We solicit our clients and take the time to understand how our products are used in their business; coupled with a culture that produces world-class people with a client-service mindset. At TMA we realize that success is only possible with team members that share our passion for excellence.
Care to join us?
