The Database Administrator is a top level technical contributor able to perform all aspects of database management in a multi-platform enterprise scale environment. Responsible for performance tuning, data integrity, data security, and data interchange and other concepts related to various databases such as Oracle, and SQL Server. This individual can sit at any Collins Aerospace domestic location or remote.
Primary Responsibilities:
Stay abreast of technology developments in the database arena and provide expert level advice
Demonstrate proactive identification of key database architectures, components and interfaces
Partner with RDBMS vendors demonstrating industry-standard knowledge to deploy complex business solutions
Work with application teams to define optimal data models employing tools such as normalization principles
Guide the DBA team to deploy best in class RDBMS technology designs
Assume the lead on design and performance configuration efforts in the most complex database architectures and implementations
Provide database support in an on-call rotation
Innovate to find better means of achieving the goals of 24x7 availability and top performance
Focus on strategy to ensure the group’s goals align with those of the company
Basic Qualifications:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of prior relevant experience OR Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 5 years experience OR In absence of a degree, 12 years of relevant experience is required
Experience creating and maintaining stored procedures for Oracle SQL
Knowledge of diverse database architectures
Knowledge in database and information modelling (ER, Dimensional, physical, logical, hierarchical, semantic, etc.)
Knowledge in database and schema design and translation to implementation
7 years of data management experience
Experience migrating databases to newer releases
Strong oral and written communication skills
Proficiency working in a team environment
Preferred Qualifications:
Work in North Carolina
Work from Eastern US - Remote

Responsibilities

Qualifications
The Database Manager Administrator role requires 4 years of experience in the field with 2 or more years in a related complex data analytics environment as an individual contributor.
The Database Manager Administrator will be responsible for managing the administration of an organization's database.
Analyzes the organization's database needs and develops a long-term strategy for data storage.
Recommends policies and procedures related to data security and integrity and monitors and limits database access as needed.
Assists in the the design, maintenance and implementation of the systems that manage an internal database.
Familiarity with managing databases in a data analytics/unstructured data environment.

Knowledge of DoD Data Standards such as the Air Force Data Services Reference Architecture.
Experience supporting either the DoD Chief Data or Chief Software Offices
Air Force PlatformONE or CloudONE experience

Our Engineering group is seeking an accomplished SQL Server Database Administrator to join our talented team in Tulsa, OK. In this position, you will provide support for production systems and provide DBA services to application development teams, including database design, database generation, coding, and database production support. You will also support database environments with a high degree of customer service, technical expertise, and timeliness to ensure user productivity.

 As a Senior Database Administrator, you are instrumental in researching, evaluating, designing, testing, recommending, and planning implementation of new versions of MS SQL Server database and database tools. You may act as a team lead during database implementations and for system operation and maintenance.
Primary Responsibilities and Essential Duties:
Defines database strategy to support our cloud and on-prem database environments.
Develops automation for environment setup, configuration, deployment, and recovery.
Continual assessment of database performance and identification of problem areas.
Designs global solutions for multi-region high availability, cloud failover, and disaster recovery.
Works with engineering, support, and operations teams during design, development, and implementation of production applications.
Provides guidance and mentoring across the organization in all aspects of the supported areas.
Maintains awareness of industry developments, technology, and trends.
Reviews tools, technologies, and processes to make best practice recommendations.
Provides technical support for the database environment and provides guidance to the development team on new service implementations.
Leads database performance benchmarks and implements performance enhancements.
Manages day-to-day database support and maintenance activities, such as database backup and testing, to meet business and IT needs.
Develop, manage, and support 24x7 proactive monitoring and alerting for database environments, working with both cloud and development teams to resolve issues as part of on-call support rotation.
Logical and physical database design and documentation.
Translation of log files to actionable and measurable tasks.
Planning and execution of database migrations, combined with modernization, upgrades, transformation, and optimization.
Responsible for Database Server installation and configuration.
Infrastructure troubleshooting in partnership with server support team.
 Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in computer science or other business-related field or equivalent experience.
5+ years of experience as a DBA in a mixed Operating System environment.
5+ years of experience with MS SQL Server or Azure SQL.
5+ years of working experience in large enterprise(s).
Very strong knowledge and experience in DB performance tuning.
Knowledge of data modeling concepts.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with successful project management.
Preferred Skills:
Experience with Azure cloud technologies
Hands On experience with SQL Always-On technology
MS SQL certifications
Azure cloud certifications

Spathe Systems is a rapidly growing, Defense Contractor headquartered in Tampa, FL with satellite offices in Fayetteville, NC. As a fast, reliable, agile, and responsive services and solutions company, Spathe Systems enables operations by capitalizing on our diverse experiences within the Defense, Commercial and Academic Industries, delivering Innovative, Interoperable Technologies and leveraging strategic alliances with industry partners. Our niche spans C5I Systems Support, Workforce Modernization, and Mission Support. As a small business with a tight nit family feel, Spathe empowers its employees to solve problems and make decisions, while supporting and elevating the workforce with the responsibility and accountability to be successful.


Spathe is currently searching for a Database Engineer to join our team in the Tampa, FL area in support of the United States Special Operations Command (USSOCOM) Mission!


Clearance: Ability to attain Secret Security Clearance (Must be US Citizen)


Job Description:

Spathe is looking for an experienced, dedicated, and personable Database Engineer to join our team in Tampa FL! In this position you will support the USSOCOM Mobile DevSecOps training team. You will travel to various Theater Special Operations Command (TSOC) and Component locations, both CONUS and OCONUS, as part of a team to directly train USSOCOM resources in modern software development, Cloud, and DevSecOps principles. When not traveling, you will refine and support USSOCOM HQ Software Development, Cloud, and DevSecOps standards. In addition to evangelizing these changes within USSOCOM you will support Greenfield software development of new applications to support USSOCOM mission needs including but not limited to Azure, & AWS environments utilizing Docker Containers on a Kubernetes orchestrated PaaS. Design, develop, and deliver data solutions including database design, relational/non-relational modeling, and prototyping. Develop and document of data standards, design, and development of test plans. Execute testing and data solution debugging as well as implementation of a solution that follows efficient design techniques and development that meets and exceeds the solutions.


Job Duties/Responsibilities:

Provide support for the cross-functional Mobile DevSecOps team to ensure operations meet technical standards and deliver on productivity and quality goals. Helping customers architect scalable, highly available application solutions that leverage cloud services
Lead design and modeling of various USSOCOM applications
Provide Database design training in support of USSOCOM Mobile DevSecOps team
Build conceptual and logical data models for stakeholders and management
Train and develop existing USSOCOM resources in modern database management and microservices architecture
Utilize Agile software development and DevSecOps techniques
Experience with implementing DevSecOps practices such as infrastructure as code, continuous integration, and automated deployment
Creating repeatable patterns for deployments
Facilitating collaboration between application owners and cloud engineers
Respond to USSOCOM team needs in a timely fashion

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related analytical field or equivalent experience is preferred
Demonstrated technical leadership experience (direct supervisory experience preferred)
Have a passion for agile and DevSecOps methodologies.
Strong experience with Postgresql and MongoDB and/or other open source database technologies
Experience with data migration to cloud based environment
Experienced in sourcing, maintaining, and updating data
5 years of experience supporting multi-tier web applications.
3 years of experience handling workloads in large-scale environments.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working exclusively designing and implementing cloud native workloads
Experience with version control systems (Git, Perforce, SVN, TFS/VSTS/Azure DevOps).
Demonstrable experience of microservices architecture, container technology and K8s based PaaS solutions (OpenShift, PKS, etc.) – Desired requirement
Deep understanding of the design, deployment and management of cloud resources in numerous environments (AWS, Azure, etc.). – Desired requirement
Job Type:

Full-time


Additional Compensation:

Bonus potential


Work Location:

Tampa, Florida


Travel:

CONUS & OCONUS Required
No more than 60% – 70%


Benefits:

Health insurance
Dental insurance
Retirement plan
Paid time off


Schedule:

Monday to Friday with flexible work hours

Job Purpose
The Manager of Marketing Database & Reporting plays a critical role for the entire marketing organization by providing the most meaningful and accurate information to decision makers within the organization. This new team member will design, develop, and maintain various reports and dashboards for them, perform ad hoc analyses to help them improve the performance of campaigns and other marketing initiatives, and work closely with them to improve the existing business processes to support marketing operations.

Please note, this role is an individual contributor position and does not manager personnel.
What You Will Be Doing:
Database & Reporting:
 1) Ensure the marketing database houses accurate and useful information for performance reporting and decision making,
2) Design, develop and maintain marketing dashboards to enable company leaders and other marketing teams to evaluate, adjust and optimize marketing strategies,
3) Create ad hoc marketing reports as requested by company leaders and other marketing teams to solve business issues
4) Identify, define, and translate business needs/problems into the requirements for reporting and performance measurement by understanding organizational strategy and objectives
4) Work with IT and third-party vendors to continue to improve our marketing database and reporting capabilities
Marketing Performance Analysis:
1) Assess the results of our campaigns and other marketing initiatives from all angles by fully utilizing the information in the marketing database,
 2) Summarize his or her findings clearly and concisely and make recommendations to the decision makers in the marketing department,
3) Identify new opportunities to improve marketing performance based on a data-driven approach
Process Improvement:
Streamline or automate various processes to support marketing operations by utilizing the information in the marketing database and strong technical skills
Develop scalable, efficient, and automated processes for marketing performance measurement and reporting as well as quality control and problem detection

Communication & Project Ownership
Manage projects in their entirety and requires minimal direction and receive guidance when needed
Partner with senior team members to assess customer needs and define business questions and derive solutions
Communicate results and insights, both verbally and written (including visual graphics), in a clear and concise manner to analytical and non-technical business partners
Identify and communicate roadblocks
Work on multiple concurrent projects and accommodate frequent interruptions and changing priorities
Effectively participate in meetings with customers and emerging ability to guide discussion and decision making

Leadership:
Emerging ability to mentor junior team members
The essential functions listed represent the major duties of this role, additional duties may be assigned.
What You Must Have
5+ years related work experience to include marketing database maintenance/ownership and advanced report/dashboard development or similar role
Related Bachelor’s degree or additional related equivalent work experience Computer Science, Engineering, Math, MIS, Data Science, Business, or similar job related field of study

Additional Required Qualifications
Hands-on experience in developing automated performance reports as well as highly complex ad hoc reports utilizing a large-scale relational database
Expert proficiency in SQL or similar query language
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, including working knowledge of Pivot Table and look-up function
Understanding of core marketing concepts such as customer segmentation and break-even analysis
Ability to recognize data anomalies and identify possible causes independently
Communicate data-driven insights in clear and concise business language
Demonstrated proficiency in using other Microsoft Windows software (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Team player, organized and able to handle multiple projects
Positive attitude while working under tight deadlines
Strong analytical and communications skills
Strong attention to detail and troubleshooting/debugging/problem-solving skills

What We Would Prefer You Have:

Summary of Position:

VisitPay, an R1 Company, is looking for a Database Engineer who will focus mainly on optimization, automation, data quality, and governance. You will be responsible for making stable and long-term improvements to our data structures as well as improving database management and deployment processes with an eye to scalability and security. We are looking for an innovative, self-starter with a passion for data quality and efficiency. You have significant experience with Microsoft SQL Server and Azure, as well as modern database design and management. You enjoy working independently, planning and executing both large and small projects. You can estimate timing for projects, build a plan and meet the deadlines.
Key Activities:

Optimize SQL Server databases for OLTP needs as well as data warehousing
Automate processes relating to database management and deployment
Design and build data quality controls and monitoring
Audit databases and data infrastructure for slowly developing issues
Collaborate on solutions with DevOps, data engineers, and other developers
Thrive in a fast-paced start-up culture that expects great things every day

Competencies for success:

Adaptability to changing priorities, deadlines, and requirements
Communicate clearly to all stakeholders, including non-technical co-workers
Keep up with latest database management and governance techniques
Exposure to Agile development
Works effectively with remote team members

Qualifications:

Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in C.S., CIT/S, or data related field
5+ years’ experience with MS SQL Server
2+ years’ experience with Azure
Experience with cloud-based data warehousing is a plus
Exposure to modern ETL tools is helpful
Prefer exposure in the handling and security of sensitive data
Location:

This position is headquartered in Boise, ID. Remote work is available.
Sponsorship is not available for this position.


Why VisitPay?

VisitPay is an R1 company that works closely with some of the nation’s largest and most well-respected health systems to provide innovative and compelling SaaS-based products. We are poised to capture significant share in the massive and growing self-pay market. Our solutions help healthcare systems optimize their revenue while providing patients with a much improved and friendly billing experience.

With R1, VisitPay offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package, inclusive culture and commitment to a work-life balance with a team that strives to deliver outstanding results.

Overview

Pyramid Hotel Group “Pyramid” is a privately-owned Boston-based hotel and resort management company with a portfolio of properties in the United States, Caribbean and Europe. Pyramid is a full-service management company and provides a wide range of services including hotel management, asset management, project management, lender/receivership services, and consulting services. The company currently operates over 80 hotels, across all major brands, on behalf of numerous institutional capital groups and continues to pursue growth opportunities across all U.S. markets and abroad.

Due to recent growth, we are seeking to add a full-time Hybrid Remote Manager – Database Specialist/Analyst to our corporate team.

This position will join our Business Analytics & Reporting team to ensure database design objectives are reached. They will also partner with end users to support distributed dashboards and self-service data exploration. The ideal candidate should possess solid experience in using the SQL programming language and SSMS. They should also have the desire and proper background to take on other analytical and reporting responsibilities to facilitate career growth within our organization.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities Include:

Design and maintain Microsoft SQL databases in Azure cloud.
Provide proactive and reactive data management support.
Determine, enforce, and document database policies, procedures, and standards.
Develop queries to support data extraction needs.
Support financial reporting requirements and organization's needs & efforts toward data analytics.
Provide analytical support to the business/operation department in platforms outside of our database environment including Microsoft Dynamics.
Analyze financial and operational data and assist in creating tools and reports for decision support.
Identify and drive process improvements, including database tuning.
Perform other reasonable requests of management.
Assist in training staff (remote and in office) to achieve efficient and effective service delivery
Supports, manages and initiates change within the organization, taking steps to remove barriers or to accelerate progress
Maintain and develop web-based applications associated with our Azure environment
Other responsibilities as assigned by management.

College Degree or equivalent experience required
Experience with Microsoft SQL and the Azure cloud
Understanding of how Microsoft Dynamics, Power BI and the Microsoft Office Suite interacts with data.
Knowledge of common web & business application programming languages (Python, C+,Visual Basic,etc)

The American College of Radiology is a professional association serving over 40,000 members across the country. Consistent with the ACR’s mission to advance the practice of radiology and improve the health outcomes of the populations we serve, the ACR’s Center for Research and Innovation (CRI) has been a world leader in radiology clinical research for over 50 years. Over this period, the CRI has conducted clinical research trials and other research projects which have transformed the practice of radiology, informed the development of clinical practice standards, led to new device approvals, and changed healthcare policy.The CRI serves as the core radiology resource for NCI multicenter clinical trials involving diagnostic or therapeutic radiology. And, through active research committees in neuroradiology, cardiology, oncology, and pediatrics, the CRI has developed and delivered a diverse range of research studies in partnerships with academia and with commercial sponsors. Research studies range from prospective clinical trials to retrospective reader studies, novel imaging methods and imaging software, validation of biomarkers, radiomic feature analysis, and AI algorithm development and validation.Based on these strategic objectives, ACR is seeking a Clinical Data Manager to provide support to the ACR study initiatives across the College.Principal duties include: Review protocols and coordinate study set-up activities for trialsDefine data collection methods based on protocol aimsCollaborate with study team members and investigators to determine metadata specificationsProgram forms within the EDC system as per specificationsIdentify and program edit checks and online Web logic specificationsCreate calendar specifications for data collectionPerform user acceptance testingPrepare CRF and/or web entry completion guidelinesCreate standard, study specific, and ad hoc reportsPerform database updates as needed per protocol amendmentsPerform quality control review checks to ensure data integrityServe as a resource for site research associates to ensure adherence to protocol specifications.Qualified candidates will possess the following: 3+ years of related experience preferred. Professional nursing degree/other healthcare certification/Bachelor’s degree preferredExperience in a multi-modality clinical trials group or research team a plusCertified Medidata Rave Study Builder a plus.If you would like to put your experience to great use in a professional team-oriented environment, please apply online. Prudential’s Global Technology team is the spark that ignites the power of Prudential for our customers and employees worldwide. Our organization plays a critical and highly visible role in delivering customer-driven solutions across every area of the company. The Global Technology team is made up of diverse, agile-thinking, and highly skilled professionals; we use our combined capabilities to enable the organization with innovation, speed, agility, scalability and efficiency.
The Global Technology team takes great pride in our culture where digital transformation is built into our DNA. When you join the Global Technology organization at Prudential, you’ll unlock a challenging and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading financial services institutions.
Prudential’s Chief Data Office is seeking a Business Intelligence Data Engineer to own the technical development for the Business Intelligence team, valuing simplicity and willing to challenge technical constraints and procedures to achieve Agile design.
As a Data Engineer , the person will work with the agile product teams and Tech Lead to align technical execution to the overall strategy. The Data Engineer will build high quality data pipelines driving platform or product delivery . This person will work collaboratively across Prudential and third-party vendors to deliver a technology-led, intelligent platform that supports our customer’s success.
The role requires deep understanding of data architecture, data engineering, data analysis and reporting. The successful candidate must have deep technical domain subject matter experience, execution and operations of data analytics platforms, experience creating data products (e.g., ingestion, consumption, data models supporting analytic solutions) .
Responsibilities:
Design, develop, optimize and maintain data architecture and pipelines that adhere to ETL principles and business goals.
Partner with Product Owner, Tech Lead and developers on team to develop technical architecture for strategic enterprise initiatives.
Understands the enterprise data architecture and aligns the design of the data models accordingly (e.g., domain-based or business view models)
Advise, consult, mentor and coach other data and analytic professionals on data standards and prac tices.
Foster a culture of sharing, re-use, design for scale stability, and operational efficiency of data and analytical solutions.
Lead the evaluation, implementation, and deployment of emerging tools and process to improve our productivity as a team.
Skills / Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, Business Administration, or a related field
Expertise in SQL and data analysis and experience with at least one programming language ( e.g., Python).
Experience developing and maintaining data warehouses in big data solutions.
Conceptual knowledge of data and analytics, such as dimensional modeling, ETL , reporting tools, data governance, warehousing, structured and unstructured data.
Excellent communication, listening, and influencing skills .
Self-motivated with strong problem-solving and learning skills.
Strong wor k ethic, consultative skills and attitude to thrive in fast-paced team environment.
Preferred:
Experience / aptitude with BI and data visualization packages.
Database development experience using Hadoop or BIgQuery and experience with a variety of relational, NoSQL, and cloud database technologies.
Experience in Agile Development
Experience of Agile infrastructure, environments, and deployment strategies / technologies to drive efficient working practices .
Understands relationship between Product Owner, Scrum Master, and rest of team, with a strong sense of design thinking

advantageComfortable with relational data modeling and database system (RDBMS) designBasic understanding of database administration and experience with modern databases (SQL Server, Oracle)Should be process and detail orientedResponsibilitiesParticipate in the analysis and composition of requirementsReview code, write documentation and follow test proceduresEnsure that database servers back up is as per the business’s Recovery Point Objectives (RPO)Conduct test backups to verify that business’ Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) are metBe available to troubleshoot SQL Server service outages even Job Title: Sr. GIS Data Architect / Project Manager
Description: Sr. GIS Data Architect / Project ManagerInnovate! Inc. is seeking a highly motivated individual to join its geospatial solutions team as a Sr. GIS Data Architect/Project Manager in support of expanding Innovate’s business footprint in Salt Lake City, Utah.Our team is looking for well-organized, self-directed applicants who have experience with the ArcGIS suite of desktop and server software as well as with developing desktop and web-based GIS applications using a variety of programming languages. You will be responsible for leading a team of technical professionals to manage large and small GIS projects. You may be called upon to assist with the design, development, and maintenance of geospatial applications through concept, design, and implementation phases. Your role will also include supporting other personnel in utilizing GIS applications and software as well as interfacing with clients and teaming partners.The candidate must have a “let me at it” attitude who can adapt to a fluid work environment and an occasionally demanding schedule. In return, you will be a part of a motivated, highly skilled team and contribute to the growth and positive direction of our company.*Contingent upon contract being awarded*LOCATIONCandidate can work remotely but needs to be in Salt Lake City, UT.RESPONSIBILITIES· Participate in needs assessments/requirements, meetings, and document solutions for GIS enterprise use.· Installation and configuration of ArcGIS Server software.· Provide/write GIS system technical recommendations, standard operating procedures, administrative and help documents for clients and technical teams.· Assess customer's existing GIS environments and recommend areas for improvements in application technology, system performance, and software migration plans.· Communicate with architects and developers to successfully deploy custom solutions.· Write and execute test plans.· Troubleshoot solution errors and support end users.· Present system design information to technical and non-technical audiences.· Create mapping, imagery, and data services.· Prepare Agile/Scrum meetings and sprints with team and client.· Client and Subcontractor Complexity, serves a single client or multiple clients and may require developing and managing program plans across several subcontractors and multiple, distinct technology areas.SKILLS AND ABILITIES· Ability to work with ArcGIS Desktop tools, ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Online, ArcGIS Web Application Builder· Ability to design and implement enterprise spatial solutions· Subject Matter Expert (SME) for GIS data workflows and versioned editing· Ability to troubleshoot issues with system implementation· Ability to manage GIS data within at least one of the following: Oracle, MS SQL Server, and/or PostgreSQL database environments.· Ability to use geospatial data and developing applications for visualization, analysis, and presentation of geospatial data.· Ability to develop GIS applications using two of the following: Python, JavaScript, C#, ArcObjects, or related programming languages.· Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills· Ability to quickly learn new technologies, work independently, and quick turnaround maps, application prototypes or deliverables· Knowledge and understanding of GIS principals, theories, and practices· Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)· Hands-on experience with various database systems, e.g., SQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL, etc. Ability to analyze business processes and systems and migrate to/integrate with geospatial systemsEDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE· At least 6 years of geospatial database development and management experience or equivalent college level course work· B.S. or Graduate Degree in Geography/GIS, Science, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent experience· Experience with ESRI products suite including mobile, desktop, server, and database· Experience managing one or more hosting platforms (servers, virtual machines, Amazon, Azure, etc.)· Experience in web design/development and understanding of Web 2.0 concepts· 5-7 years of direct experience as a Project Manager in an IT and/or software development environment· Experience working with project management principles, policies, and procedures· 3+ years of enterprise-level GIS technology experience· 3+ years of direct experience working with Esri GIS Tools and applications· Demonstrated experience integrating multiple enterprise technologies in an enterprise environment· Scripting or programming experience (e.g., Python, SQL, or HTML)LEARN MORE ABOUT US Innovate! Inc. is a woman and minority-owned company passionate about the dynamic benefits of providing effective management consulting, IT support, and geospatial technology for the federal government. We believe that thinking innovatively can achieve positive results in organizations that lead to cultural and business change. This belief and our ability to deliver cutting-edge solutions were recognized with Innovate being named 2012 Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Outstanding 8(a) Small Business of the Year. Innovate is a fast-paced, rapidly growing group of entrepreneurs creating a culture of excellence. Rapid advancement within our organization is not only possible, it is encouraged.To view our website, visit www.innovateteam.com.Innovate! Inc. proactively fulfills its role as an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, marital status, physical or mental disability, status as a Disabled Veteran, Recently Separated Veteran, Active-Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran, Armed Forces Services Medal, or any other characteristic protected by law.Apply on our Career page: Innovate Public Job Board. Your cover letter must include your salary requirements (residents of MA are exempt from this request). If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at 703.922.9090 x5.Job Types: Full-time, ContractBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offRetirement planVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftApplication Question(s):Do you have a Bachelors's Degree in Geography/GIS, Science, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent experience?Do you have experience with ESRI products suite including mobile, desktop, server, and database?Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:ArcGIS: 6 years (Required)Project Management: 6 years (Required)Enterprise GIS Technology: 3 years (Preferred)Work Location:One locationFully RemoteWork Remotely:Yes

Journey with us! Combine your career goals and sense of adventure by joining our exciting team of employees. Royal Caribbean Group is pleased to offer a competitive compensation & benefits package, and excellent career development opportunities, each offering unique ways to explore the world.

The Senior Manager, Database Platforms is a technical manager who is responsible for the development and execution of technical goals and strategies within Information Technology for the company's Database Platforms and tools. The Senior Manager Database Platforms will also focus on driving innovation for emerging database technologies - help shape the future of the next generation platform for database services. This role works closely with Enterprise Architecture, Infrastructure, Delivery, Governance, and IT leadership teams to provide operational direction, implementation, and support for IT solutions related to database platforms and tools. He/she will be accountable for driving operational excellence in the overall maintenance of our database platforms and tools, develop database standards, ensure availability, resilience, performance, security, and regulatory compliance. The Senior Manager, Database Platforms will report on project progress and operational metrics to executives and various stakeholders at the enterprise level.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Lead a highly technical team responsible for ensuring the integrity, availability and security of multiple database platforms, data integration tools and cloud infrastructure disciplines, requiring specialized administration support.
Lead recruitment efforts to attract, retain high quality and diverse talent
Collaborate with senior management and other peers for strategy development and execution planning
Lead our journey to the cloud and as a service model for database platforms where possible
Develop project and funding proposals for programs that provide continuous delivery of cost-effective Database Platform and Application administration solutions that meet business requirements.
Develop and track staffing plans and ensures the team is adequately staffed with skilled professionals.
Define roadmaps and use cases directly with business and technology leaders to modernize our database platforms (IBMi, MS SQL, Oracle, MySQL); NoSQL (Couchbase), Ne04j including big data management and capability stack which include data movement, high availability, disaster recovery, security, compliance, analytics, and artificial intelligence.
Lead the Database Platform and Application Administration team for delivering, installing, and providing 24/7 global operational support, reliability, performance and continuous improvement for database platform and application administration.
Define, optimize, and implement procedures and policies, as well as organizational activities and initiatives
Performs other duties as required. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to perform any other job-related duties assigned by their supervisor or management

FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage labor and non-labor budgets of $4M USD or more
Develop business case and cost/benefit analysis for Database Platform & Applications Administration capital requests, support operations spending and initiatives.
Responsible for defining optimization opportunities to manage expenses
Solid understanding of IT estimation activities. May lead large/complex estimation activities

QUALIFICATIONS:
A minimum of 10 years relevant Database Platform experience or in a related area
Bachelor's degree (Master's degree preferred) in Computer Sciences, Computer Engineering, or Information Systems, or equivalent experience
Demonstrates extensive knowledge and capabilities across a variety of database platforms and tools

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Technical experience and subject matter expert with various Database Platforms, emerging database platforms, packaged Enterprise Resource Planning systems, operating systems, storage options, networking, and security. Familiar with tools to manage these various environments.
Strong background in sourcing, implementing, and managing Managed Services, vendor relationships and contracts.
Strong leadership skills; proven experience in leading and developing technical professionals and influencing leaders
Remain current with industry best practices, trends, innovation, and emerging technologies in database platforms and tools in the marketplace
Capable of making independent decisions that impact IT and/or business strategy
Build a high-performant on-shore/off-shore database delivery team to ensure 24/7 database coverage.
Experience with Agile/Dev Ops methodologies and tools
Experience with any Cloud (AWS, Azure, Oracle) database platform offerings and solutions
Subject matter expertise with database high availability solutions such as cluster, replication, standby
Strong knowledge of project management principles and disciplines; highly proficient in a few areas including governance, financial and benefits realization, business case development etc.
Demonstrates strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Effective verbal, presentation, written and listening communications skills
Accepts accountability and manages execution of individual and team results at corporate and divisional level

Specific requirements that are essential parts of the job should be described clearly and precisely below. Examples: lifting, standing for extended periods of time, hearing, carrying, moving, pulling/pushing, climbing etc.
The successful candidate must be able to sit for extended periods of time. Employees are required to attend meetings and work in conference rooms with others.

Work Environment:
List working environment or conditions that describe those encountered in performing the job functions (inside /outside the office, travel, shipboard, noise level etc.)
The position will require occasional travel onboard our vessels and to other locations, domestic and international.

Company Overview
Plexium is a pharmaceutical company focused on developing first-in-class therapeutics by targeting and modulating E3 ligases. Our propriety DELPhe platform enables us to disrupt and redefine high-throughput screening through the use of miniaturization. We are leveraging our DELPhe platform to develop novel small molecule modulators of E3 ligases to uncover new therapeutic biology.

Position Summary
This position is for innovative people who geek out over data and have fun creating new systems. The Database Manager designs, builds and oversees the deployment and operation of technology architecture, solutions and software to capture, manage, store and utilize structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources
Essential Job Responsibilities
Lead initiatives to design and build data storage/data lakes, APIs, information dashboards, and other end-user information portals or resources
Design and develop databases for capture and retrieval of complex data and metadata
Develop technical tools and programming that leverage artificial intelligence, machine learning and big-data techniques to cleanse, organize and transform data and to maintain, defend and update data structures and integrity on an automated basis
Develop capability to integrate public database query outputs into Plexium informatics workflows
Create and establishes design standards and assurance processes for software, systems and applications development
Source and manage interactions with software service providers to meet data user needs
Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Informatics, computer science, or a related scientific field
8 years’ experience in the use and design of cloud-based information systems
Skills/Knowledge
Ability to develop and deploy cloud platforms
Expertise working with big data (omics) using EMR, SPARK, JavaScript, Python/R technologies
Expert knowledge working within AWS infrastructure such as Athena, Glue Studio and Data glue
Proficient in DevOps, CI/CD, and test-driven development
Ability to work in an agile and rapid changing environment with high quality deliverables and is considered a subject matter expert in the technical area of expertise
Excellent oral and written communications skills, business acumen with problem solving and analytical skills

Current Employees:
If you are a current Staff, Faculty or Temporary employee at the University of Miami, please click here to log in to Workday to use the internal application process. To learn how to apply for a faculty or staff position using the Career worklet, please review this tip sheet .
Transforming Lives
The University of Miami is among the top research universities and academic medical centers in the nation, and one of the largest private employers in South Florida.
With more than 16,000 faculty and staff, the University strives for excellence, and is driven by a powerful mission to transform and impact the lives of its students, patients, members of the community, and people across the globe.
The University is committed to fostering a culture of belonging, where everyone feels valued and has the opportunity to add value. Through values of Diversity, Integrity, Responsibility, Excellence, Compassion, Creativity, and Teamwork (DIRECCT) the U community works together to create an environment driven by purpose, excellence, community, and service.
The Department of Information Technology has an exciting opportunity for a Full-time Senior Database Administrator to work remote. The Senior Database Administrator designs, implements, and maintains complex databases, including back-up, performance tuning, capacity planning, monitoring critical events, and documentation to ensure optimum system performance and efficiency.
Creates ad-hoc reports utilizing various data sources.
Develops data models and performs planning of architecture, functions, modules, recovery, standards, and implementation.
Provides primary support for the daily operations of database systems and serves as liaison to customs.
Plans, coordinates, and administers database systems including base definition, structure, documentation, requirements, and operational guidelines and protection.
Works on a variety of development and maintenance projects.
Works closely with developers and business users on system requirements, analysis, design, and implementation.
Provides guidance to technical staff on concepts and best practices.
Provides strategic advice on architecture and technology of database design, use, and administration.
Participates in the testing and implementation of new or enhanced database systems.
Establishes and maintains databases for user testing purposes and production.
Analyzes and determines information needs and elements, data relationships and attributes, data flow and storage requirements, and data output and reporting capabilities.
Researches and evaluates alternatives and recommends solutions for business issues.
This list of duties and responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties or responsibilities as necessary.
CORE QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field
Minimum 6 years of relevant experience
Knowledge of business and management principles.
Ability to direct, manage, implement, and evaluate department operations.
Ability to establish department goals, and objectives that support the strategic plan.
Ability to effectively plan, delegate and/or supervise the work of others.
Ability to lead, motivate, develop, and train others.
Any appropriate combination of relevant education, experience and/or certifications may be considered.
The University of Miami offers competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, tuition remission and more.
UHealth-University of Miami Health System, South Florida's only university-based health system, provides leading-edge patient care powered by the ground breaking research and medical education at the Miller School of Medicine. As an academic medical center, we are proud to serve South Florida, Latin America and the Caribbean. Our physicians represent more than 100 specialties and sub-specialties, and have more than one million patient encounters each year. Our tradition of excellence has earned worldwide recognition for outstanding teaching, research and patient care. We're the challenge you've been looking for.
Patient safety is a top priority. As a result, during the Influenza ("the flu") season (September through April), the University Of Miami Miller School Of Medicine requires all employees who provide ongoing services to patients, work in a location (all Hospitals and clinics) where patient care is provided, or work in patient care or clinical care areas, to have an annual influenza vaccination. Failure to meet this requirement will result in rescinding or termination of employment.

Our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. We're transforming the workplace experience through the power of transparency. As the worldwide leader in employer branding and insights, our vision is for a world where transparency empowers the workforce and motivates companies to become better employers.

Please note this role is open to remote hiring. Our main office locations are in San Francisco, CA, Chicago, IL, Uniontown, OH and London, Eng.

About the Role

As a Lead Database Administrator, you'll play a key role in developing our technology base and helping the company move forward to a more current technology stack. You'll be responsible for all aspects of database administration for our production and development database environments that support nearly 70+ million unique users a month (and growing). We currently have multiple production OLTP databases, a data warehouse and a half dozen staging and QA database servers.

Our DBA team focuses on creating, configuring and maintaining SQL Server and Postgres databases. In addition, they own our DR and HA strategies, and play an important part in setting the technology trends and standards we will be building upon in the future.

In this role you will work with a small, collaborative team of engineers and product managers – so good social and interpersonal skills are also a requirement. Most importantly, we're looking for an individual who can prioritize, multi-task, and deliver high-quality solutions.

Compensation: $144,000.00 - $180,000.00
At Glassdoor, operating transparently is at the heart of everything we do. That's why we let job seekers know that salary ranges may differ for jobs depending on where these positions are filled. It's no secret that the cost of living and other economic considerations vary widely across the country and the world.

At Glassdoor we apply a "tier" system to promote consistency in level of compensation for where roles are filled in different locations. The tiers are as follows:

Tier 1 encompasses the highest salary range for states where large metropolitan areas are located (ie: San Francisco, New York City, Washington DC, & etc)
Tier 2 encompasses salary ranges 15% less than those in Tier 1 for states with mid-sized cities (ie: Chicago, Dallas, Portland, etc)
Tier 3 encompasses salary ranges 20% less than those in Tier 1 for states with smaller
cities (including our Ohio office, Nevada, etc)

You can learn more about our compensation philosophy here and see salary ranges for all Glassdoor jobs here.
What You'll Do

As one of a team of 4, you'll need to be a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment – which means wearing many hats, being able to change direction quickly, and showing an eagerness to learn new technologies as the needs arise. You love to tackle problems and take independent action, seek out new responsibilities, act on opportunities, and generate new ideas

What You'll Bring
7+ years SQL Server Database Administration
Currently working with SQL Server 2019 with AlwaysOn Availability Groups in high volume, high availability production database systems
Production experience with Postgres
Experience with Cassandra and MongoDB a huge plus
Extensive knowledge of AWS - EC2 and RDS are required
Experience with both Windows and Linux administration highly desired
Experienced at troubleshooting performance issues related to CPU, memory, I/O, disk space and other types of resource contention
Expertise in disaster recovery and high availability for SQL Server and Postgres
Knowledge of partitioning strategies and having worked with very large tables
Experience with PowerShell and/or other scripting languages highly preferred
A strong desire and ability to add to our culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion
Why Glassdoor?
100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage, with 80% dependent coverage.
Equity Incentives in our parent company's ADR (Recruit Holdings, Stock ID: 6098T).
Annual 10% bonus aligning with bi-annual performance reviews.
401(k) Plan with a Company Match to prepare for your future.
Generous paid holidays and open paid time off.
Our Commitments
Transparency: We are open and honest. We share information – the good and the bad – so we can continuously learn, collaborate and make the right decisions. Pay bands, our compensation philosophy, and employee feedback survey responses are shared publicly.
Innovation: We actively pursue new and different ways to further Glassdoor's mission. We forge our own path by challenging the status quo. The ultimate goal is not just to change how we operate at Glassdoor, but for every employer to follow our lead!
Good People: We work together with integrity, respect and compassion for one another. We have fun together! We are inclusive, fair and humble while remaining confident. We do the right thing, period.
GRIT: We are resilient, inventive and fearless. We see challenges as opportunities. With passion and courage, we come together to get the job done.
Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: We are dedicated to building a company that is more diverse and representative of society at large. Glassdoor externally publishes our Diversity & Inclusion report and information about our employee population to hold ourselves accountable to our dedication. We also provide programs and resources to build a greater sense of belonging for our employees.

Scripps Health Administrative Services supports our five hospitals and 19 outpatient facilities, which treat half a million patients annually through 2,600 affiliated physicians.
At Scripps Health, you will experience the pride, support, respect that has been repeatedly recognized as one of the nation’s Top 100 Places to Work.
You’ll be surrounded by people committed to making a difference in the lives of their patients and their teammates. So if you’re open to change, go ahead and unlock your potential.
The Manager of Donor Services will provide key leadership support for the Scripps Health Foundation department. This individual will be responsible for maintaining, upgrading, and modifying the features and functionality of the foundation's CRM tool. Oversees system conversions, manages data integrity and security, and ensures reports are accurate and timely. Knowledge of implementation and support of donor information systems: CRM and web development/strategy and in business practices for fundraising enterprise. Experience managing a system that stores data in a SQL database. Ability to deploy and manage digital campaigns through platforms such as bb/raisers edge. Experience managing gift processing related functionalities.
Other job duties include:
Support administrative and management staff on financial management activities related to fundraising.
Communicate and collaborate with staff to understand data needs.
Produce reports which support the fundraising efforts of the organization and secure reporting data in the CRM system.
Identify areas of improvement, and commonalities between requests and work with management to prioritize various requests.
Provide Analytics on digital and direct mail campaigns.
Ability to manage and produce ad hoc reporting as necessary.
This is a full time, benefit eligible leadership position located in San Diego.

Required Education/Experience/Specialized Skills:
Five years of progressive experience with system administration and application support.
Attention to detail, accuracy, workflow and time management.
Strong data analytical and data manipulation skills.
Highly customer oriented and able to communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical users.
Business process experience, applications management and end user support.
Comfortable in varied organizational relationships.

Journey with us! Combine your career goals and sense of adventure by joining our exciting team of employees. Royal Caribbean Group is pleased to offer a competitive compensation & benefits package, and excellent career development opportunities, each offering unique ways to explore the world.

The Senior Manager, Database Platforms is a technical manager who is responsible for the development and execution of technical goals and strategies within Information Technology for the company's Database Platforms and tools. The Senior Manager Database Platforms will also focus on driving innovation for emerging database technologies - help shape the future of the next generation platform for database services. This role works closely with Enterprise Architecture, Infrastructure, Delivery, Governance, and IT leadership teams to provide operational direction, implementation, and support for IT solutions related to database platforms and tools. He/she will be accountable for driving operational excellence in the overall maintenance of our database platforms and tools, develop database standards, ensure availability, resilience, performance, security, and regulatory compliance. The Senior Manager, Database Platforms will report on project progress and operational metrics to executives and various stakeholders at the enterprise level.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Lead a highly technical team responsible for ensuring the integrity, availability and security of multiple database platforms, data integration tools and cloud infrastructure disciplines, requiring specialized administration support.
Lead recruitment efforts to attract, retain high quality and diverse talent
Collaborate with senior management and other peers for strategy development and execution planning
Lead our journey to the cloud and as a service model for database platforms where possible
Develop project and funding proposals for programs that provide continuous delivery of cost-effective Database Platform and Application administration solutions that meet business requirements.
Develop and track staffing plans and ensures the team is adequately staffed with skilled professionals.
Define roadmaps and use cases directly with business and technology leaders to modernize our database platforms (IBMi, MS SQL, Oracle, MySQL); NoSQL (Couchbase), Ne04j including big data management and capability stack which include data movement, high availability, disaster recovery, security, compliance, analytics, and artificial intelligence.
Lead the Database Platform and Application Administration team for delivering, installing, and providing 24/7 global operational support, reliability, performance and continuous improvement for database platform and application administration.
Define, optimize, and implement procedures and policies, as well as organizational activities and initiatives
Performs other duties as required. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to perform any other job-related duties assigned by their supervisor or management

FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage labor and non-labor budgets of $4M USD or more
Develop business case and cost/benefit analysis for Database Platform & Applications Administration capital requests, support operations spending and initiatives.
Responsible for defining optimization opportunities to manage expenses
Solid understanding of IT estimation activities. May lead large/complex estimation activities

QUALIFICATIONS:
A minimum of 10 years relevant Database Platform experience or in a related area
Bachelor's degree (Master's degree preferred) in Computer Sciences, Computer Engineering, or Information Systems, or equivalent experience
Demonstrates extensive knowledge and capabilities across a variety of database platforms and tools

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Technical experience and subject matter expert with various Database Platforms, emerging database platforms, packaged Enterprise Resource Planning systems, operating systems, storage options, networking, and security. Familiar with tools to manage these various environments.
Strong background in sourcing, implementing, and managing Managed Services, vendor relationships and contracts.
Strong leadership skills; proven experience in leading and developing technical professionals and influencing leaders
Remain current with industry best practices, trends, innovation, and emerging technologies in database platforms and tools in the marketplace
Capable of making independent decisions that impact IT and/or business strategy
Build a high-performant on-shore/off-shore database delivery team to ensure 24/7 database coverage.
Experience with Agile/Dev Ops methodologies and tools
Experience with any Cloud (AWS, Azure, Oracle) database platform offerings and solutions
Subject matter expertise with database high availability solutions such as cluster, replication, standby
Strong knowledge of project management principles and disciplines; highly proficient in a few areas including governance, financial and benefits realization, business case development etc.
Demonstrates strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Effective verbal, presentation, written and listening communications skills
Accepts accountability and manages execution of individual and team results at corporate and divisional level
Physical Demands:
List specific physical requirements that an employee must meet in order to perform the job duties with or without a reasonable accommodation. Specific requirements that are essential parts of the job should be described clearly and precisely below. Examples: lifting, standing for extended periods of time, hearing, carrying, moving, pulling/pushing, climbing etc.
The successful candidate must be able to sit for extended periods of time. Employees are required to attend meetings and work in conference rooms with others.

Work Environment:
List working environment or conditions that describe those encountered in performing the job functions (inside /outside the office, travel, shipboard, noise level etc.)
The position will require occasional travel onboard our vessels and to other locations, domestic and international.

Learning.com is a national leader in providing digital literacy solutions that help prepare students for online assessments, school, college, and their future careers. The company offers a complete digital literacy curriculum for grades K-8 that engages students as they develop critical skills such as keyboarding, business applications, online safety, computational thinking, and coding. Founded in 1999, Learning.com currently partners with one in six U.S. school districts and serves more than 1 million students each year. The company has earned more than 30 industry awards, including ISTE 2017 Best of Show, 2017 Award of Excellence from "Tech & Learning Magazine", "The Oregonian's Top Workplace" for 2021, 2020, 2018, 2017, 2016 and "Healthiest Workplaces" for 2021, 2020, 2019.
Summary
The Database Administrator ensures all database systems are functional and operating at peak efficiency with high system availability, protecting the security and integrity of the company's databases and systems. Working for the premier provider of web-delivered curriculum and assessment, this is an opportunity to make a real impact on the learning outcomes of nearly 2 million students using our products to learn about technology, math, and science.
Responsibilities
Proactively monitor databases and database servers to include SQL, Redis, and Aurora. Proactively monitor warehouse, data lake, data lakehouses, and/or data marts
Identify and resolve database performance and maintenance issues. Tune stored procedures and indexes to maximize performance
Provide 24/7 support to ensure high availability for all data and database systems
Automate the database release process and other common tasks to improve operational efficiencies
Audit and manage database security
Develop and implement archival and deidentification strategy and processes
Recommend server configurations for future capacity planning of production and development environments
Evaluate database-related tools and vendors and advocate for their integration into our environment when appropriate
Identify threats to system integrity (security threats, DR incidents, data corruption), develop policies, determine appropriate precautions, create measurable standards, document procedures, implement changes, and perform ongoing maintenance to ensure business continuity during unplanned events
Other duties as assigned
Supervisory Responsibilities: Individual contributor
Qualifications
Must be collaborative, adaptable, self-driven, dependable, and customer focused
Firm understanding of the networking equipment and concepts, web applications, networking, load balancing, high availability technologies, and disaster recovery architecture
Technical and troubleshooting skills is required; candidates should have experience in some of the following areas:
Strong administration experience with SQL Server
Solid skills with Transact-SQL, database/database server optimization, backup/recovery, security architecture, replication/log shipping, indexing
SQL tools such as Profiler, DTA, SQLCMD, SSIS, SSMS and BIDS
SQL clustering
Experience managing database objects in source control and using schema management tools such as RedGate, SSDT, etc
Must be willing and able to work evenings and weekends when necessary
Location: Remote
Working Conditions
Work involves talking, hearing, using hands to handle, feel or operate objects, tools, or controls, and reaching with hands and arms. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus.
General Information:
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required of personnel so classified. Management has the right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to his job at any time.
Learning.com is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, Veteran, or disability status

Student Information Database Manager with SQL Experience

Acture Solutions of Westchester, NY is looking to hire a full-time Student Information Database Manager with SQL Experience. Do you want to work on the cutting edge of IT innovation and further your career within an inventive and collaborative culture? Would you like to work for a people-first company that treats each employee with incredible respect? Are you seeking to grow your IT skillset in a supportive environment? If so, please read on!
This Database Engineer position earns top-of-industry pay of $75,000 - $85,000/year, depending on experience, technical knowledge, and industry certifications. We also offer a selection of 100%-employer-sponsored health care plans, a generous retirement plan, unlimited paid time off (PTO), and employer-sponsored continuing education. If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, apply today!

ABOUT ACTURE SOLUTIONS
Delivering technology solutions since 1984, we are a rapidly growing managed services provider that provides digital transformation services to a diverse customer base. Our services encompass networking, data center, cybersecurity, physical security, and collaboration tools that help businesses, schools, medical centers, and governments deliver services digitally. We grew up servicing the needs of large school districts across New York State. As a result, our team acquired the skills necessary to work across a large diversity of environments with highly sensitive data security. With a decades-long legacy of helping customers work smarter and drive results, we are focused on delivering positive outcomes and customer satisfaction. We treat everyone as a family, from customers to employees.
We have a performance-driven culture with a growth mindset. Our employees are constantly challenged in their work and are encouraged to make mistakes and learn from those mistakes. We sincerely believe in the power of our team-centric approach. As long as the job is getting done, strong contributors enjoy significant amounts of freedom in their work. We trust our employees to determine the hours and location for work that best suits them. And, time off is encouraged. We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity.

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A Student Information Database Manager with SQL Experience
As a Student Information Database Manager with SQL Experience, you play an essential role in maintaining the respect we have earned within the industry. Since people are our product, you are expected to power our future growth. You are the lifeblood of the talent pool for our database organization – from training junior talent to responding to customer needs – the Student Information Database Manager with SQL Experience is a leader within the team. With an exceptional focus on our customer’s needs, you are the first point of contact for end-users experiencing issues with database problems. You save the day for them with your clear, level-headed, and friendly support.

QUALIFICATIONS FOR A Student Information Database Manager with SQL Experience:
5-7 years of experience in student information database management or other information database management responsibilities.
Experienced administering Student Management / Learning Management systems, such as Infinite Campus, PowerSchool, Canvas, Schoology (or experience with similar software).
Experienced MS SQL programmer including scripts, stored procedures, views. Familiar with MS SQL Server tools including SQL Management Console, Query Analyzer, SSIS, creating packages, BCP, SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services).
Experienced with Crystal Reports including creating reports and publishing with MS IIS and Visual Studio to make reports available to users.
Experienced with Microsoft Office, including good excel skills. Some experience with MS IIS, Visual Studio.
Familiar working with file formats for transferring data between systems, including Excel, CSV, and various text file formats.
Exceptional customer service skills.
Are you an active listener with the ability to explain technical information in layman's terms? Do you have a positive attitude? Will you consistently work hard for the team? Do you have intellectual curiosity and a desire to continuously improve? Can you think on your feet? Are you organized and able to effectively prioritize multiple tasks? Do you take the time to help and mentor fellow teammates? Are you a creative thinker who is always looking for ways to improve processes? Can you move from one task to another efficiently? If so, you might just be perfect for this Student Information Database Manager with SQL Experience position!

WORK SCHEDULE
This full-time Student Information Database Manager with SQL Experience position typically works Monday - Friday, 7:30 AM - 4:00 PM with a 30-minute lunch break.

Southwest will provide a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share externally with every Southwest Customer.

Customer / Business Orientation:
Provides Leadership and coaching for team.
Completes tasks independently / interdependently.
Consequences of error carry a high risk to the organization.
Focus on internal and external Customer requirements.
Provides Leadership in key interactions with business Customers to define, analyze, and deliver Customer requirements.
Demonstrates advanced understanding of business processes being supported by assigned system(s).
Demonstrated proficient understanding of business processes across multiple business Customers.
Project Management:
Provide Leadership as a communications liaison between the business Customer and the technology development and support groups.
Develop time estimates for project schedules, monitor progress, and provide accurate and timely reports.
Plan and manage project activities within allocated resources.
Manage resolution of problems and escalate as required.
Work across projects to synchronize data analysis efforts and deliverables.
Negotiate and manage team relationships at project level.
Support the organization’s project management policy, practice, and methodology.
Problem Solving:
Employ productivity aids in all aspects of assignments.
Analyze and resolve complex or multiple problems.
Independently research and recommends alternative actions for problem resolution.
Systems Development Engineering:
Provide Leadership to design, create, implement, and support complex databases to meet project and system design requirements.
Implement complex changes to existing databases.
Provide Leadership for installation and configuration of new database engines and upgrades to new product releases.
Implement physical data models at a project, or corporate level.
Create, document, and administer, and document database backup and recovery plans, capacity plans and security plans to meet project requirements.
Testing / Deliverable Quality:
Plan tests for new products and database engine releases to ensure features and functions are acceptable and integrated across systems software and platforms.
Production Support:
Analyze and resolve highly complex problems.
Recommend database and system management tools as required.
Proactively investigate / troubleshoot database, technical and systems problems and direct / assure corrective action.
Work with application teams to recommend process or system enhancements.
Provide general technical support to Services and Development groups.
24X7 duty required for on-call rotation.
Financial Accountability:
Develop volume and cost estimates.
Must be able to meet any physical ability requirements listed on this description.
May perform other job duties as directed by Employee’s Leaders.
Qualifications:

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
High School Diploma, GED or equivalent education required.


Must be at least 18 years of age.


Must have authorization to work in the United States as defined by the Immigration Reform Act of 1986.


EDUCATION:
High school diploma or equivalency required.
BS, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, and/or equivalent formal training preferred.
WORK EXPERIENCE:
7 or more years (or equivalent knowledge base) work experience in Engineering and / or Information Technology – Database environment required.
Demonstrates experience with computer / network systems / hardware and software development methodology / processes obtained through formal training, education and / or work experience.
Experience with design and development of multiple database engines required.
Minimum 2 years experience as a technical or team lead required.
SKILLS/ABILITIES/KNOWLEDGE/WORK STYLE:
Core Knowledge:
Advanced knowledge of physical database design, capacity planning, security planning, backup and recovery systems, operating systems, data modeling, query language, multiple database engines, performance and testing, and software development concepts and technology.
Advanced knowledge of computer / network systems / hardware and software development methodology and process.
Advanced knowledge of technical / business environments.
Critical Skills:
Excellent partnering, communication, and negotiation skills, so as to gather and communicate business Customer requirements to technology development and support groups.
Ability to provide leadership within a specific technology area, or across multiple technology areas, to complete root-cause analysis, design solutions, write code, perform testing, provide documentation, and implement large / multiple development projects.
Ability to coach the technical development of less senior DBA’s.
Ability to analyze and resolve multiple, complex problems.
Ability to manage projects using the organization’s project management methodology.
Ability to work effectively in a strong Customer service / team oriented environment.
Must be able to comply with Company attendance standards as described in established guidelines.


OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:
Consistently recognized as a top performer in the job title by both Employees and Leadership.
Must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by start date to comply with Executive Order 14042, which requires employees of federal contractors to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
Must maintain a well-groomed appearance per Company appearance standards as described in established guidelines.
Please print/save the job description because it won't be available after you apply.
