SUMMARY:
Responsible for implementation and day-to-day maintenance and monitoring of SQL Server, Azure SQL, and Oracle databases supporting AF Group’s critical business processes and continually deepening and evolving need for data . Member of DBA team responsible for both on-prem and cloud-based environments. Interact with development staff in all areas of database design and operation.
RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS:
Manage all aspects of data administration to ensure databases are highly secure, available, recoverable, and performant.
Perform routine, day-to-day database administrator duties in data replication, SQL tuning, application tuning, creation of database objects, and data modeling.
Participate on committee that sets database standards.
Consults with users to identify current database requirements and clarify objectives.
Review documented processes and procedures.
Maintain confidentiality of information processed.
Participate in on-call rotation for production database support.
ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS FOR SENIOR DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR:
Make technical recommendations and implement policies and standards relating to the architectural design of databases, network communications, data access and security requirements, and backup and recovery procedures for production and development databases.
Create and refresh non-production databases.
Monitor and manage data growth and size requirements.
Plan, develop, test, and tune databases.
Assist and mentor development staff in data modeling, SQL tuning, application tuning, and creation of database objects.
Install third-party applications for testing and implementation in production.
Develop and maintain operational programs to monitor database conditions and activities.
Identify application and/or SQL performance problems and assist in their resolution.
Analyze, review, and alter database parameters and structure to increase operating efficiency or adapt to new requirements.
Consults with users to identify current database requirements and clarify objectives.
Document current, revised, and new processes and procedures.
Perform prototyping and database tuning and optimizing.
Stay up to date with advances in information technology by reading manuals, trade periodicals, and technical reports relating to SQL Server databases.
Provide technical assistance to other Information Services personnel.
Work with minimum supervision and exercise sufficient discretion and independent judgment.
Mentors peers and IT personnel.
Manage relationship with Microsoft and Oracle Support.
Analyze and plan for future database, server, storage, and network requirements.
Gather database statistics for trend analysis.
Research and plan implementation of new database features and enhancements.
Design database growth management strategies.
Design data backup and recovery strategy including usage of standby databases for Business Resumption Plan.
Produce periodic reports for management and staff.
This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.
EMPLOYMENT QUALIFICATIONS:
EDUCATION:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or related field required. Certification or progress toward certification of, industry-recognized professional designation in Oracle or SQL preferred and encouraged. Combinations of relevant education and experience may be considered in lieu of a degree. Continuous learning, as defined by the Company's learning philosophy, is required. SQL Server required, Oracle experience and Certifications preferred.
EXPERIENCE:
Five years experience within an IT environment which provides the necessary skills, knowledge and abilities. Three years relevant experience with SQL Server databases or maintaining a production data warehouse environment preferred. Experience within the insurance industry preferred.
SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES (SKA) REQUIRED:
Ability to troubleshoot client/server problems.
Ability and proficiency in the use of computers and company standard software specific to position.
General understanding of database administration.
Strong knowledge of SQL Server database management tools.
Strong knowledge of Always On Availability Groups
Strong knowledge of Data Warehouse Architecture and SQL Server operational best practices.
Basic knowledge of SQL commands.
Foundational knowledge of Oracle running on Linux.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Ability to apply the principles of logical thinking to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to comprehend the consequences of various problem situations and to make sound decisions or to refer problems to appropriate people for decision making.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet necessary deadlines.
Ability to work varying hours, including evenings, weekends and holidays as required.
Ability to perform other assignments at locations outside the office.
ADDITIONAL SKAs REQUIRED FOR SENIOR DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR:
Ability to work closely with Database engineers to implement standards, policies and procedures developed.
Ability to document and develop standard operating procedures for day to day activities.
Ability to make technical recommendations. Demonstrated high level of competency in SQL Server database administration.
Thorough knowledge of and ability to use SQL Server database utilities and management tools.
Thorough knowledge of SQL and PowerShell programming.
Solid understanding of cloud-based data management options and industry trends.
Ability to establish work flows, manage multiple projects, and meet necessary deadlines.
Advanced knowledge of communication layer between client, network and SQL Server databases.
Advanced knowledge of and demonstrated competency in all facets of SQL Server database administration.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
Work is performed mainly in an office environment with minimal hazards. May be exposed to temperatures, which may be cooler than a normal office setting. Travel may be required.
The qualifications listed above are intended to represent the minimum education, experience, skills, knowledge and ability levels associated with performing the duties and responsibilities contained in this job description.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity is valued and we will not tolerate discrimination or harassment in any form. Candidates for the position stated above are hired on an "at will" basis. Nothing herein is intended to create a contract.

Immuta is the universal cloud data access control platform, enabling data teams to automate data access control on any cloud, using any data platform, at scale. With Immuta, organizations can finally unlock the full value of their data – even the most sensitive data – while improving productivity, reducing time to data, maintaining strong security, and enabling new data sharing use cases.
Since our founding in 2015, Immuta has now become the leader in cloud data access control. That comes by applying our expertise in engineering, security, ethics, and law. But, more importantly, it requires a relentless focus on our customers’ needs. Immuta’s customers understand that data is the most critical asset for innovation. Secure, democratized, self-service access to cloud-based data is an imperative to accelerate business intelligence, data science, and data sharing outcomes.
 Immuta has been recognized by Forbes as a top American startup employer, by Inc. Magazine as one of the best workplaces, and by Fast Company as one of the top 50 most innovative companies Customers include Aon, Credit Suisse, Daimler, S&P Global, U.S. Army, and Atlassian. Over half of the top banks now use ImmutaPartners include Databricks, Snowflake, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and Starburst$169 million in total venture capital funding. Investors include Greenspring Associates, March Capital, Ten Eleven Ventures, Intel Capital Corporation, NGP Capital, DFJ Growth, Dell Technologies Capital, Citi Ventures, Inc, Wipro Ventures, and Okta VenturesMajor offices in Boston, Massachusetts; Columbus, Ohio; and, College Park, Maryland
TAKE YOUR IMPACT TO THE NEXT LEVEL:
We are looking for an Engineering Manager to lead the product engineering squad responsible for building many of our integrations with various cloud databases. We want you to help us continue to bring the best in security and privacy to our customers. As an engineering manager at Immuta, you will be responsible for recruiting, coaching, and leading a team of bright, mission-focused engineers, while still writing quality code.
YOU'RE THE BEST PERSON FOR THIS ROLE IF YOU ENJOY:
Building and running a top-notch engineering team. You have recruited, coached, and led junior and senior engineers. You empathize and actively listen first, fostering a warm, inclusive, “humble-intellect” culture.
Data. You love databases and want to stay current on all the new features available in various cloud databases.
Programming. Our engineering managers are technical. We’re looking for candidates that still want to spend at least some of their time hands on writing code.
A company that really cares about their employees. Immuta invests significantly in you and your well-being with 100% employer-paid health, dental, and vision, mental health, Unlimited PTO, and more.
YOU'LL BE A GREAT ADDITION TO THE TEAM IF YOU HAVE:
Experience leading a software engineering team or a senior engineer looking for that next career challengeProven track record of delivering performant, scalable products in a continuous delivery environmentExperience with a modern technology stack (our stack: Node.js, Typescript/Javascript/SQL/ODBC/C, Docker/Kubernetes, numerous SQL databases)Strong technical background that allows you to advocate for and support your engineersStrong desire to understand the details of systems, get hands-on with data analysis and root cause analysisAbility to hold yourself, and direct reports accountable for resultsAbility to maintain high standards for hiring employees, culture, and quality
Benefits
At Immuta, our goal is to help bridge the gap between personal and professional growth, so that our team members can be well and thrive personally and professionally. After all, great professional success stories rarely happen without great personal success stories! Our generous benefits package includes:
100% employer paid Healthcare (Medical, Dental, Vision) premiums and deductibles for you and your dependents (including Domestic Partners)100% employer paid mental wellness platform for you and your dependentsStock OptionsWellness perks (100% employer paid Whoop fitness band and subscription)Paid parental leave (Both Maternity and Paternity)Unlimited Paid time offLearning and Development Resources

Company Overview
Plexium is a pharmaceutical company focused on developing first-in-class therapeutics by targeting and modulating E3 ligases. Our propriety DELPhe platform enables us to disrupt and redefine high-throughput screening through the use of miniaturization. We are leveraging our DELPhe platform to develop novel small molecule modulators of E3 ligases to uncover new therapeutic biology.

Position Summary
This position is for innovative people who geek out over data and have fun creating new systems. The Database Manager designs, builds and oversees the deployment and operation of technology architecture, solutions and software to capture, manage, store and utilize structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources
Essential Job Responsibilities
Lead initiatives to design and build data storage/data lakes, APIs, information dashboards, and other end-user information portals or resources
Design and develop databases for capture and retrieval of complex data and metadata
Develop technical tools and programming that leverage artificial intelligence, machine learning and big-data techniques to cleanse, organize and transform data and to maintain, defend and update data structures and integrity on an automated basis
Develop capability to integrate public database query outputs into Plexium informatics workflows
Create and establishes design standards and assurance processes for software, systems and applications development
Source and manage interactions with software service providers to meet data user needs
Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Informatics, computer science, or a related scientific field
8 years’ experience in the use and design of cloud-based information systems
Skills/Knowledge
Ability to develop and deploy cloud platforms
Expertise working with big data (omics) using EMR, SPARK, JavaScript, Python/R technologies
Expert knowledge working within AWS infrastructure such as Athena, Glue Studio and Data glue
Proficient in DevOps, CI/CD, and test-driven development
Ability to work in an agile and rapid changing environment with high quality deliverables and is considered a subject matter expert in the technical area of expertise
Excellent oral and written communications skills, business acumen with problem solving and analytical skills

Experience minimum 7 years
Overall 5+ years of IT experience with a minimum of 5 years in creating Data visualization BI dashboards and good working experience in MS Power BI for creating Dashboards by connecting to the Data source (OnPrem/Cloud)
Excellent analytical thinking for translating data into informative visuals and reports and able to implement row level security on data and have an understanding of application security layer models in Power BI
Proficient in making DAX Queries in Power BI desktop with strong quantitative knowledge and attention to detail.
Expertise in using advance level calculations on the data set and able to develop tabular and multidimensional models that are compatible with warehouse standards
Experience in developing, publishing and scheduling Power BI reports as per the business requirements and knowledge in designing and developing ETL SSIS
Strong knowledge in RDBMS

Product Manager, USADeliver data and Artificial Intelligence (AI) products that power the development of next-generation materials and chemicals.About Citrine: At Citrine, we’re changing the way new materials are developed.We are the industry leader in materials informatics, the application of data-driven methods to materials and chemicals development. Our platform provides data management and AI tools that help our customers rapidly develop better, more sustainable materials. Our users are scientists and engineers at huge manufacturing and materials companies, and researchers at leading universities and government labs. Our platform enables our users to accelerate the development of new materials.In 2020 Citrine was recognized for technology innovation by the Global CleanTech Group and was named one of the most promising AI startups by CB Insights. As a team, we are ambitious with our goals, passionate about our vision, and eager to grow and learn from each other. Our team is growing fast and looking for the best to join us.Though our technology was originally built by materials scientists, our team now consists of professionals trained in a diverse set of fields, including data science, physics, biology, and computer science. We have clusters of remote employees in the San Francisco Bay Area, Chicago, Pittsburgh, Boston and Raleigh-Durham areas and our customers include Fortune 100 materials and product companies.Position Summary: In this role, you will contribute to the mission of delivering the right tools, services, and technology to our customers. You are excited by the opportunity to drive revolutionary change in the materials industry, and comfortable collaborating with materials researchers to distill their objectives, understand their pain points, and appreciate the power of bringing the right workflows and tools to their research. You thrive working autonomously and collectively with smart colleagues and customers who are changing the world.You will drive and define the product strategy, goals, and requirements for our data and visualization platform working with cross-functional teams to execute and deliver on the next phase of Citrine’s AI and Data services. With a focus on the future, the Product Management team works closely with creative engineers, designers, and researchers to develop tools and technologies that grow the field of Materials Informatics. We're responsible for guiding products from concept to execution for some of the world’s leading companies by analyzing, positioning, and tailoring our solutions to the market as it matures.Responsibilities: Deliver services for data visualization/dashboards and work closely with engineering teams to develop and enhance the data platform to enable scientists and enterprise customers’ to analyse their data for better decision making.Analyze and document complex business requirements and processes; construct conceptual data and process models; develop business requirements.Create business and technical documentation to enable internal & partner data integrations.Understand the current market landscape and articulate how your product fits into the ecosystem.Define the strategy, goals, roadmap and requirements of your product and execute the product vision for Citrine’s users.Work cross-functionally with data scientists, engineers, researchers, design, and other internal stakeholders to identify and implement customer workflows and scalable solutions.Manage product expectations, roadmap, dependencies, metrics, and releases while iterating and prototyping to test hypotheses with customers.Skills & Qualifications: 5+ years of experience as Product Manager.Proficiency with data visualization techniques and their respective applications in designing to solve analytical- and workflow-related tasks.Experience with data analysis and building the right visualization for users to make decisions, strong user research skills needed.30-60-90 day goals: will own the Data APIs and visualization of plots we expose through the UIWorking technical background, including knowledge of databases, BI, front-end, back-end, web, and mobile apps.Experience driving backend service capability for solving user-focused problems.Excellent oral and written communication skills with the purpose of bringing clarity to complexity and communicating to inform and influence across cross-functional teams and leadership.Demonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals and evolve product strategy based on research, data, and industry trends.Ability to manage and lead across highly cross-functional teams.Excited to be innovative in a fast-paced, highly technical environment. Experience with Agile Scrum and Lean methodologies.Background in research and user experience is a plus.Experience in the materials or chemical development or manufacturing industries is a plus.Benefits:Work from home opportunitiesFlexible working hoursEducation reimbursement13th Month Pay/End of Year BonusStock optionsAdditional holidaysProfit sharing/share optionsCompany phoneJob Type: Full-timePay: $130,000.00 - $160,000.00 per yearWork Remotely:Yes

Oracle Utilities Cloud Database Administrator
Responsibilities:
The Oracle DBA is responsible for providing technical expertise in the analysis, design, implementation, and maintenance of an existing high-volume, data intensive system. Position requires critical thinking and problem-solving abilities to address complex issues involving performance analysis, data migration, information life cycle management, multi tenancy for applications designed for very large databases.
Candidate must be able to support large enterprise initiatives and help resolve architectural issues in the environment and database infrastructure, as well as develop and maintain an in-depth understanding of the database architecture and the application functionality.
Additional responsibilities may include database design and implementation for multiple products; supporting multiple lab environments; installing, maintaining, and refreshing Oracle database for development and test environments; analyzing performance issues and providing recommendation based on testing results; proactively diagnosing and resolving problems affecting database; maintaining database configurations in compliance with release management and change management; participates in special projects and performs additional duties as required.
The candidate will work with a cross-section of organizations, including other DBAs, systems engineers, developers and the management team. The candidate is expected to work on shifts for ensuring 24*7 availability for the SaaS solutions.
The candidate will work with a world class team to provide enterprise-wide, Oracle Database Administration support for production systems and provide DBA services to application development teams, including database design, database generation, coding, and database production support. Provide DBA support with a high degree of customer service, technical expertise, and timeliness. Provide accurate and creative solutions to user problems of moderate nature to ensure user productivity.
 REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Strong knowledge of Oracle 10g /11g/12c internals, from performance troubleshooting from SQL to ASM.
Strong Database Administration and SQL skills
Operating system knowledge (Unix, Linux and/or Windows)
Daily administration activities such as Datapump Export/Import, Database migration/cloning, RMAN, Data Guard replication, backup/restore, patching, maintenance, upgrades, storage layout and access control should be second nature
Hands on experience with OEM 13c, AWR, ASH, SQL Tuning Advisor, SQL Plan Baselines.
Extensive knowledge of high availability database concepts.
Proficient with automation of maintenance tasks using PL/SQL and scripting tools such as shell script, Perl or Python
Superior troubleshooting skills, battle-tested in high-volume production environments including Grid Control Administration
Hands on experience on RAC, Data Guard and multitenant database
Maintenance and support for VLDB databases
Schema design and access control for multi-tenancy databases.
The following technical skills are plus:
Hands on Experience with Golden Gate
Oracle Certified Professional (OCP)
Hands on experience with VPD, Data Vault, TDE, Audit Vault is a plus
Operations support as well as Cloud operation experience
Additional experience with Oracleâ€™s Exadata engineered systems is preferred
Personal Competencies:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent customer focus and issue handling skills
Strong analytical reasoning and problem solving skills
Strong focus on diagnosing and resolving complex technical problems
Strong teamwork skills and ability to work as member of a global team
Results oriented
Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Work with a world-class team to provide enterprise-wide, Oracle Database Administration support for all products using Oracle Utilities Application Framework and provide DBA services to SaaS development and production environments.
Own database architecture and design for Oracle Utilities Framework products and help resolve complex technical issues.
Provide product development support. This includes creating primary database storage structures, designing and creating primary objects, modifying database structure as necessary for enhancements or performance, creating/maintaining documentation and standards, establishing application development best practices, monitor and optimize performance of the database, plan for backup and recovery of the database, and allocate system storage and plan future storage needs.
Design /develop / maintain database upgrade procedures/tools. This comprises creating/maintaining database-related scripts and programs to upgrade database portion of the Oracle Utility products and the scripts for database support of the development environments.
Research, evaluate, design, test, recommend, and plan implementation of new or improved RDBMS, ETL and database tools.
Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. It requires 10 years of experience supporting relational databases as an Oracle DBA. Exposure and practice at using the DBMS to optimize performance of large production databases for enterprise use is preferred. Experience with an organization with a key 24 X 7 reliance on its database is desirable. Requires a bachelorâ€™s degree in computer science or equivalent field.


Work with a world class team to provide enterprise-wide, Oracle Database Administration support for production systems and provide DBA services to application development teams, including database design, database generation, coding, and database production support. Provide DBA support with a high degree of customer service, technical expertise, and timeliness. Provide accurate and creative solutions to user problems of moderate nature to ensure user productivity.


As a Senior Database Administrator, you are instrumental in researching, evaluating, designing, testing, recommending, and planning implementation of new versions of Oracle database and database tools. May act as a team lead during database implementations and for system operation and maintenance.


Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. 8 years of experience supporting relational databases as a DBA, with multiple distributed relational DBSM's or a depth and focus in Oracle and related tools. Success at using the DBMS to optimize performance of large databases for enterprise use is greatly preferred. Experience with an organization with a key 24 X 7 reliance on its database is desirable. BS or equivalent desired.

Job summary

Would you like to build and lead a Specialized Sales team focused on accelerating adoption of AWS Database Services? Do you have the business savvy, technical background, and sales leadership skills necessary to help position Amazon as the cloud provider of choice for these workloads? AWS is seeking a seasoned Specialized Sales Manager to help us maintain our leadership position as the preferred cloud platform for database. The role has a specific focus on AWS services such as Amazon Aurora, Amazon RDS, Amazon Document DB, and Amazon ElasticCache Service just to name a few of our database services. The Specialized Sales Team is critical to driving deeper workload specialization in alignment with our Account Managers with a goal to build a unified and cohesive community of delighted database customers powering their business with AWS.

The leader of this team will be in charge of hiring and developing a Specialized Sales Team within the United States focused on SMB and Startup accounts. They will be an integral part of the leadership team and a key member of the worldwide database organization. The ideal candidate will have experience with cloud-related activities such as data center migrations, database management systems, infrastructure optimization/modernization and earning customer trust by helping to create a long-term strategy with the customer as part of their AWS partnership. They will be a self-starter, and be willing to operate both tactically and strategically. As a key team member in this fast growing, exciting space, this leader will have the opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of a service category with significant impact on our customers’ business.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Key job responsibilities
Responsibilities include building and managing a sales team focused on driving revenue, adoption, and market penetration in a large territory. The ideal candidate will possess a sales background with a strong track record of performance and customer obsession to lead a team of remote senior Specialized Sellers with engagements at the CxO level, manage a regional sales pipeline and lead sales efforts. They will engage with our internal sales, solutions architects, partners, and professional services organizations to drive large and highly complex opportunities to closure. They will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product and technical challenges with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions while working cross-organizationally to build consensus.

A day in the life
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Experience Selling to Startups and Small/Medium Business

Company Overview
Plexium is a pharmaceutical company focused on developing first-in-class therapeutics by targeting and modulating E3 ligases. Our propriety DELPhe platform enables us to disrupt and redefine high-throughput screening through the use of miniaturization. We are leveraging our DELPhe platform to develop novel small molecule modulators of E3 ligases to uncover new therapeutic biology.

Position Summary
This position is for innovative people who geek out over data and have fun creating new systems. The Database Manager designs, builds and oversees the deployment and operation of technology architecture, solutions and software to capture, manage, store and utilize structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources
Essential Job Responsibilities
Lead initiatives to design and build data storage/data lakes, APIs, information dashboards, and other end-user information portals or resources
Design and develop databases for capture and retrieval of complex data and metadata
Develop technical tools and programming that leverage artificial intelligence, machine learning and big-data techniques to cleanse, organize and transform data and to maintain, defend and update data structures and integrity on an automated basis
Develop capability to integrate public database query outputs into Plexium informatics workflows
Create and establishes design standards and assurance processes for software, systems and applications development
Source and manage interactions with software service providers to meet data user needs
Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Informatics, computer science, or a related scientific field
8 years’ experience in the use and design of cloud-based information systems
Skills/Knowledge
Ability to develop and deploy cloud platforms
Expertise working with big data (omics) using EMR, SPARK, JavaScript, Python/R technologies
Expert knowledge working within AWS infrastructure such as Athena, Glue Studio and Data glue
Proficient in DevOps, CI/CD, and test-driven development
Ability to work in an agile and rapid changing environment with high quality deliverables and is considered a subject matter expert in the technical area of expertise
Excellent oral and written communications skills, business acumen with problem solving and analytical skills

Be part of something more.
A majority of our time is spent “at work.” We believe that time most meaningful when it’s spent around people who care about you and who challenge you. We hire people who know how to make good decisions, because we won’t be constantly looking over your shoulder—you’ll be empowered to do what’s right for our customers. Most importantly, we’re a partner. We partner with our associates to help them thrive personally and professionally. We partner with our communities and the organizations that support them. And, we partner with our customers to create an experience they won’t find elsewhere.
Are you ready to be part of something more?
You ’ re more than a means to an end — a way to help us meet the bottom line. UMB isn ’ t comprised of workers, but of people who care about their work, one another and their community. Expect more than the status quo. At UMB, you can expect more heart . You ’ ll be valued for exactly who you are and encouraged to support causes you care about. Expect more trust . We want you to do the right thing, no matter what. And, expect more opportunity . UMBers are known for having multiple careers here and having their voices heard.
The Database Systems team plays a critical role in supporting our database platforms which includes Oracle, SQL Server and DB2 Mainframe. The team manages data security and privacy including data integrity, conducts data backup and recovery, tunes database performance, and improves query processing performance. This team is a collection of well-rounded database administrators supporting and maintaining the database environment to ensure high performance to avoid any business disruptions.
As a S enior Database Administrator , you will manage our Oracle, SQL Server and DB2 Mainframe databases. Your collaboration with teammates and other technical team members will allow you to identify and mitigate any potential issues with the data. In turn, this will ensure the integrity of the bank’s data and it is secure.
The Database Systems team is a close-knit group of database professionals with a shared commitment of providing a strong and robust database environment. Trust and open communication are the cornerstones of how we roll, and we have plenty of fun while doing it! Self-education, peer consultation, mentor guidance, and formal training/seminars are some of the methods that we share information and knowledge.
How you’ll spend your time:
Installing, configuring, maintaining and upgrading the applicable database software on the corresponding hardware platforms.
Proactively monitoring databases and its performance, and tuning the databases accordingly to ensure peak performance.
Tending to regular database backups and performing any recovery activities when required.
Conducting database change management.
Interacting with users and technical teams to ensure data integrity and data security.
We’re excited to talk with you if:
You have a Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or related field and at least 4 years of database administration experience, OR at least 7 years of database administration experience.
You have at least 7 years of experience using Oracle (10g/11g/12c) , SQL Server (2008R2/2012/2014/2016) , and/or DB2 Mainframe. It is preferred that you have experience with all three databases, but we will provide training on the database with least experience.
You have solid knowledge of the databases and related tools to support, administer or diagnose the RDBMS.
You have experience with UNIX shell scripting, ssh configurations, and PL/SQL including UNIX commands and architecture for an Oracle database.
You have experience with SQL Profiler and SQL Networking including SSAS, SSIS or SSRS for a SQL Server database.
You have solid experience with z/OS for a DB2 database.
Open to qualified remote candidates.
The pay range for a candidate selected for this position who is based in Colorado is typically $ 69,400 to $ 129,000 annually. The selected candidate’s actual pay will be based on various factors, including but not limited to work location, qualifications, and experience, so the actual starting pay for the selected candidate may be above or below this range. The successful candidate will also be eligible to participate in one or more incentive plans based on company and individual performance.
UMB offers competitive and varied benefits to its associates including Paid Time Off; a 401(k) matching program; annual incentive pay; paid holidays; a comprehensive company sponsored benefit plan including medical, dental, vision, and other insurance coverage; health savings, flexible spending, and dependent care accounts; adoption assistance; an Employee Assistance Program; fitness reimbursement; tuition reimbursement; an associate wellbeing program; an associate emergency fund; and various associate banking benefits.
#LI-REMOTE
UMB and its affiliates are committed to inclusion and diversity and provide employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disability, military service, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. If you need accommodation for any part of the employment process because of a disability, please send an e-mail to talentacquisition@umb.com or call 816-860-7972 to let us know the nature of your request.

Company Overview
Plexium is a pharmaceutical company focused on developing first-in-class therapeutics by targeting and modulating E3 ligases. Our propriety DELPhe platform enables us to disrupt and redefine high-throughput screening through the use of miniaturization. We are leveraging our DELPhe platform to develop novel small molecule modulators of E3 ligases to uncover new therapeutic biology.

Position Summary
This position is for innovative people who geek out over data and have fun creating new systems. The Database Manager designs, builds and oversees the deployment and operation of technology architecture, solutions and software to capture, manage, store and utilize structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources
Essential Job Responsibilities
Lead initiatives to design and build data storage/data lakes, APIs, information dashboards, and other end-user information portals or resources
Design and develop databases for capture and retrieval of complex data and metadata
Develop technical tools and programming that leverage artificial intelligence, machine learning and big-data techniques to cleanse, organize and transform data and to maintain, defend and update data structures and integrity on an automated basis
Develop capability to integrate public database query outputs into Plexium informatics workflows
Create and establishes design standards and assurance processes for software, systems and applications development
Source and manage interactions with software service providers to meet data user needs
Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Informatics, computer science, or a related scientific field
8 years’ experience in the use and design of cloud-based information systems
Skills/Knowledge
Ability to develop and deploy cloud platforms
Expertise working with big data (omics) using EMR, SPARK, JavaScript, Python/R technologies
Expert knowledge working within AWS infrastructure such as Athena, Glue Studio and Data glue
Proficient in DevOps, CI/CD, and test-driven development
Ability to work in an agile and rapid changing environment with high quality deliverables and is considered a subject matter expert in the technical area of expertise
Excellent oral and written communications skills, business acumen with problem solving and analytical skills

SUMMARY
Exercising discretion and independent judgement, directs the business functions related to membership, manages the membership database and coordinates the day to day processing of accounts payables.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

BUSINESS MANAGEMENT

Oversees the membership services department and directly carries out supervisory responsibilities to effectively manage personnel in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; auditing and appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems, without direct oversight and using independent discretion and judgement.
Serves as the Association’s lead for technical support and business questions related to membership. Investigates and determines appropriate course of action or response, without direct oversight and using independent discretion and judgement.
Reviews and recommends best practices related to the accounting and financial segment of membership and programs, without direct oversight and using independent discretion and judgement. May deviate from established policies and procedures without prior approval as needed to facilitate the business functions.
Provides leadership and guidance to the Directors in implementing and maintaining the established best practices. If not followed takes initiative to work in conjunction with the Executive to provide coaching and additional training.
Successfully completes critical aspects of deliverables related to the business functions of membership to include, but not limited to account maintenance, renewals, invoicing, bank drafts and returned payments.
Prioritizes conflicting needs; handles matters expeditiously, proactively and follow through on projects to successful completion, often with deadline pressures.
Manages the administrative responsibilities associated with special initiatives (e.g., military, limited use partners, etc.) and large corporate partnerships.
Attends membership committee meetings to provide input related to the business function of membership.
Collaborates with Directors and Executives and provides recommendations on membership data, reporting, mailing/email lists, membership categories, pricing and incentives.
Provides high quality customer service to members and program participants over the phone and in person. Uses independent discretion and judgement to handle escalated concerns from the public.
Develops and conducts initial and ongoing trainings related to use of the membership software system.

DATABASE MANAGEMENT

Manages the membership database to include performance, security and maintenance.
Troubleshoots issues on behalf of the users.
Monitors the integrity of data entered and takes appropriate action with users to remediate errors.
Develops user, support and technical documentation.
Determine need, develops and conducts trainings related to use of the database.
Provides expert advice and information sharing to other users and management.
Creates, analyzes and provides input on reports that utilize data stored on the database. Cross references and mines data from multiple source documents as needed.
Customizes existing applications in order to make them fit for purpose.
Assumes a lead role in managing the implementation process of enhancements and upgrades to software. Collaborates with users and provides, input, guidance and leadership.

OTHER

Maintains flexibility as workloads change throughout the department and assumes responsibilities to support the ongoing success of the YMCA as a whole.
Develops and maintains procedures for job duties.
Monitors and maintains departmental record systems, files and paperwork.
Receives and protects confidential information.
Receives and carries out instructions.
Maintains regular and predictable attendance. May require evenings/weekends as required to conduct training and/or support the branches.
Performs special projects and other duties as assigned.
Performs other activities and duties as needed that address the ongoing health and well-being of our staff and members, including but not limited to housekeeping, sanitation, etc. throughout all YMCA buildings and program areas.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Ability to read, write, talk, see and hear.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide.
Ability to exhibit initiative, responsibility and flexibility and maintain organization and detail in a changing environment.
Knowledgeable in accounting and financial procedures.
CRM experience
General knowledge and proficient use of a computer and computer programs to include MS Office products.
Ability to perform multiple tasks and handle multiple projects at one time.
Ability to maintain a high level of detail.
Ability to work with all levels of YMCA staff, members and program participants and establish effective working relationships.
Possesses a strong understanding of the YMCA and its purpose, mission and values. Demonstrates this understanding through behavior and actions that support the purpose, mission and values.

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience and/or training.

SUMMARY:
Responsible for implementation and day-to-day maintenance and monitoring of SQL Server, Azure SQL, and Oracle databases supporting AF Group’s critical business processes and continually deepening and evolving need for data . Member of DBA team responsible for both on-prem and cloud-based environments. Interact with development staff in all areas of database design and operation.
RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS:
Manage all aspects of data administration to ensure databases are highly secure, available, recoverable, and performant.
Perform routine, day-to-day database administrator duties in data replication, SQL tuning, application tuning, creation of database objects, and data modeling.
Participate on committee that sets database standards.
Consults with users to identify current database requirements and clarify objectives.
Review documented processes and procedures.
Maintain confidentiality of information processed.
Participate in on-call rotation for production database support.
ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS FOR SENIOR DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR:
Make technical recommendations and implement policies and standards relating to the architectural design of databases, network communications, data access and security requirements, and backup and recovery procedures for production and development databases.
Create and refresh non-production databases.
Monitor and manage data growth and size requirements.
Plan, develop, test, and tune databases.
Assist and mentor development staff in data modeling, SQL tuning, application tuning, and creation of database objects.
Install third-party applications for testing and implementation in production.
Develop and maintain operational programs to monitor database conditions and activities.
Identify application and/or SQL performance problems and assist in their resolution.
Analyze, review, and alter database parameters and structure to increase operating efficiency or adapt to new requirements.
Consults with users to identify current database requirements and clarify objectives.
Document current, revised, and new processes and procedures.
Perform prototyping and database tuning and optimizing.
Stay up to date with advances in information technology by reading manuals, trade periodicals, and technical reports relating to SQL Server databases.
Provide technical assistance to other Information Services personnel.
Work with minimum supervision and exercise sufficient discretion and independent judgment.
Mentors peers and IT personnel.
Manage relationship with Microsoft and Oracle Support.
Analyze and plan for future database, server, storage, and network requirements.
Gather database statistics for trend analysis.
Research and plan implementation of new database features and enhancements.
Design database growth management strategies.
Design data backup and recovery strategy including usage of standby databases for Business Resumption Plan.
Produce periodic reports for management and staff.
This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.
EMPLOYMENT QUALIFICATIONS:
EDUCATION:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or related field required. Certification or progress toward certification of, industry-recognized professional designation in Oracle or SQL preferred and encouraged. Combinations of relevant education and experience may be considered in lieu of a degree. Continuous learning, as defined by the Company's learning philosophy, is required. SQL Server required, Oracle experience and Certifications preferred.
EXPERIENCE:
Five years experience within an IT environment which provides the necessary skills, knowledge and abilities. Three years relevant experience with SQL Server databases or maintaining a production data warehouse environment preferred. Experience within the insurance industry preferred.
SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES (SKA) REQUIRED:
Ability to troubleshoot client/server problems.
Ability and proficiency in the use of computers and company standard software specific to position.
General understanding of database administration.
Strong knowledge of SQL Server database management tools.
Strong knowledge of Always On Availability Groups
Strong knowledge of Data Warehouse Architecture and SQL Server operational best practices.
Basic knowledge of SQL commands.
Foundational knowledge of Oracle running on Linux.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Ability to apply the principles of logical thinking to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to comprehend the consequences of various problem situations and to make sound decisions or to refer problems to appropriate people for decision making.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet necessary deadlines.
Ability to work varying hours, including evenings, weekends and holidays as required.
Ability to perform other assignments at locations outside the office.
ADDITIONAL SKAs REQUIRED FOR SENIOR DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR:
Ability to work closely with Database engineers to implement standards, policies and procedures developed.
Ability to document and develop standard operating procedures for day to day activities.
Ability to make technical recommendations. Demonstrated high level of competency in SQL Server database administration.
Thorough knowledge of and ability to use SQL Server database utilities and management tools.
Thorough knowledge of SQL and PowerShell programming.
Solid understanding of cloud-based data management options and industry trends.
Ability to establish work flows, manage multiple projects, and meet necessary deadlines.
Advanced knowledge of communication layer between client, network and SQL Server databases.
Advanced knowledge of and demonstrated competency in all facets of SQL Server database administration.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
Work is performed mainly in an office environment with minimal hazards. May be exposed to temperatures, which may be cooler than a normal office setting. Travel may be required.
The qualifications listed above are intended to represent the minimum education, experience, skills, knowledge and ability levels associated with performing the duties and responsibilities contained in this job description.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity is valued and we will not tolerate discrimination or harassment in any form. Candidates for the position stated above are hired on an "at will" basis. Nothing herein is intended to create a contract.

Grow your career as a Senior Oracle Database Administrator with an innovative global bank in Tampa, FL. Long-term contract with excellent growth potential. Will start working remotely until offices reopen, then will be required to be onsite 2-3 days per week.
Responsibilities:
Provide application database support to the entire reference data team for its enhancements.

Excellent knowledge with Oracle Golden Gate tool and hands on experience.

Responsible for providing trend analysis to the service management team to enable them to make informed decisions regarding resource management.

Document all technical inquiries, develop and review content for knowledgebase using tool set.

Develop work schedules and project plans in support of various App Dev requests.
Maintain server, software, licenses and other inventories.
Ensure weekend activities complete successfully through assignment, coordination, oversight and validation and Checkout. This may require weekend work.

Engineering graduate.
15+ years of working experience in web development.
Essential Skills: Oracle 11g, 12c, 19c, RHEL, 5 RHEL7, GoldenGate 12.3, 19c, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Sybase, MS SQL Server, AWS, UDeploy, TPAM, CyberArk, Autosys, Shell scripting, PL/SQL, T-SQL

Overview:

Southwest will provide a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share externally with every Southwest Customer.
Responsibilities:

Completes tasks independently / interdependently.

Demonstrates advanced understanding of business processes being supported by assigned system(s).
Demonstrated proficient understanding of business processes across multiple business Customers.

Develop time estimates for project schedules, monitor progress, and provide accurate and timely reports.
Plan and manage project activities within allocated resources.
Manage resolution of problems and escalate as required.
Work across projects to synchronize data analysis efforts and deliverables.
Negotiate and manage team relationships at project level.
Support the organization’s project management policy, practice, and methodology.

Employ productivity aids in all aspects of assignments.
Analyze and resolve complex or multiple problems.
Independently research and recommends alternative actions for problem resolution.

Implement complex changes to existing databases.
Provide Leadership for installation and configuration of new database engines and upgrades to new product releases.
Implement physical data models at a project, or corporate level.
Create, document, and administer, and document database backup and recovery plans, capacity plans and security plans to meet project requirements.
Testing / Deliverable Quality:
Plan tests for new products and database engine releases to ensure features and functions are acceptable and integrated across systems software and platforms.
Production Support:
Analyze and resolve highly complex problems.
Recommend database and system management tools as required.
Proactively investigate / troubleshoot database, technical and systems problems and direct / assure corrective action.
Work with application teams to recommend process or system enhancements.
Provide general technical support to Services and Development groups.
24X7 duty required for on-call rotation.

Develop volume and cost estimates.
Must be able to meet any physical ability requirements listed on this description.
May perform other job duties as directed by Employee’s Leaders.

Minimum 2 years experience as a technical or team lead required.

Advanced knowledge of physical database design, capacity planning, security planning, backup and recovery systems, operating systems, data modeling, query language, multiple database engines, performance and testing, and software development concepts and technology.

OVERVIEW:
KS2 Technologies, Inc. is looking to aggressively grow our JD Edwards Practice and is hiring a full-time Oracle/SQL Database Administrator (DBA) consultant as a result. The DBA Consultant role at KS2 Technologies is responsible for technical design, administration, implementation, upgrade and managed services of Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle 2008 and newer. You will also be expected to refine and automate regular processes, track issues and document changes. In addition to the DBA tasks, the DBA consultant will support KS2 initiatives as it relates to ERP JD Edwards applications, interfaces, service oriented architecture (SOA), cloud and web based portals for customers. The ideal candidate will be able to meet directly with clients (Via Zoom during COVID). They will need to have the ability to provide technical analysis, make the appropriate recommendations, communicate thoroughly and execute timely for each project.
RESPONSIBILITIES OF ORACLE/SQL DBA:
Maintain backups and recovery of databases
Develop, design, implement and debug stored procedures, triggers, and indexing
Implement High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery plans
Optimize database performance and ensures availability
Clone, recover and migrate databases
Execute and maintain maintenance plans & index statistics
Maintain database security
Provide technical support to include proactive and reactive incident resolution
Review system logs to identify signs of potential problems
Write, execute and peer review SQL, T-SQL and PL/SQL scripts and functions
Perform database upgrades
Perform performance tuning and optimization using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
Administer third-party applications that require Oracle AND MS SQL server support as needed
SSIS package development, deployment, monitoring and troubleshooting
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES FOR DBA:
Experience with MSSQL Server 2008 or newer
Experience working with scripting tools (Powershell, OS-Level scripts, Java-Scripts)
Experience with Oracle Databases 11g or newer
Working experience using JD Edwards EnterpriseOne application on MSSQL and Oracle database is a plus
Infrastructure / server management in public / private clouds utilizing AWS, Oracle or Azure
Experience monitoring database performance
Experience as a Consultant in a Professional Services organization
Be a highly motivated individual and multitask oriented
Effective in person, phone, and written communication skills
Excellent documentation and organizational skills
Ability to work in a team environment while achieving personal production goals
Excellent problem-solving skills.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE FOR ORACLE/SQL DBA:
5+ years as MS SQL Server DBA with 5+ years as Oracle DBA (must have both)
Certified Oracle DBA
ADDITIONAL EXPERIENCE AND CONSIDERATIONS FOR ORACLE/SQL DBA:
Linux platform experience desired but not required
Ability to manage technical projects
Core value fit:
Better Together - Together, we work hard, collaborate constantly, lift one another up, and challenge each other to do our best work.
People Matter - We love computers, but people are our biggest source of success.
Take the High Road - Trust, integrity, respect and accountability in all relationships.
H3 Hungry, humble, hustle
Good is Not Good Enough We aspire to be the very best
No sponsorship / must be US citizen
No H1B Visas
Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment
COMPENSATION:
KS2 Technologies compensates our JD Edwards DBA consultants with a competitive base salary, a quarterly bonus plan, and a benefits package that includes a health care plan, dental, 401k with match, PTO and paid holidays. We recognize top performers with elevated bonus and growth opportunities. We are a highly collaborative team that enjoys working together that performs well and celebrates our successes.
REQUIRED EDUCATION:
Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent work experience
TRAVEL REQUIRED:
Up to 15% domestic travel may be required to work (to Client specific locations).
Great team work, family atmosphere, and a values-driven culture can be expected when joining our team. We are looking for that special individual that understands what it takes to be successful in our industry and is looking for a great team to call "home" for the long-term.
KS2 Technologies, based in Grapevine, TX, is an industry leader in IBM and Oracle Software Consulting Services and Product Licensing / Resell. KS2 is an IBM Gold Business Partner and Oracle Platinum Partner. In business for over 20 years, KS2 has been passionate about delivering world-class service and value to our clients for IBM Hardware / Infrastructure, Oracle JD Edwards ERP systems, and IBM Cloud and Middleware products (Cast Iron, DataPower, MQ, IIB, Bluemix, etc). KS2's Consulting Service Engagement Models and client portfolio enables placement of consultants locally and nationally - depending on our client and project needs.

WAWA - Wawa, Inc. - Corporate Office
Job Description
Job Summary :
The Sr. Database Administrator will manage, escalate and resolve complex production and design issues related to RDBMS, NOSQL, and other database technologies both on site and in cloud based implementations. Support existing database implementations and lead/participate in the design and implementation of new data architecture in pursuit of security, reliability, availability, and performance based upon business requirements. Lead in the database implementation portion of projects, providing strategic vision, managing technical and business resources to ensure results conform to quality and time stipulations, and maintaining appropriate relationship with customers, business partners and other business associates.
Principal Duties:
Collaborate with the IT Engineering team and act as technical participant in the design, development, testing, implementation and support of multiple strategic database technologies.
Ability to apply ITPS Security standards and practices as well as adhere to these standards in the development and design of new and existing technologies within our corporate and store infrastructure.
Provide production support as necessary in the deployment of application upgrades and patches, and by acting as part of the Release Management process.
Participate in research around database related technology products and make recommendations based on business or operational requirements. Anticipate potential problematic situations/risks and address them with effective responses.
Administer, support, and maintain data infrastructure components. Troubleshoot high-level problems and document procedures to guide resolution process.
Facilitate issue resolution between internal ITPS teams and external IT business partners.
Analyze and define database configuration, hardware, software and associated utilities.
Integrate enterprise-wide tools for automating, monitoring and managing the current and future technology environments.
Establish a performance baseline. Monitor database performance and tune for peak performance.
Develop, document, implement, and maintain database management strategies, policies and procedures, including security, support, training, and installation procedures.
Maintain a significant degree of decision making regarding data related privileges and responsibilities.
Work with internal and external business clients to plan new databases and the database enhancements necessary to address expanding business needs.
Develop project plans to install, upgrade, and manage database management software.
Recommend, design, implement, and support database integration into business solutions, while meeting the business goals and objectives. This includes supporting documentation and diagrams detailing the specific infrastructure.
Lead and/ or participate in Information Technology related projects. Drive all projects enlisting technical resources where necessary. Provide project management, technical assistance and strategic vision for our technical infrastructure services.
Ensure the use of configuration management tools to prevent temporary or undocumented configuration changes. Participates in change control process as required.
Provide support vendors with documented procedures and training material as well as safety standards in order to provide superior support services. This includes the management of our support vendors in many situations.
Deliver inventory and asset management of appropriate infrastructure. Meet and establish working relationships with field engineers and account managers in order to establish clear communication paths. Provide leadership and continuous improvement of standards to enable a more customer focused, responsive department.
Develop production support models designed to enhance response times and maintain high availability of all production infrastructure components and systems.
Identify and implement improvements to technology to proactively manage support.
Evaluate the technical activities of Associates to ensure that each activity provides value in the context of database technologies. Examine and re-engineer these activities and related business processes in order to facilitate reporting and meet established business requirements/guidelines. Make appropriate cost saving recommendations to achieve the financial strategic plan.
Perform audits as required to ensure PCI compliance.
Essential Functions:
Ability to work well individually as well as in a team environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical Associates.
Excellent customer service skills
Ability to work with little or no supervision
Detail oriented and excellent organizational, time and stress management skills.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and independently
Excellent interpersonal skills
Proven self-starter with demonstrated ability to make decisions
Excellent leadership and vendor management skills
Have the ability to provide support outside of normal business hours, which may constitute a significant amount of time
Proven ability to learn quickly and independently train themselves on existing and new technologies and technology platforms
Offers technical expertise, feedback or advice as a valuable resource to others
When prioritizing work, considers the bigger picture, ensuring alignment with department objectives.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or a technical discipline (e.g., engineering) preferred
10+ years of related work experience
Ability to achieve certifications in multiple appropriate strategic technologies.
MSSQL administration
MySQL administration
Oracle DBMS administration
Vertica administration
Exposure to infrastructure design, implementation and support
Minimum of three years’ experience operating and managing in a large-scale Windows/Linux environment.
Knowledge of architecture and taxonomy of RDBMS, NOSQL, and other database technologies
Exposure to appropriate support and database management solutions.
MSSQL administration
MySQL administration
Oracle DBMS administration
Vertica administration
MongoDB administration
Linux O/S
Windows O/S
T-SQL
PowerShell
Knowledge of Security Technologies and standards (PCI)
Knowledge of standard support frameworks (e.g., ITIL)

Job Brief

Primary Sr. Database Administrator - SQL (Tier 3)

Position Description

Datavail helps customers manage their data and maximize IT efficiency through application of our deep expertise in databases, analytics, and applications. We are North America’s largest data integration and database administration company with more than 900 employees on payroll and core operations in four countries. Founded in 2007, Datavail is based in Broomfield, Colorado and supports mid-market and enterprise clients headquartered in North America. For more information, visit www.datavail.com.

Title: Primary Sr. Database Administrator - SQL (Tier 3)

Location: Anywhere in the US. Remote.

Datavail is looking for a Senior SQL Server Database Administrator. Our company provides 24 X 7 support for our customer’s mission critical database systems, which is possible through our proven model of Primary Tier 3 DBAs in the U.S. and our Tier 3 and Tier 2 teams in India. This model allows our DBAs to provide superior service to our customers, without compromising work and life balance. We are looking for a Primary Senior SQL DBA with very strong SQL Server experience in production environments and database consulting experience. The Primary Senior SQL DBA will lead our service team as the primary technical contact in interacting with our customers. The Primary Senior SQL DBA must be able to lead database service for a client – which means advising on both the reactive activities needed to maintain availability, security, and performance, but also the proactive items like architecture design, DR strategies, backup management, performance and capacity management, and helping our clients to minimize their database costs. This position would be an exciting opportunity for the DBA who has the right experience to grow their career and expand their knowledge and be part of one of the biggest SQL Server support team in North America supporting multiple clients utilizing the latest cutting edge technologies and IP automation.

Applicants must have the following experience in order to be considered for this position:

Mandatory SQL Server DBA Skills:

12+ years overall IT experience, with 5+ years on SQL Server 2000, 2005, 2008 and 2008 R2, 2012, 2014, 2016, 2017 and 2019
Experienced in supporting SQL Server IaaS and PaaS on AWS and Azure Clouds.
Well versed in database performance tuning, especially SQL tuning
Worked in clustered SQL Server environments
Supported SQL Server on Linux both migrations and on-going support.
Experienced in setting up SQL Server Log Shipping, Replication and Mirroring
SQL Server Always On Availability Groups
Skilled in backups & disaster recovery
24 X 7 production support experience
Knowledge of Windows Server 2003R2 and later editions
Working knowledge in T-SQL, BCP, DTS and SSIS development
AWS Certified Solutions Architect Associate or Microsoft Certified Azure Administrator

Experience in the following other areas is required:

Worked in Managed Service Providers or supported multiple customers
Has supported large enterprises with over 100 SQL Server instances
Is able to direct others' work
Is able to coordinate between Datavail's DBA team and directly with the customer
Can converse with executive levels of management and user base
Communicates clearly and pointedly

This position is for full-time employment with full medical benefits and may require up to 10% US travel.

Company Overview
Plexium is a pharmaceutical company focused on developing first-in-class therapeutics by targeting and modulating E3 ligases. Our propriety DELPhe platform enables us to disrupt and redefine high-throughput screening through the use of miniaturization. We are leveraging our DELPhe platform to develop novel small molecule modulators of E3 ligases to uncover new therapeutic biology.

Position Summary
This position is for innovative people who geek out over data and have fun creating new systems. The Database Manager designs, builds and oversees the deployment and operation of technology architecture, solutions and software to capture, manage, store and utilize structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources
Essential Job Responsibilities
Lead initiatives to design and build data storage/data lakes, APIs, information dashboards, and other end-user information portals or resources
Design and develop databases for capture and retrieval of complex data and metadata
Develop technical tools and programming that leverage artificial intelligence, machine learning and big-data techniques to cleanse, organize and transform data and to maintain, defend and update data structures and integrity on an automated basis
Develop capability to integrate public database query outputs into Plexium informatics workflows
Create and establishes design standards and assurance processes for software, systems and applications development
Source and manage interactions with software service providers to meet data user needs
Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Informatics, computer science, or a related scientific field
8 years’ experience in the use and design of cloud-based information systems
Skills/Knowledge
Ability to develop and deploy cloud platforms
Expertise working with big data (omics) using EMR, SPARK, JavaScript, Python/R technologies
Expert knowledge working within AWS infrastructure such as Athena, Glue Studio and Data glue
Proficient in DevOps, CI/CD, and test-driven development
Ability to work in an agile and rapid changing environment with high quality deliverables and is considered a subject matter expert in the technical area of expertise
Excellent oral and written communications skills, business acumen with problem solving and analytical skills

Department

IU NETWORK SCIENCES INSTITUTE (UA-IUNI-IUBLA)

Department Information

The mission of the Indiana University Network Science Institute (IUNI) is to promote research and development of the foundational aspects of network science such as theories, methods, analytic tools, and to strengthen the practice of network science, and to foster collaborative, interdisciplinary network science approaches to understanding and improving the complex challenges of our world.
Job Summary

Provides experienced design, development, and implementation of databases with an emphasis on performance, security, and stability; determines technical feasibility and design solutions related to hardware and software requirements; conducts related planning, programming, data modeling, data flow diagramming, structural design, and testing.
Delivers and reports on data through the development of stored procedures, triggers, functions, and views; creates database queries, indexes, and writes data load scripts; designs, tunes, and indexes data tables.
Troubleshoots issues and develops normalized database solutions; reviews monitoring tools and query execution plans to maintain or increase query efficiency; performs root cause analysis on query performance issues.
Creates and maintains documentation for all database development projects and/or activities.
Researches and stays current with database development trends and best practices; recommends database standards, policies, and procedures.
Qualifications

EDUCATION
Required
Bachelor's degree (preferably in computer science, information systems, or a related field).
WORK EXPERIENCE
Required
2 years of database planning, design, development or related experience.
Combinations of related education and experience may be considered.
SKILLS
Required
Proficient communication skills.
Maintains a high degree of professionalism.
Demonstrated time management and priority setting skills.
Demonstrates a high commitment to quality.
Possesses flexibility to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment.
Seeks to acquire knowledge in area of specialty.
Highly thorough and dependable.
Demonstrates a high level of accuracy, even under pressure.
Preferred
Knowledge of at least one scripting language such as Python or R.
Experience with SQL and RDBMS administration, especially PostgreSQL.
Experience with NoSQL database principals.
Experience developing ETL pipelines and data documentation.
Experience reading and developing data management policy documents.
Knowledge of Linux system administration or experience working in a Linux environment.
Able to interpret user requests and perform data extraction.
Experience with distributed computing in Spark and distributed database systems.
Positive attitude and problem solving mindset.
Working Conditions / Demands

This role requires the ability to effectively communicate and to operate a computer and other standard office productivity equipment. The position involves sedentary work as well as periods of time moving around an office environment and the campus. The person in this role must be able to perform the essential functions with or without an accommodation.

Work Location

Bloomington, Indiana

FLSA: Exempt

Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology? A roll-up-your-sleeves SQL Database Administrator who wants be part of a collaborative environment? A leader who can incorporate new ideas in a think-tank and share new ideas with your colleagues? If so, consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center - we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center.

Work you'll do/Responsibilities


The SQL team does end to end care of a large-scale enterprise MS SQL Servers
Help the application teams and developers with requests for anything from new users/roles to standing up an entire new clustered instances that is fully compliant with security standards.
Actively support our internal IT teams as well as our government clients performing regular maintenance/patching for a wide variety of MS SQL server deployment.
Work with several on prem and cloud MS SQL Servers that we support.


The Team


Our Government & Public Sector Systems Engineering team delivers large-scale software applications and integrated systems, and assists clients with architecture design, assessment and optimization, and definition. We develop service-oriented architecture (SOA) and other integration solutions to enable information sharing and management between business partners and disparate processes and systems, and we deliver technology enablement to support CIO services transformation.


Government & Public Sector Systems Engineering professionals focus on key client issues that impact the core business by maximizing operational value, driving down the cost of quality, and enhancing technology innovation. Our teams deliver a wide range of services, including application architecture design and optimization, application modernization, business process management and solution integration, custom application design and development, and large-scale technology delivery program efforts.

Must have an Active Top-Secret Clearance or completed and SSBI background check
6+years of SQL database administration and troubleshooting
6+ years of SQL database Migration
Patching with clustering and standalone SQL instances
SQL Audit Logs, STIG standards
Experience with large-scale enterprise MS SQL Server
Travel up to 20% annually (While 20% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)
Prefer to have a Security+ Certification
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available
Travel up to 10% annually
