NatureServe seeks a highly collaborative spatial data manager to coordinate aggregation and delivery of standardized observation data to users by among our institutional partners.*JOB SUMMARY: *The Spatial Data Manager supports NatureServe’s strategic goal of expanding our holdings of ready-to-use, decision quality biodiversity data by assembling spatial observation data from the Network and a wider set of partners. Using state-of-the art GIS applications, the Spatial Data Manager collaborates with scientists from federal resource management agencies, NatureServe member programs, and NatureServe staff to standardize existing species observation data and facilitate data transfer among the parties. They apply emerging tools to automate the transformation of observation data to delineate sites (“Element Occurrences”) that contribute to the long-term survival of the species. The Spatial Data Manager also supports the assembly and delivery of observation and Element Occurrence data to our partners and clients via web maps, feature services, and via NatureServe’s Explorer Pro platform.*DUTIES: *Work with federal clients (initially the Bureau of Land Management) to identify priority data sets, match their data fields to NatureServe’s Biodiversity Observation Data Standard, and apply Esri GIS tools (e.g., Simple Data Loader, Survey123, ArcGIS Dashboard) to standardize their existing observation data and serve it via ArcGIS Online.Support NatureServe member programs to apply emerging GIS tools to collect and transform observation data to create Element Occurrences.Manage client and partner relationships in the data standardization process by coordinating and effectively communicating with federal client technical leads, Network member program scientists and data managers.Assemble and manage aggregated observation data from multiple jurisdictions using Esri ArcGIS tools.Fulfill client data requests for Biodiversity Location Data from NatureServe’s aggregated data holdings sourced from both Network and other sources.Support enhancements to NatureServe databases and software tools as needed.*REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS: *Degree in the field of biological science, environmental science, natural resource management, information systems, geography, or related field.5 years of experience managing biological data and databases.Intermediate GIS skills including proficiency in ArcGIS Online, ArcGIS Pro/Desktop, and field data collection apps such as Survey 123.Relational database experience and ability to write optimized SQL queries.In-depth knowledge of geodatabases and database management technologies.Experience developing and managing metadata.Experience working closely with partners to aggregate, manage and distribute spatial observation data.Keen organizational skills.Skilled in working alongside project team members and with external partners in a highly collaborative environment.Ability to deal perceptively and communicate effectively (verbal and written) with a diverse array of people and institutions – from technical to non-technical.Demonstrated flexibility, self-awareness, professional integrity, and cultural competence - including commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion.Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.Willingness and ability to travel occasionally.Commitment to the conservation of biodiversity and a genuine desire to make a lasting impact.*PREFERRED SKILLS: *Experience working with NatureServe Network member programs and knowledge of NatureServe Natural Heritage Methodology.Familiarity with observation data collection and management standards including NatureServe’s Biodiversity Observation Data Standard and Darwin Core.Experience working with U.S. federal agencies on conservation assessment or resource management issues.Experience using NatureServe’s Biotics software.Experience with data modeling and database designExperience with a scripting language such as R or Python*ESSENTIAL PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: *Ability to converse verbally and in writing with staff and partners.Ability to maintain a full-time position.Ability to travel unassisted.Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus such as: preparing reports and figures; viewing a computer terminal.*ABOUT NATURESERVE: *For nearly 50 years, NatureServe has been the authoritative source for biodiversity data throughout the Western Hemisphere. With an international network of nearly 100 natural heritage programs across the United States, Canada, and Latin America, NatureServe is the leading source of information on rare and endangered species and threatened ecosystems. To protect threatened biodiversity, NatureServe works with over 1,000 conservation scientists to collect, aggregate, and standardize biodiversity statistics, providing comprehensive data to the public for strategic conservation efforts. NatureServe and NatureServe network programs develop and manage the most comprehensive data for over 100,000 species and ecosystems, answering fundamental questions about what exists, where it is found, and how it is doing. NatureServe has an expansive botanical library in its Arlington, VA office and access to online botanical literature to support our work.NatureServe offers full-time employees a comprehensive benefits package that includes:401K savings and retirement plan with matching contributionsHealth and dental insuranceShort and long-term disabilityAnnual and sick leaveLife insuranceTelework/Flex work*NATURESERVE IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER*m/f/vet/disabilityAn equal opportunity, reasonable accommodations employer, NatureServe complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. OVERVIEW:
KS2 Technologies, Inc. is looking to aggressively grow our JD Edwards Practice and is hiring a full-time Oracle/SQL Database Administrator (DBA) consultant as a result. The DBA Consultant role at KS2 Technologies is responsible for technical design, administration, implementation, upgrade and managed services of Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle 2008 and newer. You will also be expected to refine and automate regular processes, track issues and document changes. In addition to the DBA tasks, the DBA consultant will support KS2 initiatives as it relates to ERP JD Edwards applications, interfaces, service oriented architecture (SOA), cloud and web based portals for customers. The ideal candidate will be able to meet directly with clients (Via Zoom during COVID). They will need to have the ability to provide technical analysis, make the appropriate recommendations, communicate thoroughly and execute timely for each project.
RESPONSIBILITIES OF ORACLE/SQL DBA:
Maintain backups and recovery of databases
Develop, design, implement and debug stored procedures, triggers, and indexing
Implement High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery plans
Optimize database performance and ensures availability
Clone, recover and migrate databases
Execute and maintain maintenance plans & index statistics
Maintain database security
Provide technical support to include proactive and reactive incident resolution
Review system logs to identify signs of potential problems
Write, execute and peer review SQL, T-SQL and PL/SQL scripts and functions
Perform database upgrades
Perform performance tuning and optimization using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
Administer third-party applications that require Oracle AND MS SQL server support as needed
SSIS package development, deployment, monitoring and troubleshooting
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES FOR DBA:
Experience with MSSQL Server 2008 or newer
Experience working with scripting tools (Powershell, OS-Level scripts, Java-Scripts)
Experience with Oracle Databases 11g or newer
Working experience using JD Edwards EnterpriseOne application on MSSQL and Oracle database is a plus
Infrastructure / server management in public / private clouds utilizing AWS, Oracle or Azure
Experience monitoring database performance
Experience as a Consultant in a Professional Services organization
Be a highly motivated individual and multitask oriented
Effective in person, phone, and written communication skills
Excellent documentation and organizational skills
Ability to work in a team environment while achieving personal production goals
Excellent problem-solving skills.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE FOR ORACLE/SQL DBA:
5+ years as MS SQL Server DBA with 5+ years as Oracle DBA (must have both)
Certified Oracle DBA
ADDITIONAL EXPERIENCE AND CONSIDERATIONS FOR ORACLE/SQL DBA:
Linux platform experience desired but not required
Ability to manage technical projects
Core value fit:
Better Together - Together, we work hard, collaborate constantly, lift one another up, and challenge each other to do our best work.
People Matter - We love computers, but people are our biggest source of success.
Take the High Road - Trust, integrity, respect and accountability in all relationships.
H3 Hungry, humble, hustle
Good is Not Good Enough We aspire to be the very best
No sponsorship / must be US citizen
No H1B Visas
Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment
COMPENSATION:
KS2 Technologies compensates our JD Edwards DBA consultants with a competitive base salary, a quarterly bonus plan, and a benefits package that includes a health care plan, dental, 401k with match, PTO and paid holidays. We recognize top performers with elevated bonus and growth opportunities. We are a highly collaborative team that enjoys working together that performs well and celebrates our successes.
REQUIRED EDUCATION:
Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent work experience
TRAVEL REQUIRED:
Up to 15% domestic travel may be required to work (to Client specific locations).
Great team work, family atmosphere, and a values-driven culture can be expected when joining our team. We are looking for that special individual that understands what it takes to be successful in our industry and is looking for a great team to call "home" for the long-term.
KS2 Technologies, based in Grapevine, TX, is an industry leader in IBM and Oracle Software Consulting Services and Product Licensing / Resell. KS2 is an IBM Gold Business Partner and Oracle Platinum Partner. In business for over 20 years, KS2 has been passionate about delivering world-class service and value to our clients for IBM Hardware / Infrastructure, Oracle JD Edwards ERP systems, and IBM Cloud and Middleware products (Cast Iron, DataPower, MQ, IIB, Bluemix, etc). KS2's Consulting Service Engagement Models and client portfolio enables placement of consultants locally and nationally - depending on our client and project needs.

Position Summary
This position is for innovative people who geek out over data and have fun creating new systems. The Database Manager designs, builds and oversees the deployment and operation of technology architecture, solutions and software to capture, manage, store and utilize structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources
Essential Job Responsibilities
Lead initiatives to design and build data storage/data lakes, APIs, information dashboards, and other end-user information portals or resources
Design and develop databases for capture and retrieval of complex data and metadata
Develop technical tools and programming that leverage artificial intelligence, machine learning and big-data techniques to cleanse, organize and transform data and to maintain, defend and update data structures and integrity on an automated basis
Develop capability to integrate public database query outputs into Plexium informatics workflows
Create and establishes design standards and assurance processes for software, systems and applications development
Source and manage interactions with software service providers to meet data user needs
Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Informatics, computer science, or a related scientific field
8 years’ experience in the use and design of cloud-based information systems
Skills/Knowledge
Ability to develop and deploy cloud platforms
Expertise working with big data (omics) using EMR, SPARK, JavaScript, Python/R technologies
Expert knowledge working within AWS infrastructure such as Athena, Glue Studio and Data glue
Proficient in DevOps, CI/CD, and test-driven development
Ability to work in an agile and rapid changing environment with high quality deliverables and is considered a subject matter expert in the technical area of expertise
Excellent oral and written communications skills, business acumen with problem solving and analytical skills

Overview
Intuit is seeking a Senior Manager of Analytics to manage a small team of business data analysts. We have an exciting opportunity to help shape how we use data and technology to reach our customers across multiple touchpoints. This role will partner closely with data scientists, marketers, and product managers, and will balance individual contribution with direct management of a small team.
What you'll bring
7-10 years of experience working in marketing, web, product, or other related analytics fields.
3-5 years of experience managing data analysts with a proven track record of developing successful analysts.
Highly proficient in SQL, Tableau, and Excel.
Experience in modeling or business application/evaluation of machine learning.
Experience in a scripting language preferred but not necessary.
Ability to tell stories with data, educate effectively, and instill confidence, motivating stakeholders to act on recommendations.
Excellent problem-solving skills and end to end quantitative thinking.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet objectives and deadlines.
Outstanding communications skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues.
Strong organizational skills, time management, portfolio prioritization experience, and accountability required.
How you will lead
Provides guidance and support leadership to Business leaders and stakeholders on how best to harness available data in support of critical business needs and goals
Leads the full cycle of iterative big data exploration, including hypothesis formulation, algorithm development, data cleansing, testing, insight generation/visualization, and action planning
Uses considerable expertise and independent judgment in collaborating with peers, data engineers, database managers, and business analysts in designing and implementing the research strategy needed to methodically and iteratively structure, extract, cleanse, sample, test, validate, and communicate data-driven insights from complex sources and significant volumes of data for complex and unique business problems
Applies proven methods and hacking skills in working with divergent data types, data scales, and big data (petabytes), to explore and extrapolate data-driven insights using advanced, predictive statistical modeling and testing applied to data acquired and cleansed from a range of sources (relational and non-relational NoSQL databases)
Provides to business stakeholders the entrepreneurial guidance essential for appropriately interpreting and building on findings, and fully exploiting the insights revealed through the research

Overview:

Abile Group has an exciting and challenging opportunity for a Database Administrator supporting an Intelligence Community Customer. We have an IMMEDIATE NEED for a Database Administrator to provide SQL and PostgreSQL support to Agile DevOps software development and to IT mission critical systems. The DBA will perform database administrator tasks including monitoring user access and security, monitoring performance and managing parameters to provide fast responses to front-end users, mapping out the conceptual design for a planned database, refining the logical design, installing and testing new versions, and refining the physical design to meet system storage requirements and conduct capacity planning.

Act as the SME and provide best practice recommendations for SQL and PostgreSQL
Provide SQL infrastructure engineering to include database architecture maintenance, database upgrades, server configurations, and application configurations.
Install, configure, and manage multiple SQL server environments with high availability and disaster recovery, to include monitoring, analysis, reporting, and data warehouse services and solutions
Architect and design the configuration and operation of SQL platforms on all environments.
Ensure proper integration of SQL with applications to include but not limited to SharePoint, Active Directory, etc.
Ensure that storage and archiving procedures are functioning correctly
Work closely with IT Project Managers and Software Developers
Communicate with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security
Commissioning and installing new applications and customizing existing applications
Support on-call activities as needed
Qualifications:

Clearance Required: Top Secret
Degree and Years of Experience:
BS degree and 12 – 15 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 10 – 13 years of prior relevant experience
5+ years of experience administering, patching, performance tuning and securing PostrgeSQL database
Preferred 3+ year administering Microsoft SQL Server
4+ years of AWS RDS management experience
Desired Certifications:
Oracle Database Administrator Certifications a plus
Relevant AWS certification preferred
Required Skills:
Experience with scripting using Ansible, Python or similar dynamic languages
Must have excellent communications and documentation skills
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to effectively troubleshoot, resolve, or escalate problems
Experience in Federal Grants Management is a plus
About Abile Group, Inc.:

Abile Group, Inc. was formed in July 2004 to partner with the Intelligence Community and their Contractors in the areas of Enterprise Analytics & Performance Management, IT & Systems Engineering and Program & Project Management. We have significant experience with the Federal Government and are an EDWOSB dedicated to our employees and clients. We are looking for high performing employees who enjoy providing advice and guidance along with solutions development and implementation support, crafted by combining industry best practices with the clients’ subject matter experience and Abile’s breadth of expertise.

Database Engineer


Spathe Systems is a rapidly growing, Defense Contractor headquartered in Tampa, FL with satellite offices in Fayetteville, NC. As a fast, reliable, agile, and responsive services and solutions company, Spathe Systems enables operations by capitalizing on our diverse experiences within the Defense, Commercial and Academic Industries, delivering Innovative, Interoperable Technologies and leveraging strategic alliances with industry partners. Our niche spans C5I Systems Support, Workforce Modernization, and Mission Support. As a small business with a tight nit family feel, Spathe empowers its employees to solve problems and make decisions, while supporting and elevating the workforce with the responsibility and accountability to be successful.


Spathe is currently searching for a Database Engineer to join our team in the Tampa, FL area in support of the United States Special Operations Command (USSOCOM) Mission!


Clearance: Ability to attain Secret Security Clearance (Must be US Citizen)


Job Description:

Spathe is looking for an experienced, dedicated, and personable Database Engineer to join our team in Tampa FL! In this position you will support the USSOCOM Mobile DevSecOps training team. You will travel to various Theater Special Operations Command (TSOC) and Component locations, both CONUS and OCONUS, as part of a team to directly train USSOCOM resources in modern software development, Cloud, and DevSecOps principles. When not traveling, you will refine and support USSOCOM HQ Software Development, Cloud, and DevSecOps standards. In addition to evangelizing these changes within USSOCOM you will support Greenfield software development of new applications to support USSOCOM mission needs including but not limited to Azure, & AWS environments utilizing Docker Containers on a Kubernetes orchestrated PaaS. Design, develop, and deliver data solutions including database design, relational/non-relational modeling, and prototyping. Develop and document of data standards, design, and development of test plans. Execute testing and data solution debugging as well as implementation of a solution that follows efficient design techniques and development that meets and exceeds the solutions.


Job Duties/Responsibilities:

Provide support for the cross-functional Mobile DevSecOps team to ensure operations meet technical standards and deliver on productivity and quality goals. Helping customers architect scalable, highly available application solutions that leverage cloud services
Lead design and modeling of various USSOCOM applications
Provide Database design training in support of USSOCOM Mobile DevSecOps team
Build conceptual and logical data models for stakeholders and management
Train and develop existing USSOCOM resources in modern database management and microservices architecture
Utilize Agile software development and DevSecOps techniques
Experience with implementing DevSecOps practices such as infrastructure as code, continuous integration, and automated deployment
Creating repeatable patterns for deployments
Facilitating collaboration between application owners and cloud engineers
Respond to USSOCOM team needs in a timely fashion

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related analytical field or equivalent experience is preferred
Demonstrated technical leadership experience (direct supervisory experience preferred)
Have a passion for agile and DevSecOps methodologies.
Strong experience with Postgresql and MongoDB and/or other open source database technologies
Experience with data migration to cloud based environment
Experienced in sourcing, maintaining, and updating data
5 years of experience supporting multi-tier web applications.
3 years of experience handling workloads in large-scale environments.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working exclusively designing and implementing cloud native workloads
Experience with version control systems (Git, Perforce, SVN, TFS/VSTS/Azure DevOps).
Demonstrable experience of microservices architecture, container technology and K8s based PaaS solutions (OpenShift, PKS, etc.) – Desired requirement

Document all technical inquiries, develop and review content for knowledgebase using tool set.
Work directly with other team members to resolve problems in a timely manner.

Qualifications:
Engineering graduate.
15+ years of working experience in web development.
Essential Skills: Oracle 11g, 12c, 19c, RHEL, 5 RHEL7, GoldenGate 12.3, 19c, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Sybase, MS SQL Server, AWS, UDeploy, TPAM, CyberArk, Autosys, Shell scripting, PL/SQL, T-SQL

Experience with CyberArk, UDeploy, Autosys, SNOW is a plus.
Experience with NO SQL DB is a plus.
Able to make changes to the existing data model (logical & physical), implement changes, build deployment packages and promote them to higher environments (UAT, Production and Cob) following SDLC.
Excellent understanding on database concepts including procedures, triggers, packages, database constraints, indexes using Oracle 11g, 12c, 19c.
Able to help in finding current issues and provide solutions to improve performance.
Working knowledge of Linux RedHat, File System, Cluster Management and Oracle ASMC and ACFS.
System analysis and design skill with knowledge of data flow diagrams, data dictionary techniques, case tools, Entity relation Modeling, design Technique, etc.
Database design skill including normalization theory, STAR Schema Design and Data Modeling tool with proven experience of process, data flow and forward/reverse engineering of logical/physical RDBMS layout.
Change control management skills using Source Control System.
Experience of working in a team that delivers a high availability service.
Experience with Oracle Golden Gate 12c/19c implementation and support will be an added advantage.
Familiarity with project management tools and /or software packages.
Demonstrated leadership in completing individual tasks and a team player
Good working knowledge of networking.
Prefer experience working within an Enterprise IT Support environment.
Financial industry experience.

The SQL team does end to end care of a large-scale enterprise MS SQL Servers
Help the application teams and developers with requests for anything from new users/roles to standing up an entire new clustered instances that is fully compliant with security standards.
Actively support our internal IT teams as well as our government clients performing regular maintenance/patching for a wide variety of MS SQL server deployment.
Work with several on prem and cloud MS SQL Servers that we support.


The Team


Our Government & Public Sector Systems Engineering team delivers large-scale software applications and integrated systems, and assists clients with architecture design, assessment and optimization, and definition. We develop service-oriented architecture (SOA) and other integration solutions to enable information sharing and management between business partners and disparate processes and systems, and we deliver technology enablement to support CIO services transformation.


Government & Public Sector Systems Engineering professionals focus on key client issues that impact the core business by maximizing operational value, driving down the cost of quality, and enhancing technology innovation. Our teams deliver a wide range of services, including application architecture design and optimization, application modernization, business process management and solution integration, custom application design and development, and large-scale technology delivery program efforts.


Required Qualifications


Bachelors degree or equivalent years of experience
Must have an Active Top-Secret Clearance or completed and SSBI background check
6+years of SQL database administration and troubleshooting
6+ years of SQL database Migration
Patching with clustering and standalone SQL instances
SQL Audit Logs, STIG standards
Experience with large-scale enterprise MS SQL Server
Travel up to 20% annually (While 20% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)
Prefer to have a Security+ Certification
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available
Travel up to 10% annually

Our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. We're transforming the workplace experience through the power of transparency. As the worldwide leader in employer branding and insights, our vision is for a world where transparency empowers the workforce and motivates companies to become better employers.

Please note this role is open to remote hiring. Our main office locations are in San Francisco, CA, Chicago, IL, Uniontown, OH and London, Eng.

About the Role

As a Lead Database Administrator, you'll play a key role in developing our technology base and helping the company move forward to a more current technology stack. You'll be responsible for all aspects of database administration for our production and development database environments that support nearly 70+ million unique users a month (and growing). We currently have multiple production OLTP databases, a data warehouse and a half dozen staging and QA database servers.

Our DBA team focuses on creating, configuring and maintaining SQL Server and Postgres databases. In addition, they own our DR and HA strategies, and play an important part in setting the technology trends and standards we will be building upon in the future.

In this role you will work with a small, collaborative team of engineers and product managers – so good social and interpersonal skills are also a requirement. Most importantly, we're looking for an individual who can prioritize, multi-task, and deliver high-quality solutions.

Compensation: $144,000.00 - $180,000.00
At Glassdoor, operating transparently is at the heart of everything we do. That's why we let job seekers know that salary ranges may differ for jobs depending on where these positions are filled. It's no secret that the cost of living and other economic considerations vary widely across the country and the world.

At Glassdoor we apply a "tier" system to promote consistency in level of compensation for where roles are filled in different locations. The tiers are as follows:

Tier 1 encompasses the highest salary range for states where large metropolitan areas are located (ie: San Francisco, New York City, Washington DC, & etc)
Tier 2 encompasses salary ranges 15% less than those in Tier 1 for states with mid-sized cities (ie: Chicago, Dallas, Portland, etc)
Tier 3 encompasses salary ranges 20% less than those in Tier 1 for states with smaller
cities (including our Ohio office, Nevada, etc)

You can learn more about our compensation philosophy here and see salary ranges for all Glassdoor jobs here.
What You'll Do

As one of a team of 4, you'll need to be a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment – which means wearing many hats, being able to change direction quickly, and showing an eagerness to learn new technologies as the needs arise. You love to tackle problems and take independent action, seek out new responsibilities, act on opportunities, and generate new ideas

What You'll Bring
7+ years SQL Server Database Administration
Currently working with SQL Server 2019 with AlwaysOn Availability Groups in high volume, high availability production database systems
Production experience with Postgres
Experience with Cassandra and MongoDB a huge plus
Extensive knowledge of AWS - EC2 and RDS are required
Experience with both Windows and Linux administration highly desired
Experienced at troubleshooting performance issues related to CPU, memory, I/O, disk space and other types of resource contention
Expertise in disaster recovery and high availability for SQL Server and Postgres
Knowledge of partitioning strategies and having worked with very large tables
Experience with PowerShell and/or other scripting languages highly preferred
A strong desire and ability to add to our culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion
Why Glassdoor?
100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage, with 80% dependent coverage.
Equity Incentives in our parent company's ADR (Recruit Holdings, Stock ID: 6098T).
Annual 10% bonus aligning with bi-annual performance reviews.
401(k) Plan with a Company Match to prepare for your future.
Generous paid holidays and open paid time off.
Our Commitments
Transparency: We are open and honest. We share information – the good and the bad – so we can continuously learn, collaborate and make the right decisions. Pay bands, our compensation philosophy, and employee feedback survey responses are shared publicly.
Innovation: We actively pursue new and different ways to further Glassdoor's mission. We forge our own path by challenging the status quo. The ultimate goal is not just to change how we operate at Glassdoor, but for every employer to follow our lead!
Good People: We work together with integrity, respect and compassion for one another. We have fun together! We are inclusive, fair and humble while remaining confident. We do the right thing, period.
GRIT: We are resilient, inventive and fearless. We see challenges as opportunities. With passion and courage, we come together to get the job done.
Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: We are dedicated to building a company that is more diverse and representative of society at large. Glassdoor externally publishes our Diversity & Inclusion report and information about our employee population to hold ourselves accountable to our dedication. We also provide programs and resources to build a greater sense of belonging for our employees.

Grow your career as a Senior Oracle Database Administrator with an innovative global bank in Tampa, FL. Long-term contract with excellent growth potential. Will start working remotely until offices reopen, then will be required to be onsite 2-3 days per week.
Responsibilities:
Provide application database support to the entire reference data team for its enhancements.
Responsible for ensuring availability and performance tuning of the databases that support the system.
Excellent knowledge with Oracle Golden Gate tool and hands on experience.
Work with the team to ensure that the associated hardware resources allocated to the databases and to ensure high availability and optimum performance.
Proactively monitor the database systems to ensure secure services with minimum downtime.
Responsible for providing trend analysis to the service management team to enable them to make informed decisions regarding resource management.
Responsible for problem escalation to Oracle Development team and third parties as appropriate.
Responsible for improvement and maintenance of the databases to include rollout and upgrades.
Responsible for implementation and release of database changes as submitted by the development team.
Respond to customer requests regarding outages, performance degradation and project status.
Maintain flexible work schedules, which may include evenings, weekends or holidays to work on deployments or regularly scheduled maintenance.
Resolve customer technical issues through diligent research, reproduction and troubleshooting.
Document all technical inquiries, develop and review content for knowledgebase using tool set.
Work directly with other team members to resolve problems in a timely manner.
Develop work schedules and project plans in support of various App Dev requests.
Maintain server, software, licenses and other inventories.
Ensure weekend activities complete successfully through assignment, coordination, oversight and validation and Checkout. This may require weekend work.
Qualifications:
Engineering graduate.
15+ years of working experience in web development.
Essential Skills: Oracle 11g, 12c, 19c, RHEL, 5 RHEL7, GoldenGate 12.3, 19c, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Sybase, MS SQL Server, AWS, UDeploy, TPAM, CyberArk, Autosys, Shell scripting, PL/SQL, T-SQL
Experience with Oracle RDBMS & Golden Gate 11g/12c/19c on RHEL 7.
Experience with Sybase MS SQL Server, MySQL, PGSQL is a plus.
Experience with CyberArk, UDeploy, Autosys, SNOW is a plus.
Experience with NO SQL DB is a plus.
Able to make changes to the existing data model (logical & physical), implement changes, build deployment packages and promote them to higher environments (UAT, Production and Cob) following SDLC.
Excellent understanding on database concepts including procedures, triggers, packages, database constraints, indexes using Oracle 11g, 12c, 19c.
Able to help in finding current issues and provide solutions to improve performance.
Working knowledge of Linux RedHat, File System, Cluster Management and Oracle ASMC and ACFS.
System analysis and design skill with knowledge of data flow diagrams, data dictionary techniques, case tools, Entity relation Modeling, design Technique, etc.
Database design skill including normalization theory, STAR Schema Design and Data Modeling tool with proven experience of process, data flow and forward/reverse engineering of logical/physical RDBMS layout.
Change control management skills using Source Control System.
Experience of working in a team that delivers a high availability service.
Experience with Oracle Golden Gate 12c/19c implementation and support will be an added advantage.
Familiarity with project management tools and /or software packages.
Demonstrated leadership in completing individual tasks and a team player
Good working knowledge of networking.
Prefer experience working within an Enterprise IT Support environment.
Financial industry experience.
About our client
Our client stands as one of the worlds most renowned global banks and trusted brand with over 200 years of continuously evolving financial services. Its teams provide unique insights to more than 200 million clients and enable progress all over the world. While growing your career, you will work alongside some of the smartest minds in the industry who are excited to share their knowledge and to learn from you.

Journey with us! Combine your career goals and sense of adventure by joining our exciting team of employees. Royal Caribbean Group is pleased to offer a competitive compensation & benefits package, and excellent career development opportunities, each offering unique ways to explore the world.

The Senior Manager, Database Platforms is a technical manager who is responsible for the development and execution of technical goals and strategies within Information Technology for the company's Database Platforms and tools. The Senior Manager Database Platforms will also focus on driving innovation for emerging database technologies - help shape the future of the next generation platform for database services. This role works closely with Enterprise Architecture, Infrastructure, Delivery, Governance, and IT leadership teams to provide operational direction, implementation, and support for IT solutions related to database platforms and tools. He/she will be accountable for driving operational excellence in the overall maintenance of our database platforms and tools, develop database standards, ensure availability, resilience, performance, security, and regulatory compliance. The Senior Manager, Database Platforms will report on project progress and operational metrics to executives and various stakeholders at the enterprise level.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Lead a highly technical team responsible for ensuring the integrity, availability and security of multiple database platforms, data integration tools and cloud infrastructure disciplines, requiring specialized administration support.
Lead recruitment efforts to attract, retain high quality and diverse talent
Collaborate with senior management and other peers for strategy development and execution planning
Lead our journey to the cloud and as a service model for database platforms where possible
Develop project and funding proposals for programs that provide continuous delivery of cost-effective Database Platform and Application administration solutions that meet business requirements.
Develop and track staffing plans and ensures the team is adequately staffed with skilled professionals.
Define roadmaps and use cases directly with business and technology leaders to modernize our database platforms (IBMi, MS SQL, Oracle, MySQL); NoSQL (Couchbase), Ne04j including big data management and capability stack which include data movement, high availability, disaster recovery, security, compliance, analytics, and artificial intelligence.
Lead the Database Platform and Application Administration team for delivering, installing, and providing 24/7 global operational support, reliability, performance and continuous improvement for database platform and application administration.
Define, optimize, and implement procedures and policies, as well as organizational activities and initiatives
Performs other duties as required. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to perform any other job-related duties assigned by their supervisor or management

FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage labor and non-labor budgets of $4M USD or more
Develop business case and cost/benefit analysis for Database Platform & Applications Administration capital requests, support operations spending and initiatives.
Responsible for defining optimization opportunities to manage expenses
Solid understanding of IT estimation activities. May lead large/complex estimation activities

QUALIFICATIONS:
A minimum of 10 years relevant Database Platform experience or in a related area
Bachelor's degree (Master's degree preferred) in Computer Sciences, Computer Engineering, or Information Systems, or equivalent experience
Demonstrates extensive knowledge and capabilities across a variety of database platforms and tools

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Technical experience and subject matter expert with various Database Platforms, emerging database platforms, packaged Enterprise Resource Planning systems, operating systems, storage options, networking, and security. Familiar with tools to manage these various environments.
Strong background in sourcing, implementing, and managing Managed Services, vendor relationships and contracts.
Strong leadership skills; proven experience in leading and developing technical professionals and influencing leaders
Remain current with industry best practices, trends, innovation, and emerging technologies in database platforms and tools in the marketplace
Capable of making independent decisions that impact IT and/or business strategy
Build a high-performant on-shore/off-shore database delivery team to ensure 24/7 database coverage.
Experience with Agile/Dev Ops methodologies and tools
Experience with any Cloud (AWS, Azure, Oracle) database platform offerings and solutions
Subject matter expertise with database high availability solutions such as cluster, replication, standby
Strong knowledge of project management principles and disciplines; highly proficient in a few areas including governance, financial and benefits realization, business case development etc.
Demonstrates strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Effective verbal, presentation, written and listening communications skills
Accepts accountability and manages execution of individual and team results at corporate and divisional level

Specific requirements that are essential parts of the job should be described clearly and precisely below. Examples: lifting, standing for extended periods of time, hearing, carrying, moving, pulling/pushing, climbing etc.

Job Details
Description
Akerman LLP, a top 100 U.S. law firm serving clients across the Americas, is seeking a SQL Database Administrator for its National Information Technology Department. The location for this position is flexible.

QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

Strong command of MS SQL and MS SQL server tools
Advanced knowledge of database security, backup and recovery, and performance monitoring standards
Strong command of SSAS, SSIS, SSRS
Strong experience with MS SQL Server licensing and SQL Server architecture
Extensive knowledge of various clustering strategies (CrossBox and Always on Availability Groups.
Extensive knowledge of Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery in relation to high availability and failover for SQL server clusters
Experience with troubleshooting, good technical writing, documentation and application installation and configuration experience are also desired.
Experience with report development

OVERALL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Manage extensive SQL Server environment
Configure and maintain database servers and processes
Ensure high levels of performance, availability, sustainability and security
Analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time
Provide suggestions for solutions
Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes
Assist developers with query tuning and schema refinement
Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems
Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Demonstrate excellent multi-tasking abilities, setting priorities and meeting deadlines.
Ability to work independently and as a team member.
S/he must treat all office matters with strict confidence.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum of 5 years of experience managing a large SQL environment
Experience in a law firm environment a plus
Experience with cloud services a plus

We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package. Please submit your resume, cover letter and salary requirements. EOE

OVERVIEW:
KS2 Technologies, Inc. is looking to aggressively grow our JD Edwards Practice and is hiring a full-time Oracle/SQL Database Administrator (DBA) consultant as a result. The DBA Consultant role at KS2 Technologies is responsible for technical design, administration, implementation, upgrade and managed services of Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle 2008 and newer. You will also be expected to refine and automate regular processes, track issues and document changes. In addition to the DBA tasks, the DBA consultant will support KS2 initiatives as it relates to ERP JD Edwards applications, interfaces, service oriented architecture (SOA), cloud and web based portals for customers. The ideal candidate will be able to meet directly with clients (Via Zoom during COVID). They will need to have the ability to provide technical analysis, make the appropriate recommendations, communicate thoroughly and execute timely for each project.
RESPONSIBILITIES OF ORACLE/SQL DBA:
Maintain backups and recovery of databases
Develop, design, implement and debug stored procedures, triggers, and indexing
Implement High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery plans
Optimize database performance and ensures availability
Clone, recover and migrate databases
Execute and maintain maintenance plans & index statistics
Maintain database security
Provide technical support to include proactive and reactive incident resolution
Review system logs to identify signs of potential problems
Write, execute and peer review SQL, T-SQL and PL/SQL scripts and functions
Perform database upgrades
Perform performance tuning and optimization using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
Administer third-party applications that require Oracle AND MS SQL server support as needed
SSIS package development, deployment, monitoring and troubleshooting
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES FOR DBA:
Experience with MSSQL Server 2008 or newer
Experience working with scripting tools (Powershell, OS-Level scripts, Java-Scripts)
Experience with Oracle Databases 11g or newer
Working experience using JD Edwards EnterpriseOne application on MSSQL and Oracle database is a plus
Infrastructure / server management in public / private clouds utilizing AWS, Oracle or Azure
Experience monitoring database performance
Experience as a Consultant in a Professional Services organization
Be a highly motivated individual and multitask oriented
Effective in person, phone, and written communication skills
Excellent documentation and organizational skills
Ability to work in a team environment while achieving personal production goals
Excellent problem-solving skills.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE FOR ORACLE/SQL DBA:
5+ years as MS SQL Server DBA with 5+ years as Oracle DBA (must have both)
Certified Oracle DBA
ADDITIONAL EXPERIENCE AND CONSIDERATIONS FOR ORACLE/SQL DBA:
Linux platform experience desired but not required
Ability to manage technical projects
Core value fit:
Better Together - Together, we work hard, collaborate constantly, lift one another up, and challenge each other to do our best work.
People Matter - We love computers, but people are our biggest source of success.
Take the High Road - Trust, integrity, respect and accountability in all relationships.
H3 Hungry, humble, hustle
Good is Not Good Enough We aspire to be the very best
No sponsorship / must be US citizen
No H1B Visas
Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment
COMPENSATION:
KS2 Technologies compensates our JD Edwards DBA consultants with a competitive base salary, a quarterly bonus plan, and a benefits package that includes a health care plan, dental, 401k with match, PTO and paid holidays. We recognize top performers with elevated bonus and growth opportunities. We are a highly collaborative team that enjoys working together that performs well and celebrates our successes.
REQUIRED EDUCATION:
Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent work experience
TRAVEL REQUIRED:
Up to 15% domestic travel may be required to work (to Client specific locations).
Great team work, family atmosphere, and a values-driven culture can be expected when joining our team. We are looking for that special individual that understands what it takes to be successful in our industry and is looking for a great team to call "home" for the long-term.
KS2 Technologies, based in Grapevine, TX, is an industry leader in IBM and Oracle Software Consulting Services and Product Licensing / Resell. KS2 is an IBM Gold Business Partner and Oracle Platinum Partner. In business for over 20 years, KS2 has been passionate about delivering world-class service and value to our clients for IBM Hardware / Infrastructure, Oracle JD Edwards ERP systems, and IBM Cloud and Middleware products (Cast Iron, DataPower, MQ, IIB, Bluemix, etc). KS2's Consulting Service Engagement Models and client portfolio enables placement of consultants locally and nationally - depending on our client and project needs.

Job Title: Database Administrator/ Application Developer
Department: Information Technology
Reports To: IT Manager
POSITION PURPOSE:
Controlling and monitoring user access to the database(s). Monitor and optimize the performance of the database(s). Develop, test, implement, and maintain applications, processes and system enhancements to existing applications. Review, analyze, and recommend industry best practice solutions for systems, infrastructure, and Information Technology processes and lead implementation of recommended solutions to address business needs.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Design, deploy and manage projects and support.
Schema definition of data.
Storage Structure and access method definition.
Granting of authorization for data access.
Planning for backup and recovery of database information.
Maintaining performance and capacity issues.
Maintaining archived data and backing up and restoring databases.
Generating various reports by querying from databases as needed.
Familiar with the software development life cycle (SDLC) from analysis to deployment.
Comply with coding standards and technical design.
Use a systematic approach to develop the system through clear documentation (flowcharts, layouts, & etc) of functionality, addressing USE CASEs through creative solutions.
Prepare technical specifications as well as documentation for software engineering analysis.
Design and develop technical solutions on basis of functional specifications.
Adapt structured coding styles for easy review, testing and maintainability of the code.
Integrate the developed functionality and/or component(s) into new and existing functional systems. Ensure unit and integration level verification plans are in place and adhere to a high quality of code at all times.
Active participation in troubleshooting, debugging and updating the current live systems.
Review software design ideas and present work estimates.
Prepare technical training documents for onboarding new engineers.
Extract pertinent information for designing systems, projecting capabilities, and determining performance interfaces.
Analyze user needs, provide consultation services to discuss design elements, and coordinate software installation. Designing software systems requires professionals to consider mathematical models and scientific analysis to project outcomes.
Recommend industry best practice solutions and to observe and recommend solutions that business needs.
Additional duties and responsibilities as directed.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
High school or equivalent
Knowledge of Power Shell, Git, Microsoft Visual Studio, Microsoft SQL Studio Manager
Experience in the airline industry and communication networks and standards such as APIS, ARINC, EDI, SITA and WSI is a strong plus.
Knowledge of software engineering and Information Technology architecture.
Demonstrate honesty, integrity and respect for others, a willingness to be flexible and open to change. Be willing and able to interface with analysts, designers, other peer developers and users clearly and concisely.
Strong understanding of database structures, theories, principles and practices.
Working technical experience with designing, building, installing, configuring and supporting database servers.
Hands-on database tuning and troubleshooting experience.
Experience with data processing flowcharting techniques.
LANGUAGE SKILLS:
The ability to read, write and understand spoken and written English. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to give verbal and written direction to assigned staff.)
QUALIFICATIONS:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above represent the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.)
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The Company can make reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
The employee will perform duties in a(n) office setting.
ACCOMMODATIONS:
If you need reasonable accommodation for the online application process due to a disability, please call (734) 544-7010. Please include your contact information and details about posted position of interest. Only inquiries regarding assistance for those who need accommodation with the online application process due to a disability will be returned.
**Must be authorized to work in the United States.
